I think it relies entirely too much on the no-longer-innovative climbing mechanic, but there’s simply no denying that this game is a visual masterpiece with likable characters in an interesting and intense story. In short, it’s an Uncharted game, and once again, that can speak for itself.

Uncharted 4 undoubtedly keeps up pace with its predecessors, serving as an excellent ending for the series. A lot of action, incredible adventures, humor, and highest levels of audio and graphics in video games - Uncharted 4 has it all. It's a stellar game.
Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is the most spectacular game you will play this year, the best looking game ever and a worthy end to the adventures of Nathan Drake.

A performance of power. Naughty Dog realizes their profound technical ability, showcases a relationship between gorgeous locales and engaging level design, and executes a progressive yet agile and animated narrative. The viability of Uncharted's action—safe but nimble platforming and brisk cover-based shooting parallel to limitless coincidences and explosions—can feel out of sync with 2016, but A Thief's End is easily the best it has ever been.
An incredible technical achievement but also one of the most cleverly crafted and most cinematic action games ever made.
What I can say, however, is it is the best representation of the Uncharted series we have seen to date, and you’d be doing yourself a disservice if you didn’t experience it firsthand.

Uncharted 4 finishes off the story of Nathan Drake in style. It's one of the best-looking games on PlayStation 4, the environments are huge, and the action set pieces are great. The pacing falters in the middle due to new vehicle sections, but once Uncharted 4 gets going, it's a great ride.

[Multiplayer is] competent, polished (I experienced a few connection problems but chalked them up to pre-launch network jitters), and reasonably entertaining. But it lacks the depth and long-term appeal of shooters that make online play their bread and butter.

We've had a few years with the PS4 now, and while I've cherished games like 'Until Dawn' and 'Bloodborne,' there has been a void when it came to the question of a must-own exclusive. Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is that game. It's not ahead of its time like its series' forebears, but the elements of story, gameplay, and visuals come together like a masterwork. For me, the final product beats the impressive previews. It's not a revolution, but it is Naughty Dog at the top of their game.

There is nothing cheap about how Naughty Dog has decided to retire this franchise — no door is left open for a crass surprise sequel — and there's nothing ambiguous about its resolution. Every other Uncharted game has, to varying degrees, posed a question — "can a thief be good?" — and summarily moved on without wagering a guess. In finding an answer, Uncharted 4's story soars, and presents a moving, fulfilling finale.

A remarkable achievement in blockbuster storytelling and graphical beauty. Though it’s let down by a lack of imagination and some self-indulgence, especially in a third act that drags on far too long, Uncharted 4 carries on the series’ proud tradition of peerless polish and style, with a great multiplayer component to boot. Most importantly, it’s a gentle sendoff to the rag-tag group of characters we’ve known for nine years.

Naughty Dog has done it again, creating a cinematic marvel that sets the bar for the action genre. There are a couple of off moments throughout the story and the multiplayer, while a decent component, lacks the variety other games deliver, but the thirteen hour single player campaign will blow you away. It’s filled with an intriguing mystery, heart-wrenching emotional scenes, incredibly over the top set pieces, and of course the humor fans have come to love from our plucky (now older) hero and his trusty sidekicks.

One of the few PS4 exclusives that lives up to the "Greatness Awaits" slogan. There's a special element to games from Naughty Dog that deliver the type of single player experiences that can stand on their own, offering the perfect blend of story telling, visuals, and gameplay -- everything else I just consider a bonus.

This is a masterful piece of storytelling from Naughty Dog, packed full of wonderful and genuine character moments, great performances from the main cast and no small amount of little references for fans of both the series and developer. As a celebration of what Nathan Drake has given us over the last nine years we couldn’t really have asked for too much more.

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is simply amazing. Naughty Dog has done an incredible job with the last chapter of this epic franchise, creating a deep, emotional and entertaining experience for both the movies and video games addicted. If you have a PlayStation 4, buy this game and live a gorgeous adventure around the world.

With Uncharted 4: A Thief's End, Naughty Dog has delivered another gorgeous, action-packed and memorable epic. Although it's kept from perfection by some pacing issues and a couple of other minor quibbles, it's a jaw-dropping experience that offers a lot of bang for one's buck. As such, it's something that every PlayStation 4 owner, and self-respecting gamer, should play through at least once.
Overall, Uncharted 4 is a good game, but I can't help but be slightly disappointed in it. I wish there were more puzzles in the game, and that the puzzles that are there were more challenging.

The fourth installment is a worthy addition to the series. And yet I'm sorry to say that the gameplay isn't groundbreaking, and it almost seems like Naughty Dog was too cautions and not prepared to take any risks. It frequently feels like the series is relying too much on its own reputation.

Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is different from the others. It eschews the supernatural elements of the previous games in favor of a slower-paced, deeply personal story that’s marred by some pacing issues. However, as usual, this entry pushes Sony’s console to the max. Whether or not A Thief’s End usurps Among Thieves’ position as the best in the series is unclear; however, this is Drake’s best tale.
The fourth installment of Uncharted is exactly what you were waiting for: awesome action sequences, kick-ass graphics, and, finally, a full point in the story of Nathan Drake.

Sony’s premier action adventure series is showing its age from a creative standpoint, if not a technical one. Recognizable story cues and shock attempts have become bromidic, and there are moments that had me rolling my eyes as Uncharted 4 expected me to be startled by twists anticipated from miles away. As cornball as it can be, however, Uncharted 4 remains a damn classy romp with a sensitive side, and fans are undoubtedly going to adore it.
Excellent part four, which maybe repeats most of its previous tricks, but repeats them so well that you will forgive it for doing so. [Issue#254]

It would be easy to dismiss Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End as a jack of all trades and a master of none, and in terms of gameplay, that would be true. Beyond navigating the environments, nothing is truly exemplary and is mostly fine or good.  Thankfully, it’s so much more than that with standard bearing presentation, writing, and acting.
Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is visually stunning, and the best we've seen on console. Naughty Dog have produced a fine farewell to one of PlayStation's most beloved characters.
Uncharted 4 offers nothing profound, assured in its own way that it has nothing to prove.

It’s a good conclusion for the series overall. Sure, it’s a little loose at the start, and tonally it tries hard to be so serious and grown up, but once it gets all that out of its system the Uncharted-ness comes through and we get to take Nate for one last spin, ‘Oh Craps’ and all.

As expected, Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is a spectacular action adventure, with some of the best and most impressive effects in the gaming history. At the same time it’s a little too safe game and we have seen the formula before. Still: the best parts are, as always, jaw-dropping good.

In terms of giving the fans what they want, I’m certain Naughty Dog has nailed every part of the brief that it was given. Uncharted 4 shows a truly masterful eye for detail and is near perfect in mechanical execution. It’s also presented with cinematic brilliance. My issues with the game are less about it in isolation than it as representative to the broader AAA-blockbuster space. I am increasingly uncomfortable with the superficiality of these games, and the way that they work so hard to hide just how passive you are as a participant.
It's a confident, assured, and rather more intelligent game than it first appears, and a strong end to the series.

If I can sum up my experience and thoughts on the game at all, it’s with the above metaphor. Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is an enjoyable romp, but it’s essentially an interactive movie with very little player-choice over what any of that interaction is.

If Uncharted 4 played even half as good as it looked, it would be a masterpiece… but it doesn’t. In fact, for all its splendor and all the obvious care taken towards making it look and sound as good as humanly possible, it makes one cardinal sin that’s impossible to forgive—it’s downright boring to play. There are moments when it’s easy to get swept up the visual opulence and bombast, but then the moments pass, and it’s straight back to snarky comments and auto-climbing up mountainsides...But hey—it sure does look nice, doesn’t it?
Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End feels as inevitable as it does unnecessary.

Naughty Dog delivers once again! The graphics are amazing, the story is almost on TLOU-level in my opinion and the gameplay got even better. It is not perfect but no game will ever be so for me its still 10/10.

From Beginning to end Uncharted 4: A thief's end never seizes to impress, as a fan of the series I can surely say that this is the perfect conclusion the fans were looking for, this time not only being overcome and amazed by the intense action of previous titles but actually feeling like an explorer as the game breaks through set pieces where the action slows down and you're left to explore uncharted 4's rich, beautiful environments from the perfect grass textures, nothing short of realistic lighting effects, all the way down to the audio used for every surface Nate steps on presented in masterful 1080p graphics utilising the playstation 4's maximum. There is no doubt in mind that naughty dog spent ages perfecting this game to make it the masterpiece that it is today. The story itself feels like naughty dog took a pace in the direction of how the last of us was made and that is certainly a good thing. The game not only has numerous treasures and letters for you to collect but also many interactive pieces to remind us of the previous titles sparking major nostalgia in me as many of the fans also probably felt. Without spoiling anything I can say the story is phenomenal from beginning to end, through the 14 hours it took me to finish the game on moderate difficulty I can say I did not come out disappointed but couldn't help feeling the want for more, maybe...uncharted 5....I can dream!
This game is amazing! The first chapters are very cinematic, in which we can see the magnetic story of the game. Then the action starts, and this new concept of open world is just amazing.
Un des meilleurs jeu aux quel j'ai jouer. il mérite amplement sa note qui est excellente.
Damn, Damn, Damn what a game I love it, I love it , I love it. Ppl trying to munipulate the review with fanboy hatred. What a damn, what damn shame, smh.
I have played half of the game and a couple hours of the multiplayer.

I don't usually make a review but the insane envy of fanboys from other platform giving the much acclaimed game a zero is an injustice and idiotic.  So I will give my 10 rating to offset those nincompoops!

This game is amazing. The best Uncharted game in my opinion. The gameplay, the graphics, the physics are just so realistic (as realistic as an Uncharted game can be lol). Nathan Drake is looking super sexy with so many polygons. The motion capture, facial expressions, voice acting are the best I've seen in any game today. The characters look and feel more real than the actors in most movies. It's simply great, nothing more to say about it.
This is the pinnacle of the Uncharted series.  Sublime graphics, great character development, and the best swansong Naughty Dog could give to Drake. The attention to detail is simply astonishing!

Uncharted 4 é realmente o que queriamos ver na nova geração, visualmente não existe nenhum jogo que se equipare a ele nos consoles, comparado com Tomb Raider (pelo estilo de jogo) é brutal a diferença os donos de PS4 não vão nem sentir falta de TR, o jogo está magnifico visualmente, as musicas e sons estão impecáveis, jogabilidade como a de sempre, mas ele destroi mesmo é no enredo que é monstro.
Fantastic Game! best uncharted game by far. The crash bandicoot easter egg is so hype. Picked up the steel book today and it came with a free uncharted shirt (L)

Mais um jogaço da naughty dog. Uncharted 4: A Thief's End vem para encerrar uma saga épica de Drake juntamento com toda sua turma e amigos. A atenção aos detalhes, o refinamento do combate, o aproveitamento de tudo que foi aprendido nos jogos anteriores torna esse o melhor capitulo da serie superando Uncharted 2. E que final.

Naughty Dog delivers again.  I played most of XONE PS4 Wii U games and This is the best game I have ever played on Nextgen Console. Graphics, Gameplay, Controls and everything is the best game ever made.
The best of Uncharted franchise. The graphics are the best of ps4 games. It's a more enjoyable and replayable than previous games. Also, multiplayer is a blast!

This game is even better than I imagined. I had very high expectations for this game, considering that I've been a big fan of each game on the PS3, and heck, even the game on the PSVITA. And yet, this game blew my expectations out of the water. From a technical standpoint, this game is a modern marvel. The graphics are amazing and almost lifelike. Things like hair, foliage, lighting, shadows, and even more and done extremely well. This game is the embodiment of the term "next-gen" and it is, without a doubt, the best looking game on this console generation. The gameplay is everything that you would expect from an Uncharted game, plus more! Now, a lot of people are complaining about how the game is just like any of it's predecessor's gameplay wise, and honestly, it is, but that's not a bad thing. This game is Uncharted, it's not some new IP, and so of course it's going to be like the older games, but there's so much more new stuff added to keep it refreshing. Things such as the hook mechanic, the sliding mechanic, the new stealth system, and more. The AI is also better than ever. In older Uncharted games, when you got spotted, the AI wouldn't stop unless you were dead or they were dead. Once they saw you, they basically fixated on you, even if you were out of their sight. In this game, the AI is much different than that. There's three different "modes" of the AI: passive, neutral, and aggressive. Passive shows up above an enemy when you're out in the open and there's a great chance of them spotting you. Neutral is when they think they've spotted you, but you've obstructed their visual with you and then they go and investigate. And aggressive is when they start shooting at you after spotting you. This adds a much more realistic taste to the game that is done very well. The shooting is as fun as ever as well. They've also added another new mechanic...vehicles. Now, in the game, you can drive cars and boats, which, while it may not seem groundbreaking, is just a nice touch. The game also borrowed a bunch of things from The Last of Us, a game also developed by Naughty Dog in 2013. Things such as the side conversations, and the new hidden things such as documents that you can discover, look at and read. Again, while it may not seem groundbreaking, it's a nice touch. Another cool thing is that, when Nate, Sam, and Sully are having a conversation, if you do anything to stop the conversation (i.e. driving through a waterfall or a shootout) they'll say something like, "wait, what were we talking about" and they'll just pick up the conversation from there. It's that realistic, and the detail is perfect. And the story, oh, the story. It's marvelous! The end of Uncharted 3 kind of left you for a yearning to find out what happened after the seemingly abrupt ending. Well, I don't want to spoil anything, but let's just say, it's great to find out what happened, and the story is anything that you would expect from Uncharted, but even better. It's so much more fleshed out. Anyways, whether you're a big fan of the series, whether this is your first game, or whether you don't even have a PS4, you NEED to pick up this game. The $60 price tag is way worth it in the long run (though, I would recommend playing the first 3 games just so you know most of the characters and what's going on). It's that good. I'm about halfway through the game and I'm loving it. I haven't played much multiplayer (though I did participate in the open-beta) and let's just say that it's not tacked on and is very much fun... : )

you really no they are quicly made accounts just to downvote Uncharted 4 when all of the negative reviewers have not reviewd anything else at all and just recently made their account, or just gave one other rating on a nintendo or xbox game. ie one reviewer reviewed only 2 things, 10/10 for Star fox zero and 0/10 for Uncharted 4. some fanboys are actually giving this masterpiece a zero  lol , haven't seen a game get such a huge amount of 10/10 scores from websites in a very long time , good job noughtydog
I think that the PS One scene and Drake remembering his past (Memories form Uncharted games) are the best easter eggs ever!. Madgascar is amazing and multiplayer is very fun. 10/10
Incredible game in pretty much all aspects; gameplay, story and graphics are perfect. Multiplayer is fun too!

O que posso dizer? Bela jogabilidade, belos gráficos, bela história. è o jogo mais humano que já vi, depois de The Last of Us. Ele merece meu 10/10, pena que é o último jogo da saga e infelizmente não terá outro jogo. Ótimo jogo pra fechar com chave de ouro.

Best graphic I've ever seen in my life.Too many action scenes that you must sit and only watch your monitor.One of the best stories in video games history and a simple but smooth detailed gameplay with huge changes and elements.
Nathan Drake is a brilliant character.
Easily the best game of this generation by far.Bravo naughty dog.Amazing story graphics gameplay set pieces.The second best uncharted only to uncharted 2

these people complaining about micro transactions is ridiculous. Personally this game for me so far (11 chapters in) is playing like a 9.5/10. 10/10 best game eeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeever it so fun to play single player and multiplayer.  It gets 100/10 or 100/100 it's the best ps4 game

Every good thing comes to an end, so as the epic Uncharted 4...Finished the legendary title, which is going to b d undisputed GOTY 2016, few mins ago... And felt it sud be defined as a "Painting in Motion"...I'm not doing any review fr this masterpiece, rather sharing my POV about it..First of all I felt the long wait for Uncharted 4 was of worth as Naughty Dog didnot rush and made any compromise at all with the last installment in d UC series...Superb visuals with occasional framerate drop issues (I didn't download the day 1's 5GB patch as I lacked patience), an eye fr minute details, seamless integration from cutscene to gameplay, picturesque locations n places with interactive features with the player were the real pleasure for eyes... also the art of storytelling thru a vdo game got redefined. Compared to the previous UC installments, it has got way better enemy AI, and in many a cases bunch of enemies outnumbering the player, though aerial knockouts were bit of a challenge to me (it was really disappointing at times) in the game as it was showcased in the gameplay reveals, drivable cars with its natural interaction with muddy and rock solid surfaces, hardcore action sequences (both hand to hand and shooting), great amount of stealth, multiple paths to reach or execute the opponents, trickier puzzles (some were really nightmares), also the map wider than the semi open world maps...characters (known and newly introduced) are nicely knitted, revealing their hidden secrets, humane sides and twisted edges along with the pace of the story...3 yrs ago wen TLOU came from the same dev house, we were mesmerized n became speechless... Now I can vouch that UC4 in addition to that will hypnotize u all as well...Won't say much now...enjoy this masterpiece asap, which pushed the PS4 boundaries to the optimum level and delivered the wildest and wonderful dreams in a small round shaped blue ray disc..And for Naughty Gods...Thnks for making UC4 nd introducing it to mankind...plss take max time for TLOU 2 and make us awestruck with ur creations in future again n again..

Uncharted is one of those series that comes around once in awhile and revolutionize the industry, and with Naughty Dog's latest and last game, they have done it again. I have been a fan of the Uncharted series for years now, but I will not let this affect my review. This game is simply amazing and in my opinion, it’s the best game on the PlayStation 4 by far. Maybe even the best game on any modern console. The motion capture is the best I have seen in any game, it feels like real people having real conversations, who is being brought to life by Nolan North and his fellow actor friends. The game play is, to put it simply, fun. From shooting enemies with a range of different weapons to swinging from ledge to ledge with a rope, the game is never a bore. Naughty Dog has also in it's latest release shown us just what the console are capable of and has raised the bar for future video games to come. The story is, without spoiling it, amazing, it's never boring, the new characters are great and it moves on with a good pace.
These other negative reviews, 99% are just total crap reviews which are probably done by Xbox fans. This is one of the best games ever made. Good Job on you Naughty Dog.

Insomma per farla breve Naughty dog c' è riuscita ancora, ha creato un capolavoro, una perla videoludica che alza ulteriormente l' asticella degli standard nel mondo dei videogames! Alright, I thought long and hard on how i'll review this game. So, here we go! I've been a huge Uncharted fan since I first bought Uncharted: Drake's Fortune at age 10. Had known nothing about the game, but I had the birthday money to buy me a game or two and Drake's Fortune happened to be that game and was the first game I purchased for the PS3. It was incredible. 2 years later, Uncharted 2, absolutely incredible and my favorite of the three. I didn't appreciate the third one as much at the time, but as I played it recently on the Uncharted Collection to prepare myself for the fourth, I enjoyed it more. Now, for what we've been waiting for. Uncharted 4: A Thief's End has kept my mouth open in awe with the three hours of playthrough. Now, I'm only on the 6th chapter of the game, so this review may change, but there hasn't been a moment where I wanted to put the controller down. I almost called in to say I was sick. Its really an incredible experience. Its got me emotionally drawn. Now, know that I've had such a crazy passion for these games and I cherish the franchise and Naughty Dog more than anything, since Jak and Daxter and Crash. This game isn't a game you should give such a low score. It really isn't. Its physically impossible for the game to get at least lower than a 6. Its graphics are incredible. I don't use Photo Mode often, but, you're gonna have to. The characters and location look incredible. 103 people so far have given the game negative scores, yet 3 have wrote reviews? This game, to me, is an absolute masterpiece. The Last of Us has been my favorite game since 2013, but Uncharted 4 is coming up close. I've enjoyed the hell out of it and I enjoy the amount of care and hardwork the employees at Naughty Dog put into their games to make an outstanding experience. Most people claim that the beginning was a little slow. I didn't think so. **** was happening all over the place. I say you should buy it. You shouldn't be baseing you views on the amount of negative distribution when only 3 have to say something about it, and even then, what they have to say is utterly stupid. Naughty Dog has never upset. I love the game so far. I love everything about it. You should probably consider buying it. Also, Multiplayer is pretty damn neat too. I'm not a huge fan of multiplayer like Destiny, COD, etc, so this was incredible to me.

Greatness from small beginnings is indeed true. When one last time came about it came apparent this will end. This is a legacy, a series that will be written down in history, that will be remembered as a symbol of an epitome of what a game can be graphics wise and story telling. Throughout my playthrough I was astounded by many things. The graphics we all know were one of the best ever, although this game made me stop a lot of times and just glare at the environment around Nathan Drake, looking at the vast design of the levels or looking at small things and saying "Wow, That's real." Uncharted 4's story is the best I've ever experienced out of a game period, it keeps me engaged and it didn't bore me at all. The pacing helped with it too. I did not rush through the game because I don't want this to end and I want to experience everything one last time. Each character had their and purpose and same with the villains, Rafe and Nadine are some of the best in any videogame/film. The gameplay is still classic uncharted and is improved in some ways or greatly. The multiplayer is still a fun add on and I don't think I will stop playing. A thief's end left me feeling satisfied and will be remembered one last time as a masterpiece!

Uncharted is one of those series that comes around once in awhile and revolutionize the industry, and with Naughty Dog's latest and last game, they have done it again. I have been a fan of the Uncharted series for years now, but I will not let this affect my review. This game is simply amazing and in my opinion, it’s the best game on the PlayStation 4 by far. Maybe even the best game on any modern console. The motion capture is the best I have seen in any game, it feels like real people having real conversations, who is being brought to life by Nolan North and his fellow actor friends. The game play is, to put it simply, fun. From shooting enemies with a range of different weapons to swinging from ledge to ledge with a rope, the game is never a bore. Naughty Dog has also in it's latest release shown us just what the console are capable of and has raised the bar for future video games to come. The story is, without spoiling it, amazing, it's never boring, the new characters are great and it moves on with a good pace. A true masterpiece. 10/10.

Alright, a lot users who are giving it very low ratings are PC trolls who are hating. It's quite obvious since a lot of the reviews have been copied and pasted. Alright, the game itself is very good. The storytelling and dialogue is very natural and the new characters are very good (Nadine and Sam. Rafe was unlikable, but that's the point anyways...). The start is slow for the story to settle in, so it doesn't feel like Sam was shoehorned in. It picks up during Madagascar. The number of QTEs are not as much as The Order 1886 as many claim to be. It's around the same number as The Last of Us. The graphics of the game is an achievement, especially on the limited PS4 hardware, and the character models with really good facial deformation gives the acting the much-needed nuance. The gameplay is the same as previous games but more refined. A lot of fanboys would argue that it's the same gameplay and not innovative. And I ask them, which AAA titles have they played that is innovative in this day and age. I loved The Witcher 3, but it's the same mechanics as its predecessor. Only innovation we'll probably get is out of indie games. The rope is an okay addition, because I didn't use it much in combat.

As with a great deal of the other reviewers here, we are coming full circle on a legacy of a story started so long ago in the past console generation (which started off at a slow stride if I may say so myself). For those that have walked in Drake's steps time and time again, this release bears uncommon baggage. In a day where many a game leave One without closure after hours killing mindlessly while grinding endless mountains of enemy's for little payoff, here comes the last grand stand of a series that has been an outlier amongst all the Call of Destiny: Infinite Battlefield's out there. You will not be disappointed, and I am not here to give a shred of the pleasure away. We are blessed by the gaming gods that we still have companies willing to flesh out a single player campaign to this extent with such a vibrant world. A true pleasure it has been, hope you all enjoy it!

This was the first Nathan Drake game I played and will likely be the last - while I enjoyed it, I see no replay value in it, nor do I feel too eager to check the previous installments. The graphics are amazing and really bring the characters to life - Nathan's brother is especially memorable to me. The brothers' reunion and search for priorities storyline keeps the story moving forward and makes it interesting, while the lost pirate city is a bit too much. How did they manage to build such resplendent mansions on a desert island again? Fights are ok, exciting enough, but all the jumping around from one storm-ridden cliff to another is just too crazily unrealistic. I can handle Tomb Raider's level of unrealism, but not this.

Uncharted 4 is a masterpiece that has it all: characters that feel human, incredible storytelling, action packed adventure, top notch graphics, fun gameplay, AND a multiplayer that doesn't feel tacked on!  I'm fully convinced that Naughty Dog is the best game developer in the world.  Their track record is impeccable Crash Bandicoot, Jak & Daxter, Uncharted, and The Last of Us.   Do yourself a favor and buy this game ASAP.  It is worth buying a PS4 just to experience this rare gem. I honestly feel bad for anyone who misses out on this adventure. Naughty Dog has done it again.

Let's get the obvious out of the way first. Uncharted 4 is the best looking game this gen, hands down. Uncharted 4 has by far the best and most satisfying gunplay out of this series, hands down. Uncharted 4 has the best level design and stealth during combat sections in this series, hands down. It also has the best multiplayer this series ever has (imo) hands down. These four concepts are perfect in this game, Naughty Dog really refined the gunplay and gameplay in this game nicely. The characters in this game are the same loveable bunch from previous uncharted, except for Sam; and this is where the hiccups begin for this game. You stick with Sam for like 75% of this game, and his character just wasn't very interesting, I didn't care for him. In a game where story rules all, having a character that's generic and rather predictable takes away from game a lot. The villains are also meh in this game, without trying to spoil anything the twist in the story was disappointing and rather predictable. Overall the story teeter'd from predictable to good for me personally, but I did enjoyed the ending. The gameplay overall was pretty good, I loved the open-linear world, it helped added oomph to the gamelength, and most locations were interesting and treasure hunting was great. The combat sections were amazing, I loved the level designs of it, you can approach from so many angles and directions it was very fun, the stealth was a welcome addition (more optiions is never a bad thing). The guns are less wonky, and enemies are less bullet sponges, just overall amazing. The only parts I didn't like was that the game's pacing can get pretty slow, it's borderline walking (or climbing) simulator for major chunks of this game. This wouldn't had been a problem had the game's story was amazing, but it was good and nothing more. The set action pieces for uncharted (it's trademark imo) is pretty good (would've been better had it not been spoiled by game trailers). Overall I did think the game was really good, add in the fun and tactical multiplayer and this is certainly a day one buy with great longevity.  9.0/10. On a personal side note: I also thought this was a great sendoff for the series, because honestly I feel like there's just not much we haven't seen anymore, form this game or genre;  anyone who has played all four knows what I'm talking about.

I've been a huge fan of the Uncharted games since the first one launched on PS3 and have eagerly played each new release as they came out (I actually really enjoyed Golden Abyss too). Upon playing the game it appears my fears were unfounded. I have played a lot of the game so far but am yet to finish it so I may come back and update this review but so far I am enjoying the game a lot. The tone is a lot darker than previous games but ND still manage to make certain situations with their characters light and comedic as the series should. I really take my hat off to Uncharted 4’s writers, Neil Druckmann and Josh Scherr, you can clearly see they have an amazing understanding of how real people assess and reacts to emotional situations, especially when they have something to lose. Not spoiling to much of the story, but Uncharted 4 opens up with Nathan Drake having retired from the treasure hunting business and seemingly embraced the ordinary life with us now wife Elena. He now owns a house and said mortgage on the house, and for all intents and purposes he is just an average Joe now doing mostly normal salvage work. But this all changes when he learns that his brother Samuel is alive and well and in need of his help using his skills as a treasure hunter.
Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is a perfect ending for the Uncharted series. If you have a PlayStation 4 this game is obligatory! The best exclusive in "Next Gen" so far. 9.5/10
One of the best games of all time. Amazing story-line and dialogue with some of the best set-pieces in the franchise even though there are just a few of them. An awesome end to a beloved series.

SIC PARVIS MAGNA. This is the greatness that was born from Uncharted 1-3, this should be the Magnum Opus for action-adventure games that consist of the most coherent of stories. This game, felt like an actual adventure, everything was sparkling with realism. It is gritty, it makes believe. It's inspiring. Never have I felt so inclined to review a video game on a website. This game has character, it has a heart. It's not about taking cover, throwing back grenades, and killing swarm of mercenaries in a row anymore. This game felt personal. The weight of the urge for just one more adventure, let the heroes of the game grow. The antagonists felt as if they had a genuine purpose to prove their OWN worth, it wasn't about a mere lost city, it had INTRIGUE in the subplot that revolved around the Pirates whose treasure the Drake Brothers were seeking. This game, out of the 4, is how I  will remember Nathan and Sam Drake, Victor Sullivan and Elena Fisher. The gameplay worked, for it wasn't solely about gameplay.

This is a great series...this happens to be my favorite game. On this particular game, they implemented an "auto target" in the controls, which wasn't there before on previous games. This is one of my wife's favorite games (she loves the series). The story, graphics, and controls are excellent and I feel superior to all previous games in this franchise. I feel like they did an excellent job tying up loose ends and this game closed everything out very well.

Uncharted 4 is arguably Naughty Dog's finest masterpiece, certainly it's most beautiful. Uncharted 4, in the words of Bruce Straley, is indeed "the most visually stunning game ever created". The environments themselves tell a story unlike the previous titles, with a sense of history and uncertainty that only the last of us can really match. The heavier narrative is perfectly justified by the game's premise, with a more subdued and nuanced approach to gameplay and pacing. Some players may feel disappointed by the lack of over the top set-piece moments, that were present in previous games, and the absence of certain characters. However, again, this is all perfectly justified by the approach Naughty Dog has taken with Uncharted 4. Upon completion of the game, the player is simply marveled by the depth and care that was taken in this final chapter.

Another great game coming from Naugthy Dog (maybe the only company besides Projekt Red to completely give fans what they deserve). The game is as memorable as the other installment of the series and brought the series at its highest peak. The character development is better than before and the series had finally come to a more humanistic approach. The gameplay was improved at most part and the use of the rope mechanic and stealth is more than welcome to the game, but I would have loved to see upgrades like The Last of Us gave and ways of punishment if the player was only using one tactic or strategy making a deeper mechanics in gameplay. The graphics were phenomenal and it is the best one to date that I have seen, also the environment, lighting, physics, and character interaction was beautifully done and made the game more atmospheric and immersive. The voice acting is still the best that any video game can offer, the dialogue gave life to the characters, the pacing was good too making not only the brother's relationship beneficial to the story but also made the brother a lovable character. The single player just gave the best there is to this game and even without the multiplayer you will get your money's worth. I rate this game a 10/10! Not only is this game a revolutionary game for the PS4 but it is revolutionary for the whole gaming industry. This game might not be for everyone, but the great majority surely loved this game because of what it offers. I'd say that this game is somewhat more technically advanced than TLOU when it comes to story direction and gameplay creativity and such, which is simply amazing. I can pardon it being repetitive at times with all the combat and climbing. Also, the environments are simply amazing. But now that I have finished it, I have to admit that TLOU made much more of an emotional impact on me, mostly because of a more moving story and a much more memorable soundtrack. Both are amazing games, but I'm really hoping for a sequel to TLOU now... But I have to admit that U4 really gave me a sense of adventure/uncovering mysteries, at a level that no other game has ever given me. I actually feel that tis game is a 9/10, but I see a lot of hate from people not really understanding what Naughty Dog games are about, which is, quite frankly, unfair. So I'll give you all of my support! :)

Uncharted 4 is truely an amazing gameplay experience. No other studio in the industry is as capable of makeing a true singleplayer experience as good as Naughty Dog. I've played Uncharted games 1-3 and last of us and all are true masterpieces including this one.  This uncharted out of all of them is my favorite, right behind The Last of Us, which is my favorite game of all time. The action senes are the best in any game I've ever seen, the level design is so good that I can't distinguish it from real life (Play ch.3 to know what I mean), the gameplay and animations transition perfectly into each other, the character animations are flawless, and the graphics OH MY GOD. Uncharted 4s story is just unbelievable. The characters are amazing like Elena Fisher, Nathan, Samuel, and Sullivan. Uncharted 4 is more about family and friends than any other. It makes sense because the same people who wrote the game wrote Last of Us, which was all about family and relationships. You feel a true connection which feels weird to say but its true. In the game you dig deeper than ever before into nathans life. Chapter 3 is one of those times you dig deep into Nathans current life, dealing with his past. The chapter is said to be a bit to long but I feel that it was just the right lenghth and pacing for me to really absorb it all. I found it nice to see them living a normal life. The bad guys were kind of interesting but kind of forgot about them for some of the story. But seeing them in action was cool. The puzzles are a real challenge and fun too. The main plot is also great and very emotionaly driven than anything else. The only flaw with the game is the slightly underwelming villins. Plus the multiplayer is a blast to.

First off, it's sad to see so many negative user reviews on here, calculating a 7.8 score, and one that people will look at thinking people hate it worse than Uncharted 1-3 (which have higher scores). Of course, this is obviously down to a mixture of sheer jealously from Xbox fanboys as well the usual trolls who don't know what a good game is/are just being stupid. But onto my review...

Oh, Naughty Dog. When are you gonna mess up? I'm playing this game, scaling a clocktower while staring over a city in Madagascar. Nothing crazy is happening. I'm not being shot at; I'm not in any particular danger (okay, I'm dangling perilously at the top of a huge-ass clocktower), but I'm having fun. In fact, I'm having an absolute blast.

The games pacing is slowed down a bit over previous games. Previous games are more shooting focused than this. This game also has more stealth than previous games. The different pacing isn't bad, it's just different as the non shooting sections are also great and help the game feel more balanced. The addition of sliding and the rope are great and I was left wishing they were in the previous games. The story telling is top notch and this is a standard I'd like to see matched more often. The game is the best looking game ever made and some how looks better than The Order despite been more action packed and better than anything on the PC. One minor niggle is that the enemies throw grenades often and the ability to throw them back in Uncharted 3 is not in 4 and the grenades get very annoying when you get 3 thrown, one after the other.

Uncharted 4 is absolutely gorgeous. The story, as always is suburb. YES, it is a linear game. If you're trying to use that as a problem i assume you haven't played the previous 3. It is a interactive story you taker part in, not an open world adventure. Its the most polished and intuitive game in the series(which is an incredible praise in its own right). It hurts me deeply if this is in fact the last adventure of Nathan Drake, but it is quite a sendoff.  And frankly the postcard views you see in this game and their realism should bring shame to other dev studios. My only letdown is I really would have like ti see Miss Chloe Frazer again. If you want to see what your ps4 is capable of, and enjoy Tombraider/Indiana Jones type games, you should Absolutely not miss this game.

It is a truly well made and polished AAA game, but a bit overhyped.First of all the game is absolutely gorgeous. Great graphics and amazing skin textures and facial expressions, and generally immaculate attention to detail in and out of cutscenes, so much so that you almost don't notice their seamless transitions, also thanks to the absence of any loading screens. Gameplay however, suffered from uninteresting and really tedious platforming that sees Nathan making it onto the next path by the skin of his teeth dozens of times, to the point where it gets repetitive and disappointingly predictable. It's fun and looks great, above all when you take a moment to absorb it all with the other characters from a panoramic cliffpoint or tall building, or even when you're jumping from collapsing bridges and four hundred year old towers, but after a while it loses it's lustre and it just becomes a rinse and repeat cycle. Shootouts and encounters are still heaps fun and you can approach it stealthly or guns blazing (although it's not recommended), and the puzzles are varied and challenging enough to be entertaining when they come around. The thing that yet again keeps it from being a masterpiece is its linearity in the gameplay and platforming. Getting from A to B always feels extremely on rails and set up, above all through its action sequences. Characters are well acted however, which keeps the mediocre plot above the water for most of the game, although it slightly loses itself in the third act, occasionally coming through a bit forced. Nevertheless the game is a great finale to the series that successfully completes its story arc. Would recommend the game if you're looking to push your ps4, honestly not going to find a better looking game at the store for now, but in terms of gameplay and platforming you might be disappointed. Would give it a 7.7-7.8 so rounding it to 8.

Uncharted 4 is a fantastic game that I'd recommend to any PS4 owner. There really is something for everyone here, including a great story (arguably the best of the series) awesome action and set pieces, and online multiplayer. I don't like to bring up graphics as I don't think they matter, but if they're your thing, this game is absolutely gorgeous. I died a few times because I thought I was still in a cutscene, but I was actually supposed to be playing. I have a few nitpicks, though. The distance you need to fall in order to die is very inconsistent, leading to many deaths at the hands of safe-looking jumps, and the multiplayer has micro transactions. They're pretty minor and shouldn't bug you too much, but it kind of irks me that Naughty Dog thought that it'd be a good idea. There's also going to be single player DLC in the future, implying that you'll have to pay extra to experience the whole story. Again, these are all nitpicks, and you would be doing yourself a major disservice by not owning this great game.

Uncharted 4 is one of the better triple A games in recent years, and is one of the very few scripted, story driven games that can hold my attention. Through clever writing, fun characters, and a story that rejoices in a sense of globetrotting adventure, this game is extremely good at being entertaining until the very end. At its best, Uncharted 4 hits memorable story beats and follows it up with over-the-top fun and unique gun battles with unique hide-and-seek style mechanics. The worst moments, however, force the game to slow down to a crawl. For me, these were all during the climbing segments. These segments have never been, and will never be fun for me. Hitting one button to jump up a cliff is hardly anything more than a quick time event, but these climbing segments often go on for over a minute. I can understand how these are meant to slow down the pacing of the game, after all if the only moments in Uncharted 4 were the intense action sequences, the magic would ware off after a while. Yet that still doesn't excuse how boring the climbing is. Nothing happens during these segments. There's no sense of danger, and no skill necessary to progress. Noticeable improvements have been made in this aspect with the grappling hook, which adds a depth to climbing that isn't there in most other games with similar mechanics. However despite the promise of a more entertaining and complicated climbing system, there are very few areas that take advantage of the most interesting aspects of the grappling hook. I always wanted to string two to three grapples together, but the game only lets you do that a few times, which I found very disappointing. The story itself is extremely intriguing, and very clever at points, but there are points where the characters stop acting like real people for the sake of the plot, especially in the final chapters of the game. The levels, despite having a few branching paths, very rarely reward exploration with anything tangible, and as a result, some of them feel very restrictive. In this aspect, chapter four is the strongest the game has to offer. Every corner of the map has some sort of significance and exploration is always rewarded. Despite, in my opinion, having a few shortcomings, Uncharted 4 is still a very enjoyable experience. Anyone who owns a PlayStation 4 should pick this up, and I'm going to give this game a very strong 6 out of 10.

Is Uncharted 4 the most groundbreaking Uncharted game in the series? In short, no. But is it the best Uncharted game? Absolutely. Story, gameplay, graphics, sounds, motion capture, etc etc are by far the best. After 5 years from making Uncharted 3 it's bound to be better at everything. But, however, it's not as groundbreaking as Uncharted 2. Uncharted 2 was such a breakthrough in ideas and creativity. It totally blew me away. Whether it was the train sequence through the jungle ending in the snowy Himalayas to the helicopter scene in Nepal, nothing can match the innovation in Uncharted 2.
The game looks amazing ,sounds amazing, the historical mystery they solve is interesting and it runs amazing.

The game defining sequences that focused on shock and awe like falling off the train in uncharted2 are replaced with sequences where you control the character through beautiful vistas or explosions. These sequences truly look next gen but usually during a lot of gameplay the game looks slightly better than uncharted2 or uncharted3. Its not that the game doesnt look impressive but uncharted has always pushed the limits of visuals in videogames or even movies and that was last generation. Uncharted 4 is a new beginning for next gen consoles but not a massive leap like uncharted 2 was for the ps3.

This game comes as close to perfection as any other game I've played.  Holy crap.  Story.  Characters.  Voice acting.  Combat.  Exploration.  Graphics.  Audio.  Level design.  Multiplayer.  All on point.  It's really hard for me to find anything wrong here.

ncharted 4 also contains a surprisingly fleshed-out multiplayer mode. Swinging and grappling your way around these 4v4 and 5v5 maps gives you a sense of competitive awesomeness that is a great way to extend the life of the game beyond the sixteen or so hours offered by the main campaign. The three distinct game modes; deathmatch, plunder and command, are all great fun in their own ways and the inclusion of a ranked team deathmatch mode gives you a reason to keep coming back for more. While the multiplayer is very much playing second-fiddle to the campaign, it was a genuine surprise to me when I found myself really enjoying it.

O jogo está excelente, principalmente na parte de produção. Tem alguns problemas mas nenhum deles é relevante o suficiente para estragar a experiência magnifica de jogo.

A great close to the series with interesting / unexpected take on main character arc. The in-game engine animations / blended textures are phenomenal and set the bar for other developers to follow. Gameplay now resembles TLOU using slower conversational segments - love this. Environmental storytelling is excellent. If you own ps4 you should add this to your collection.

An utter masterpiece and one of the greatest and most memorable games I ever will play. Better than a lot of blockbuster movies in terms of spectacle and excitement. The perfect conclusion to a great story.
Best Uncharted game yet, Best action game that i have ever played, very close to a 10/10 for me.
Great story telling by the team at Naughty Dog. Giving this game anything less than an 8 is simply idiotic.
I really don't have a whole lot to add to this game. It's pretty much the ultimate experience Uncharted could possibly give you.

Uncharted 4 is an exceptional last entry in the series showcasing what the fine artists at Naughty Dog are capable of.  I had a hard time choosing a score.  In my opinion it is sssssooooooo close to a ten, but I feel that because of some minor pacing issues and controls that can be frustrating at times I decided a 9 was a bit more justified.  If you liked the other Uncharted games then this one is a no brainer.  If you haven't played any of the uncharted games which there might be quite a bit of those people considering there were a lot of xbox fans that switched to ps4 I highly suggest you play the first 3.  Sure, playing the first 3 isn't an absolute must but if you want to appreciate the game (and it's ending even more) you really should play the others, not Golden Abyss though :-)  I don't want to spoil anything so I will just say for the sake of the industry you should definitely play this game.  The graphics and physics are some of the best I have ever seen in a console game, combat is fun and not overly done, and with the new grapple exploring is more fun than it has ever been in an uncharted game.

Uncharted 4 was definitely one of the very best games of 2016. with phenomenal gameplay, a good story, and excellent graphics to boot. This is one of the games that makes a PS4 worth buying.  This game is not as good as TLOU, but definitely has some heart, personality, and is a groundbreaking title that is a must-own for PS4 players.

I finally got the chance to play Uncharted 4 and from someone who's played the series from the start; I'm impressed. Note that this is a story review only because I really feel the need for Uncharted multiplayer, I have COD and DooM for that.

Naughty Dog ah Naughty Dog. Every time I see them developing something it puts a smile on my face because I know its going to be gold, and that's no exception with Uncharted 4. The final chapter in Nathan's story and its a memorable one. The brotherly love is felt here and Sully coming back. It really feels like an ending to a great game series. Also what a great final battle.

Great game , little slow, seems to have more clips then in game action !!! All an all a fun great end to a great series.. Not exactly game of the year, but it does have boats, and jeeps u can play with doing game action! It's not a game I will play after beating it , but while playing it the first time around u will be very entertained. Haven't played the multiplayer cause I have always been a campaign player, so this is strickly a campaign review !!

I can say, this is the best game I played in the last 5 years, but maybe in the last ten. This is a quality work, with a good story, nice gameplay and user friendly control. Rly enjoyed it, Yo Ho, Yo Ho! :D

This game had a huge task ahead of it - to do justice to the first three Uncharted games and send the series off on a high. I am so pleased to say that Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is a fantastic ending to the series that will not disappoint fans or even newcomers for that matter. With its beautiful design, fantastic performances, thrilling gameplay and wonderful writing, it might just be the best game of the four.

A Fantastic game of Naughty Dog , which unfortunately note that this is not the "nexgen"  Game that i was expected. This being the last game of the saga this game reminds me of the best days of Playstation 2 when the " cutscenes " were the best images in comparison to the " gameplay ".....

UC4 is by far the best looking game on the PS4, or any console, ever. The animations are incredibly lifelike and the overall look of the game really brings you into the experience and never let’s go till the end. The story contains good writing and clever twists and turns along the way. Gameplay mechanics are top notch, greatly improved from Uncharted 3; everything operates so smoothly as you play, it just feels natural. The environment is great and I had to force myself not to stop and take a picture every five minutes. The only thing that holds the game ever-slightly back would be its pacing and drawn out story. I was ready for things to get moving and the game teases you over and over. That being said, Uncharted 4 is a ton of fun. It’s a console-selling title, deservedly, that demands your attention. A serious game of the year contender that will be remembered for years to come. 9.8/10
Without a doubt the best game of this generation. Uncharted 4 ticks all the boxes. Great story. Great acting. Brilliant game play and fantastic multiplayer

Thanks again to Naughty Dogs for a masterpiece. Awesome as always............... Best game ever awesome game-play GFX everything....... he best action-adventure game ever..Really, if you own a PS4, you should buy this game. If not, commit suicide.

Well...here we are, the finality of the Uncharted series. The saga has been quite the roller coaster in my opinion. The first one sucks, the second one was a master piece and the third one was in the middle. And now we finally finish Nathan Drake's latest adventure in his strongest game yet.

Uncharted 4 is the most beloved game in my shelf and it was mind blowing you wouldn't feel like you are playing a game it would feel like you are in a movie you would fell it and goosebumps would rush in while the combat.and btw it has one of the best escape scenes I have seen in games and movies!
Uncharted 4 is undoubtedly the most well crafted game in the series,however it lacks the set pieces that the series is known for

Gunplay and general combat is fantastic and satisfying.  Level design is great barring one or two areas that lose their novelty after the first time playing them.  The story works great on a surface level, but blemishes appear after looking any deeper.

Not better than The Last of Us, but definitely holds its own with a very strong story, great pacing and easily the best console graphics I've ever seen. If you're a trophy hunter as well you will enjoy this one as it is a fun list.
How do you make the perfect game? I don't know, ask Naughty Dog.

The game would have been a perfect 10 if not for the pacing issues especially on Act 3 of the single player campaign. The story is a tad bit predictable but neatly wraps up Nathan Drake's story in a memorable way. Loved the game.
pro- amazing graphic (every cutscenes are in-game graphics)

Best Uncharted game of the series!  I played through two times - beat it on normal difficulty and then replayed on a harder setting. The graphics are great and the story is excellent. My ONLY complaint (if forced to pick one) is stealth could have been done better and seems like it was added as an afterthought, but still well done and does not merit a lower score. A must play for any PS4 owner!

I'm playing through the game slowly, an hour or two at a time; on mission 9 now and I really didn't want to stop playing and go to bed last night. It's tremendously polished; having incredible detail in every visible direction. The problem I have so far is that it feels less like I'm playing a game and rather watching a movie. A great movie, but still, less interactive than I would like. A few of the missions felt like I had not actually played anything during them, and instead just watched a movie. It is like a Metal Gear Solid game, but the cutscenes make sense and are really interesting and engaging. So, I'm really enjoying this piece of entertainment, but it is in a different way than I'd expected. Still well worth the price, as everything is in the top notch of quality, and the content duration is akin to a 3-6 part movie series, gameplay aside. My favorite part of the gameplay is the puzzle solving, something I also really enjoyed in the previous games. There are few experiences to be had in gaming like this one, and I can wholeheartedly recommend it.

Great story that takes a little time too set off but when it does it does stunning visuals great dialogue sam is good rafe and nadine were good but could have had a little bit more work done on them.Loved sully as usual some great set pieces and cool locations the mystery of where  henry avery's treasure is gets more intresting as you go on with a cool twist at the end.Now lets talk about the things that werent great or could have used some extra time as I said the two vilains werent all that great but were good the combat got a little repetitive the multiplayer is fun but not enough to keep you playing and its ending was nice but I was hoping for something better but its still good but if you take away the multiplayer and the slightly repetitive combat the story is worth the price on its own this is a great game and sends the series off in style.You gotta buy this even if you havent played the previous games.
i didnt even need to play the game before i saw the awsomeness, insane graphic, good story and insane animations and details, great gamme naughty dog.

9/10 would be my final, and honest, rating for this amazing game. I finished it yesterday and I have to say that it is probably my favorite Uncharted game with U2 really close in 2nd place. People who are posting "0's" for this game have either had a momentarily mental lapse in judgement or are just being horribly bias towards this sony exclusive. That is what's wrong with the user scores for game's like this because people justify their outrageously high or low score because they feel like the other reviews didn't justify their own opinion. Listen to the critic scores with this one because there is just an immature flaming party going on here...

Uncharted 4 is undoubtedly a benchmark for the PS4 -- an alchemical formula Naughty Dog have been brewing and refining for years, mixing cinematic-action, exploration and puzzle-lite gameplay into a compelling whole. For those of us that have been along from the beginning, the (supposed) final chapter should come as a fitting - though unexpected - conclusion, thanks in large part to a refreshing staff change behind the scenes. If, like me, you were wondering how an adventurous rascal reconciles the mundane world of employment, bills and marriage versus bullets, travel and treasure; here you go.

Best graphics, fun game play, great story and the best of all... Guns! The guns looks and sounds realistic. Only downside of the game is some levels are a little boring than others but its still a great game!
It's an amazing game, I played all of them including the nathan drake collection and it was even better. Better graphics and action packed to the max!

This game is really well done.  The graphics are top notch, the story is decent but predictable  The combat and platforming leave a lot to be desired.  I think by now everyone knows that this is more of a walkabout interactive movie.  It's not much of a game.  I enjoyed the interactive movie experience.  I should have just watched it on a YouTube Let's Play.  If ND could just improve the game-play, Uncharted 4 would be an out-of the park grand-slam.  A repeatable adventure, that could have made billions.  Instead it's just a predictable movie, with nothing to bring you back.

I thoroughly enjoyed the last of the Uncharted series, the characters dialogue was my favorite by far of the series.  The pairing on Nolan North and Troy Baker was perfect they play off each other so well that you feel as though they are truly brothers.  I would also say that Warren Cole who played the villain did an outstanding job.  People say that sometimes the chapters drag on to long but I think they are missing the point, they should enjoy the dialogue and the best graphics on PS4 by far.

remember when i first played the original uncharted, it blew my mind with its characters intense gameplay and amazing story telling. It was the reason i switched to a playstation. UC 2 managed to top the first game in ways unimaginable, while UC 3 continued to push the series to greater heights. I have waited so long to play this final installment, and to all of you fans and newcomers out there it does not disappoint!. from its ground breaking graphics to its beautiful and exhilarating story UC 4 a thiefs end is such an amazing conclusion to a groundbreaking and exciting series. It makes me sad to see people saying it doesn't do anything new or that its boring, i know its a matter of opinion but people if the formula isnt broken dont fix it. Overall its a great game and if you have always been a fan of Uncharted then this game is the perfect conclusion to a great gaming icon

Uncharted 4 is one of the best video games I've ever played. When I think of my all-time favorites - Red Dead Redemption, Fallout New Vegas, Resident Evil 4 - Uncharted 4 is every bit as awesome as those games. This is the first game I've played on the PS4 that has truly wow'ed me.
This game is amazing because of its graphics and effects that happen when drake falls or fall in love , the shooting is so realistic it feels like you are in the game

An amazing experience ! This is how I would summarize playing and completing this game. Graphically speaking it is on another level compared to most games out in PS4. It is full of memorable interactions, diverse things to do and achieve and great sceneries to look at. Buy it and invest the time to it. It is worth it.
Don't be fooled by bad opinions, mostly from players who don't own PS4. Game is awesome and it's a great ending to the series, tho I can understand that some ppl didn't like it :)

Naughty Dog proves themselves as masters of the action adventure genre once again. I would give this game a 9.6 out of ten, but that isn't an option, so I'll just give it a ten. Why Uncharted 4 so good? It's got some of the best gun play and dialogue in the franchise. The combat is refined even more in this outing, and the environments are larger and much more detailed than they ever have been. Uncharted 4 brings in a bigger focus on stealth, and the grapple rope is purely AWESOME. My only minor criticism is the lack of the Uncharted theme, and Nathan Drake having a brother who has never come up in any previous game. But those are very minor, and don't detract from the experience. Uncharted 4 has the best visuals of any of any game ever, the best gun play of any game ever, and the best chase scene of any game ever. Buy this game.

This is one of the best games i have ever played. The graphics are incredible, the gameplay is incredibly fun and satisfying, and the voice acting is top notch. The story is fantastic as always and the characters are all believable and interesting. Definitely recommend buying this game.
What magnificent game, the story is great, the gameplay is very good, the graphics are gorgeous without being fanboy, this is the best game I've ever played in my life, I recommend.
No other game I have played in my life has the impact of Uncharted 4.

While I can't forgive the retro fitted older brother trope, the writers did go at length to try and make it easy for me. It's never in danger of becoming the most enthralling Uncharted game. It is however, by far, the prettiest and the same by the numbers action adventure gets a much needed shot in the arm with wider vistas that finally allow you to take a look around! The less said about the multiplayer, however, the better. Not the most satisfying we would have wished for Nathan Drake but as the man himself will tell you, it was all about the journey; not the destination.

Really awesome and beautiful, for me it's the best one of the series. i really enjoyed it, it's like playing a movie, characters are touching. uncharted 4 is definitively a must have. ND has done again a nice work. Thank you

A naughty dog fecha com chave de ouro essa espetacular franquia, com muito maior na história, tomando o devido cuidado para não deixar pontas soltas, o gráfico é absurdo e mostra quão poderoso é o ps4.

I am a longtime Uncharted fan and I am pleased to say that Uncharted 4 is a fantastic experience. Naughty Dog yet again released a beautiful, action-packed, polished adventure and I was glued to TV for 3 days because of it. It has some of the best pacing I've seen in a gaming to date and the story is well crafted, well acted, and a solid send-off to our favorite snarky Nathan Drake.

Masterpiece! The best part from Uncharted. I love landscape in "A Thief's End", this game is beautiful. Many times I just stop and I admired world around me. For me this is GOTY 2016. The best Exclusive on PS4 ever made.
There isn't much more I can add to what other who gave it a 10 have said already.

Uncharted 4 is excellent, and to be perfectly honest, would be a great game even without its captivating narrative. The introduction of the rope to game-play, as well as some ante upping on stealth mode are wonderful additions. The game is perfectly paced. The intensity ramps up higher and higher as the story continues. Firefights are much rarer than past installments, and very unique. This game-play variety surprisingly adds a lot to the story. Nate no longer feels like an unstoppable killing machine, but more like an aging man, past his prime, simply doing his best.

dont get me wrong uncharted 4 is a good game as most naughty dog games are but this one didnt do it for me as the other 3 did the gameplay is good the story great graphics omg have you seen it but i cant help but feel 2 & 3 were much better games and TLOU is MUCH!!!! better then this yes buy this if you have played them all like i have i bought a ps vita just for golden abyss but if you have never played one of these games just get tlou cheaper and better uncharted 4 is a good game but falls short 1 leap forward 2 leaps back

Its rare to find a series of games where each sequel is better than the last, but Uncharted 4 does just that, it is in my opinion the best game of the series. Uncharted 4 is a lot more mature and serious than the previous instalments, and really expands on Nathan's character and develops the bond between each of the characters.
A very fitting finale to a great overall story arc. This is a top three game for me. One of those games that you have to play from start to end as soon as humanly possible. It is just that engaging.
as perfect as a game can be. definantly in my top 10 favourite games ever made

Uncharted 4 is the high point of the Uncharted series delivering an engrossing story, fleshed out characters, brilliant gameplay and jaw-dropping graphics.  Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is a brilliant blockbuster masterpiece that brings a satisfying end to all of the characters that we have grown familiar with over the years.  It’s truly a fitting end for a thief.
A game that every ps4 gamer should have in their games library. The story is amazing, the graphic is beyond my expectations.

Best game of this generation so far for me. The multiplayer is fantastic, the story is amazing. Definetly the best uncharted game in the series. I would recommend it to anyone. If you have played the 3 other uncharted games it's a great send off.

Its a fun game and has outstanding visuals voice acting and facial animations which are jawdropping, but the gameplay gets repetitive qucikly, theres one section which was drawn out too much and the end boss battle was just a led down.Theres way too much climbing in this game which i hate the most in this game.I do like the addition of the grappling hook and the driving portion of the game were also pretty fun(though the driving controls aren't that great).Overall though i had fun with this game but it is definitely not my favourite in the series and not a system seller in my mind, but if you have a ps4 i think should get this game.The multiplayer is very underrated for this game.I still play it and its really fun to play, for that i can easily recommend this game.

Everything is done with so much love, affection, care, and painstaking detail, it’s obvious that everyone working on the project wanted it to be the best it possibly could. Playing Uncharted 4 is like reading a really great book before bed, where you have no idea what’s going to be around the next page and you just need to see what happens in the next chapter before you sign off for the night.

Uncharted 4 is one of the best games to of ever graced any console.The graphics are amazing,the gameplay is varied and the story line worthy of a hollywood blockbuster.There is a lot of cutscenes throughout the game but the deeper the story goes the more you become entwined in its storyline.The characters are believable and the narrative as good as you'll ever hear.The game involves you solving some clever puzzles and overcoming plenty of foes in some rip roaring gunfights.

Uncharted 4 is one of the best games by Naughty Dog after Uncharted 2 and The last of us.The combat and graphics in uncharted 4 are the best ever n the series. From Drake's Fortune to A Thief's End, Naughty Dog's Uncharted series is a triumphant achievement that has ended on a truly spectacular note. Uncharted 4 retains its predecessors knack for elaborate and highly engaging storytelling coupled with riveting action sequences and thought provoking puzzles. Yet this time around, the narrative runs deeper than ever before, presenting dynamic relationships and characters with a level of humanistic depth rarely seen in video games. The incredible graphics, that are certainly the best of any PS4 game so far, create a cinematic-like experience of such beauty that I constantly found myself staring in awe at my television screen. From the mountainous snow tipped peaks of Scotland to the vibrant fields of Madagascar, if there was ever a time to take in-game pictures, it would be for this. This is a must buy for not only any Uncharted fan, but any gamer as well. All game developers should strive to rival the quality and longevity of this series, and what a fantastic way for Naughty Dog to wrap it all up.

I wanted to post this review not only to counteract the trolling on here (more on that in a bit), but to say how much I'm enjoying this game! I'm nine chapters in and i can't help but be in awe of the experience of playing this game. The graphics are amazing, the voice acting is spot on--complete with all the charm and humor we've come to know and love from this series, and the gameplay is near perfect. There are a few minor gripes that I have: 1) the game, at times, tries to be like the Metal Gear games, whereas it almost seems like the game forces you to play stealthily in some sections. There are a given number of enemies in an area, and taking them out with stealth IS fun, but if they spot you all of a sudden dozens of them come out of the woodwork. Don't get me wrong, there's nothing wrong with white-knuckle shootouts, but it can be a bit frustrating at times, 2) there are certain times where the graphics CAN be a bit blurry. It's nothing major, and maybe it's intentional, but it was a little immersion breaking for me. However, these are VERY minor gripes when weighed against the whole experience of the game, which is epic to say the least!

After Naughty Dog proved what they could do with The Last Of Us, they had a lot to prove with Uncharted 4. Well, I can proudly say that Uncharted 4 completely delivers and I've only played Uncharted 2 and a little bit of 3. It is clear that Naughty Dog has taken all of the lessons they learned from the first 3 Uncharted's and The Last Of Us and once again created a masterpiece for the PS4. Nathan Drake's final adventure is perhaps the most engaging and thought-provoking yet, thanks to excellent writing and performances. However, the real strength of Uncharted 4 is the way it is able to combine story and gameplay with such grace. The game can be a little too difficult at times and the climbing controls could be improved, but those concern easily faded away when I was given the choice to engage a situation with stealth or brute force in the game's much larger sandboxes, or when the banter between Nathan, Elena, Sully, or Nathan's brother, Sam put a smile on my face or brought me to edge of tears. While playing Uncharted 4's 12-14 hour story, I never wanted to put the controller down. It's a story about family, self-examination, and even storytelling itself. And to top it all off, there is an engaging and provocative multiplayer in the package as well, with intense gameplay and tons of unlocks. Uncharted 4 is a game that AAA developers can only dream of creating. If this really is the end, Nathan Drake couldn't have asked for a better sendoff.

A call back to the franchise's past in a big way, Uncharted 4: A Thief's End shines brightest in the subtlest moments. Big set pieces have always been a pillar on which the games stand, and there are no shortage here, but it's the small nuances that really stand out. From Nate and Elena's cluttered home, full of interactive trinkets collected from previous adventures, to the wholly believable relationships with the other cast of characters (acted to absolute perfection), this game hits a more personal note than previous entries. Considering performance, the game is impeccable. The presentation, acting (again), score, and visuals are all some of the best I've ever witnessed in the medium. The only thing holding me from giving the game a 10 is its pacing. It's paced extremely well for the most part, but there are segments that can tend to drag a bit. This may be intentional, as Naughty Dog is obviously trying to convey a more reserved and reluctant hero. Regardless, this is an exceptional experience, a tour dé force in interactive storytelling, and a fitting end to arguably the most well-known and loved cast of characters in the entire Playstation library. Sic Parvis Magna!

Uncharted 4 is one of the best games of this generation. It is very rare nowadays to find a game that has a great story with interesting characters, but still focusing on letting the player feel part of what is happening on the screen. It is an amazing work of art: from its graphics to its sound, Uncharted 4 is definitely worth the $60 price and a most own. Naughty Dog have done it again and have delivered another wonderful masterpiece, following the success of The Last of Us. One of the many things that I was impressed with was its consistency to remain interesting and the length of it's story mode. *At the time of writing this review I have completed 50% of the game and it has taken me around 8:30 hours on Hard Difficulty. The game has a total of 24 Chapters that can last from 20 minutes to 1:30 plus each. There is plenty of content to keep the player entertained until the end. Overall, Uncharted 4 is the best looking PS4 game so far, the story telling is very strong and Naughty Dog proves itself, once again, as one the best gaming studio worldwide.

Uncharted 4 é uma experiência gratificante e marcante do início ao fim. O enredo segue a linha de qualidade, entregando uma história interessante e uma inter-relação entre personagens mais bem feita de toda a franquia (incrível como a inclusão de Sam ficou tão bem encaixada, mesmo não tendo se falado sobre ele nos games anteriores). O gameplay também evoluiu e está mais divertido, trazendo novas possibilidades com o stealth e o uso do gancho. A trilha sonora é excelente, casando-se muito bem com cada situação do game. Por fim, o multiplayer está bem divertido e bem fluído em 60FPS. O único ponto negativo que vejo é a retirada da abertura clássica da série, que me frustrou um pouco. Mas isso é bobagem perto da qualidade sólida deste game.
