This game was paced differently than the other three in the series, with it progressing more similar to TLOU.  It also had similar lighting and atmosphere, and at times it felt a bit frustrating being used to the bombast of the earlier series entries.  By the end of the game, I felt in retrospect though that the pacing created the most memorable entry in the series where you can play it through again and really pick up every small detail.  The only other game in the series I played multiple times through was UC2 and this one was much more captivating.  Some of the negative reviews (beyond the troll posts and the 0 ratings which are worthless for accurate reviews) might also be due to this pacing issue where it did feel labourious at times trudging through some of the levels, but the level of detail and work that went into this is truly phenomenal.  There are many good games which excel at fast gameplay or one liners, but this game portrayed a degree of realism and grit which was not present before in the series.  Overall its a great fit for players that enjoy nuance, explorable scenes and a level of detail that creates a feeling of immersion.  The soundtrack is also quite good and I recommend playing with a good set of headphones.

First, I'll just start by saying that this game is fantastic.  Modern single player games need to have a balance of certain factors to achieve greatness in entertainment.  First, it needs to have a great story that satisfies both fans of its franchise, as well as new players.  Second, it needs to have exciting gameplay that requires quick thinking and fast reactions.  Third, it needs to have elements that involve critical thinking and takes more time and in depth concentration.  Fourth, it needs to balance these aspects in a fashion that keeps the game interesting, and doesn't make it feel repetitive and/or boring.  The Uncharted series has done this very well from the first game through the fourth.  The fourth and final installment, however, did something a little bit extra.  It finished the story and finished it well.  Stories that follow a central character have to reach an inevitable conclusion.  Unlike stories that follow broader socio-political concepts, which can change and adapt to continue on, stories based on a central character needs an end for audiences to be truly satisfied.  Uncharted 4 does this in spectacular fashion.  It includes chapters from the past that reveals the depth of the Nathan Drake character, allowing for greater character development than we've seen in previous titles.  The game also shows us how Nathan Drake has learned from his previous experiences, and applies that wisdom to finally (spoiler alert) let go of his wild ambitions for treasure and adventure, and to finally settle down with Elena.  So no more lost cities and cursed treasure for Nathan.  Just a cozy life with his business and family.  A satisfying conclusion for a fun and entertaining game franchise.

I finished it today and I can safely say it's the best of the series, Naughty Dog have improved every aspect of the game, most notably the visuals which are incredible. What's more impressive is the fact the game runs so well with those visuals, for the record I'm a "60fps guy" and 30fps usually hurts games for me but not this time, the devs did an amazing job of making 30fps feel smoother than it ever has with impressive motion blur and a mostly stable frame rate. When it's hitting its target it feels very fluid but it does have random slowdown at times and it's really noticeable when it happens because the game runs so well most of the time, sadly this slowdown happens during the final chapter and it really did taint the ending for me.

Naughty Dog did an amazing job on this game. When you finish it  you actually feel like that's how it was supposed to finish. There isn't a reason it shouldn't have finished like that. It's just amazing and the ending not only brings everything together but it shows that games can actually have sequels and it can be perfected. I haven't seen anything like this before. Fallout couldn't do it, batman couldn't do it. No game on/off the market could do what Uncharted 4 has done and I don't think any game ever will. TLOU was great but the only people you really pay attention to is Ellie and Joel. In this game you care about everyone. Henry Avery, Nathan drake, Elena, Sully, Sam, Charlie, Chloe, Rafe, Nadine. The fact that I actually remember the villans shows how amazing and how big of an impact this game actually made. You feel for every one of these characters and even if Henry Avery isn't physically in the game you still want more of that character and you actually want to discover the treasure and you actually want to keep on playing until you figure out what happens. In most games you probably want to play as the same character but do something totally different than what the story actually makes you do. In this game I felt hooked and I didn't want it to be another adventure and even though the ending was unpredictable I didn't feel like it was forced or like it didn't have to happen in all honesty i'm very excited that it did happen and it's probably one of the best endings to a SERIES in gaming history. There will always be another 10/10 game but there will  never be another Uncharted. No game can even try to come close to how this game is. There's always gonna be FPS games and  3rd person shooter games but I don't think there will ever be a game like t his. Uncharted 4 deserves a 10/10 game and in my opinion it is one of the best games I've ever played, no It is THE BEST GAME i've ever played. This is why I give uncharted 4 a 10/10.

Let's get it started! Uncharted 4... I finished the game right now... There are no words to tell you guys, what i felt with the amazing game that Naughty Dog gave us. Graphics are suberb, i can't imagine another company pushing the current PS4 hardware to that level, that's what defines Naughty Dog a AAA studio! Uncharted 4, for me, is the most complete game in every aspect, impressive gameplay, a story that makes you want to play one more chapter just to know what happens next, all combined in a imersive world that offers you a huge variaty of ways to play the game, more than one single path that you need to follow to get from point A to B, you can climb, go with your vehicle or just run! I can't remember a game that made me forget everything around me and turn off the real world to be Nathan Drake... " One Last Time! " This game is at the same level of The Last Of Us! The best Uncharted ever made, even better then Among Thieves! I can't get that this is the end.. the last Uncharted ever made, but in one way, i'm glad that this is the last one. You wanna know why? Because it ended in the TOP like it deserves, the same end that The Last of Us had, that make some people beging for one more chapter, and another ones that prefer that it doesn't happen, just because it could destroy what that game ment for us. Short version, buy it, don't even doubt about it, if you have followed Nate story, if you know what Naughty Dog can bring you, just... BUY IT! It's a must have in any gamer that calls himself a true fan. A Masterpiece, thank you Naughty Dog. Goodbye Nathan! Thanks for all the memories and good time, for your amazing story, for all the action scenes, the graphics, the environment, the bad guys, the partners... One last time, THANK YOU!

When Amy Hennig got the boot, Druckmann and Straley scrapped eight months of work because they wanted to do their own thing - and it shows. Come on, if I wanted more realism and more melancholy, I would have played The Last Of Us, truly an outstanding masterpiece of storytelling, world-building and characterization, and I can't wait for the second installment. But Uncharted doesn't need any of those. The franchise never took itself seriously, it proudly reveled in its Indiana Jones pulp action vibe, it was like a comic brought to life with love and a hell of a lot of tongue in cheek. All that is pretty much gone in this one. Uncharted was a boyish larger-than-life fantasy and had a tone all of its own, and Druckmann's and Straley's version pretty much misses the mark for the most part. Yes, the acting is amazing as usual, but the tone's completely different once you look beneath the surface. Sure, the set pieces are there, the quips, the banter, the action - but now they are like they'd be in any movie these days. Same goes for the score: Greg Edmondson not only created three outstanding soundtracks and extremely catchy themes you just have to hum along, he wrote music that was unmistakably Uncharted in a nutshell. But he got the boot, too, because Druckmann and Straley wanted Henry Jackman. He certainly did a good job with the score for Uncharted 4, but this one sounds like any other action movie score. The light-hearted fun, the tongue in cheek, the old-fashioned serial vibe, the sense of wonder and adventure - completely gone.

This will be a milestone for the gaming industry for a long time. Uncharted 4; A thief's end is a spotless example of advances in graphics, writing, game play, and most importantly an excellent ending for our protagonist, Nathan Drake, along with his series - Uncharted itself. Uncharted has always been a cut from a different cloth that the adventure genre throws to us. Uncharted 1 being great, 2 being a "best game of all time" contender, 3 being fantastic, and finally 4, A shining beacon in the darkness of the  un-anticipated gaming year of 2016. I won't spoil the story at all, but the game is like a gripping movie; you cannot walk away from it. The story, and its writing and voice acting is pristine. Game play is seamless, and controls smoother than anything yet. The new mechanics are polished, and feel like they've been there since the first installment. And the graphics are just.. honestly unreal, so much so i shed a tear myself in a specific area. These are the best graphics on console of all time. Nothing can compare. If you have a PS4, you will have the time of your life with UC4.
What a ride it has been!!

Uncharted 4 es la mezcla perfecta entre the last of us y uncharted, toma lo mejor de cada uno y lo une todo en una combinación con un resultado increíble, y con un aspecto técnico y narrativo admirable. Una historia mucho más profunda que otros uncharted y una jugabilidad perfeccionada que sitúan a este juego como uno de los mejores de la generación probablemente solo superado por the witcher 3.
Needless to say what a beautiful game it is as everybody keep saying here. This is how a game with a movie-like experience should be unlike the order 1886 or quantum break. Period.
Excellent, excellent game! It brought back that feeling of playing Uncharted for the very first time. If you live your life without playing this game, then it's really not a life worth living.

There isn't really any other score this game could receive.  Naughty Dog sticks the landing with an incredibly poignant and heartwarming conclusion to their tale of Nathan Drake.  Gameplay is refined from the previous titles and runs very smoothly, while the story takes it's time to build on the relationships these characters share.  This is a slower, more involving Uncharted than the previous instalments; it doesn't go as big as 2 or 3, but I feel this is one of Naughty Dog's greatest narratives; it's only competition is Uncharted 2, for it's relentless pacing, and The Last Of Us, for it's emotional powerhouse of a story.  Overall, I am incredibly satisfied with Uncharted 4, I had a smile the moment I started up the game, and it was even larger by the conclusion.  10/10.

I don't think this game needs any more positive reviews. It's obvious it's about the highest quality you can expect from a game publisher. The graphics exceed anything else out there so far, including PC. The game-play is refined and addictive. It really doesn't get much better than this. Any negative reviews have to be coming from those that don't have access to it.

Absolutely amazing game, played the single player twice and have loved every bit of it. Between the villains of Rafe and Nadine i felt as if i was part of the story as Rafe was a convincing bad guy who had no over the top ambition to kill until right at the very end. Nadine was a great side villain who supported Rafe by acting as a leader for a hired army. Emily Rose did a fantastic job at playing Elena as she showed how the character of Elena had matured over the past few games and really convinced me that she cared about Nate and their future. Nolan North also did a fantastic job as usual with Drake. The only flaw in the characters is Sam as he doesn't end up being as likeable as he was intended to be.

Naughty Dog are the Pixar of PS games. Uncharted 4 is a tour de force of storytelling and action mixed with incredible game design and unparalleled beauty. These games will grip you emotionally (a game in which you truly care about the characters), while staying massively engaging in game play (I love feeling like I AM the lead in an blockbuster film). If all of that seems a bit vague and hyperbolic, you're right, as I would be stealing the experience from you if I discussed much more in detail. I generally have a rule that I don't pay more than a dollar per hour of play that I'll get out of a game, but here I happily make an exception. It's worth every penny.

I think this is my favorite in the series. the second game was a tighter package and slightly larger set pieces but the writing, story, and characters are better than they have ever been in uncharted 4. the set pieces and action sequences are amazing and maybe aren't as large in scale as other ones, but there is a lot more going on in these sequences and are more exciting than previous ones, thats something I didn't think was going to be achievable. these sequences were so good that during these moments I just had the hugest smile on my face. the developers added enough to keep the gameplay from getting old, a problem that I felt was present in the 3rd game. the addition of the grappling hook was awesome, nothing made me feel more badass than using it to dive bomb an enemy undetected. speaking about being undetected the option to go stealth and not attack if you wanted to was a great addition, even though it was fairly simple mechanics. Even little things like being able to double team a bad guy with the other characters when beating them down was awesome and the little side conversations you could have or not have like in the last of us were things I really appreciated and added to the emersion. despite all this, the biggest thing this game does right is the story, it is extremely emotionally investing, and I appreciate that they do this without being gloomy like so many other titles. there are so many games that try to provoke emotion by being dark and depressing that its refreshing to have a story that's actually very light hearted in tone but still hits you in the heart. not to say that aren't sad moments, this game focuses strongly on betrayal, obsession, and letting go but it still manages to keep you laughing and smiling most of the way through. I was never bored for a second, but I can see the replay value not being that strong in the first couple chapters. best villian yet in the series in my opinion because not only was the villain a complete scum bag you could also understand why he does the things he does and even empathize with him, infact hes not to different from nathan drake, they happen to have alot in common. I cant talk to much more about the gaem without going into spoiler territory so ill just say that this is easily game of the year for me so far with dark souls 3 alomost on par. the perfect uncharted game

There is no question that Uncharted 4 is a technical marvel and once again shows why Naughty Dog are arguably the world's finest game developers. Graphically, it is probably the most impressive game I have played, with incredibly detailed and realistic character models and animations, lavishly designed and visually spectacular environments, and impressive graphical effects. The sound design is equally impressive, with a suitably bombastic movie style soundtrack, excellent sound effects and mixing, and first class voice acting across the board. In terms of presentation, Uncharted 4 is an extraordinary achievement.

I was hesitant to give Uncharted 4 a perfect score. Like the other games in the series, it featured some of the natural faults of parkour controls (here's looking at you, Assassin's Creed) like Nathan not jumping to the handhold you want as well as the annoying typical Uncharted difficulty spike during the final chapters. The story was also somewhat predictable, even in a couple of its twists. However, the sheer excellence this game boasts in every other area is what earns that 10. The story, while predictable at times, is as fun as ever, and the introduction of Nathan's brother Sam is a fun change-up on the Nate/Sully pair. The performances and mo-cap work are as flawless as ever, and the actor's excellent performances really allow us to buy into the story. This also serves as a beautiful end to Nate's saga, with a truly unique epilogue. This is the closest a game has ever come to being full-blown cinema (at least in the games I've played). This is helped along by the absolutely stunning graphics. In 15 years of gaming, I don't think I ever let my mouth drop at visuals...until the opening sequences of Uncharted 4. Seriously, this is one of the most gorgeous and stunning games *ever*. The gameplay is tight and fun. Both stealth and brute force work equally well, but best in tandem. The set pieces are crazy as always, and the final boss battle was probably one of my favorites I've ever played. Last but not least, I've also really enjoyed diving into the multiplayer. Eschewing the traditional leveling system works well in this case, and the cosmetic bonuses are fun ways to utilize progression. All in all, Uncharted 4 is one of my favorite gaming experiences I've ever had. I would recommend ti (and the rest of the series for that matter) to anyone--not just gamers.

For Nathan Drake's final outing, this was a huge one. The story takes some amazing twists and even ends in the same way as the Goonies! Gameplay-wise the shooting feels like it took a little bit from every Uncharted game and sprinkled it all in there. Gone is the shaky aiming, but every gun felt like Drake has the strength of a 12 year old firing a .45-caliber. The multiplayer is where it really shines. Every single item in the game is unlockable by simply playing. Though if you're impatient you can just spent actual money to unlock things, but with enough patience you can save the $50 bucks you'll inevitably spend on vanity gear. Again, when I say everything, I mean everything! Characters, outfits, accessories, taunts, all of it is unlockable with the "relic" currency you get for simply playing the game. One thing that's missing, though I hope they'll add was the co-op arena mode from Uncharted 3. I'd highly recommend this with the season pass as well because there is a story expansion coming as well as multiplayer expansions.

Uncharted 4 is an absolute masterpiece. Sure, as with all games, it has some minor flaws. For instance, dialogue trees are never used to their full extent, and the linear design of climbing can sometimes feel repetitive, just another step to get to the next cut-scene. My applause goes out to Naughty Dog to creating a perfect ending for one of gaming's most beloved characters, not an easy task indeed.

Easily the worst Uncharted game.  Even below #1 despite the advancements since then.  When judged as a "movie-game" all 3 previous installments had a brisker pace and better encapsulated the identity of the series.  Uncharted 2 is the best TPS/action/story game this side of Resident Evil 4, and yet Uncharted in it's fourth iteration feels like a chore.  It feels like it was made by a different team entirely.  This is the sort of game I would have expected had Sony demanded another UC game that ND didn't want to do and they handed the reigns to a different studio.  One unanimous praise I'm hearing seems to be the graphics but I'm not even convinced the graphics have improved a ton since Uncharted 2.  Things are sharper and more detailed in the town settings, and some of the skyline/mountainous backdrops are superior to the previous games, but those scenes are not the entire game.  There's a lot in between that is quite bland.  Almost as if they spent too much time on certain sections and not enough on others.  I would have much rather they went for 60fps and dropped the visual fidelity.  But alas, ND has clearly chosen graphics over gameplay here, because if ND played this game along side any of the previous 3 they must have realized it was less fun moment-to-moment and kept tweaking until it was.  I've played the game twice now and it was better the second time around because I had a better understanding of the stealth and shooting mechanics throughout the entire experience, but the bland story, intermittent shooting and 30fps graphics all take their toll.  I feel really bad that this team put so much effort into a game which ends up not as fun as it ought to be.
This is an incredible piece of entertainment, Naughty Dog have once again shown they are the masters of this craft.
This game was absolutely amazing anyone who dislikes this game is clearly a hating xbone fanboy..............................................................
Note: My 10/10 has nothing to do with MP mode. I never play Uncharted MP; nor do I consider the MP mode in the price paid for the game. That out of the way, here's what I think.

9.9/10 In what could be the finale to Nathan Drake end, Uncharted 4 Thief’s End was a gorgeous; amazing new way of Naught Dog Productions telling of Nathan Drake story. A mixture of aesthetically map and story design influence from the previous games; the plane, the boat, caves, water diving, stones, treasure collectibles etc. Nathan drake, Samuel Drake, and Victor Sullivan go on the hunt for Henry Avery’s 400 million dollar lost pirate treasure, but first they must find the lost Island of Pirate utopia. The Game tells more narrative story, puzzle cyphering then actual action gameplay, however their is still a lot of action in the game just not as much Uncharted 2 Among Thieves and Uncharted 3 Drake’s Deception. The Game is more in the likeness of Drake’s Fortune when talking about mood for the game. With saying that their is a much more narrative story then Drake’s fortune and other 2 releases which is a good thing. On the gameplay side the new aim lock target is very awesome, in which the cursor is bigger and more hardened  when locked and as usually lights up red when locked and ready for fire. The game also has picture mode so you as the player can now take in game framed pictures of Drake, even though we have the share factory on PS4 it’s still a great feature by hitting down on the sticks and capturing to just share your photo instantly. The Maps are big ranging from 40 minutes to 1 hour and 15 minutes and the campaign has a prologue, 22 chapters, and a epilogue chapter going into the future years after the final chapter. All and All Uncharted 4 was the game i was waiting for and I’m thrilled with the results. I do believe this is the final chapter in Nathan Drake’s Career and the end of a generation but it went off in a bang. Thank You Naughty Dog for another brilliant story. 9.9/10

Great game.  Takes all the best stuff from the Uncharted series and perfected them in the 4th installment.  Game blends well between action and cutscenes.  The sound effect for the guns are actually much better (couldn't stand the last 3) now.  U4 is "THE"  high-end quality movie-game that will be a challenge to all developers to beat, and I don't think any game can do that for years to come.  Pacing is great; the story starts off slow because it needs to introduce several characters that was in Nate's past but never mentioned in the previous 3 games (Rafe, Sam, Nadine), to make them coherent to the plot, and right after that the game takes off.  Animation is gorgeous, facial expression is amazing, and all the characters are love-able (villains included).  Some tracks in the game are quality orchestration, but for the most part the rest are not memorable.  Gameplay is the typical Uncharted series plus grappling hook but with better animation, so don't expect great innovation in that department.  I like the darker tone of this game because it really grounds Nathan Drake and also concludes his saga (unfortunately).  A must buy for PS4 gamers.

I really felt sad at the end of the game knowing it will most likely be the last on featuring my beloved nathan drake. It felt like saying goodbye to an old friend. If you are going in not expecting COD or a normal shooter, and are open to an at times relaxing gaming experience and the most stunning technical achievement in gaming to date, with many likeable characters, go ahead and play it. And if you haven't already, play the predecessors too, as it will really make this feel as the grand finale it is.

This is my first truly "next gen" game. All of my other PS4 games have been a remake of a PS3 game, or have been multi generational/ multi platform. This is the first true PS4 game for me, and it shows. The campaign was amazing. I've been hearing some complaints about the pacing, but I felt like it was good. I don't think pacing is as important in a game overall, since you typically won't sit down and play the game in one sitting, like you would watching a film. Either way, the pacing was a little different than the other games, and the last half spends most of its time in one setting... but the entire first game was on an island, so I wasn't bothered at all. I loved the open gameplay of taking out enemies, I could really see a series like this becoming open world and working out very well. All of the mechanics were flawless. I did find myself jumping off a cliff here and there, but every time it felt like I did something stupid, whereas in previous games it was totally the game. It took me a little over 13 hours to comfortably play through it on my first run, and it could have easily been longer. There is a trophy for beating it in under 6, but I don't see that happening easily. I loved everything about the single player, and the multiplayer thus far seems great. There are "microtransactions" for coins you can earn in the game, but you don't need them at all. You can totally play the entire multiplayer experience without purchasing one thing, and still unlocking it all. I don't get the negative reviews at all, they should really be removed.

Without doubt a stunning game. Amazing visuals, deeply and loving written characters, and a significant revision of gameplay whilst staying true to the UC traditional play. Naughty Dog have taken what they learned from the Last of Us and mixed it with the best of the UC series to create an engrossing experience, with a story that went to places I did not expect (every time I thought I had it worked out, it shifted, and things that I didn't expect occurred). I finished it tonight, and realised that, whilst I wasn't crying, I had a lump in my throat.

Uncharted is the greatest video game franchise ever made and Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is probably the best game out of the four masterpieces produced by Naughty Dog. Everything you know and love about the series is back, but on a much bigger and much more detailed scale. The stellar shooting and fighting sequences blend together better than ever and the platforming, exploring aspects are a lot smoother and a lot larger than we've seen before. The amazing storytelling we are used to from the developers does not dissappoint once again, and this time it is more personal than we've been used to. The acting/voice acting is also top notch as usual, this cast is so perfect together, their performances are simply flawless. The amount of stuff you can do in the game is also outstanding, you can drive a boat, a jeep, can use a grappling hook to cimb up to places you could not before and of course treasure hunting is back as well. The epic set pieces and spectacular action scenes are here also, and as expected you will solve quite a few interesting puzzles as well. Multiplayer has a bigger focus this time around, and it is a lot of fun. The online battles are always action packed and the level designs are extremely well done. Nathan Drake's entry to the PS4 couldn't be any greater, To simply put, Uncharted 4 is the best video game made thus far. Game Of The Year, nod doubt!!!

Uncharted 4 sticks with the proven formula that has made the franchise shine amonst many other games. Gameplay wise it does not take any risks at all, but the once solid gameplay mechanics are polished beyond perfection this time arround. Shooting mechanics are improved, fire arms feel realistic, cover system is more reliable this time arround, climbing and jumping feel more responsive and natural. Uncharted 4 introduces a hook, which leads to some fantastic showcase of Nathan Drake's dexterity, and can be used in combat aswell, making the movement across the battlefield feel natural and spectacular. Stealth mechanics where added in this new entry of the series, altough minimal and basic in functions, they add a layer of depth much needed in the series, and can make your work easier when facing large gropus of enemies, though stealth is not forced upon the player at any time, and there are no real punishments for screwing over a stealth aproach, which is a good thing in these series. Uncharted 4 also showcases semi open world enviroments in some of its chapters, and offer a variety of paths to travel into, which is a neat addition to the game, but nowhere as complex as a sandbox game, but its clear that wasn't the developer's intention here.

Uncharted 4 is simply the definition of a next-gen cinematic game. The story is amazing and Nathan feel like a human more instead of a killing machine. The game is slightly flawed because of the number of climbing and sliding but the story itself makes up for it. The gameplay is great (the best in the series so far).

Having actually finished the game (unlike a lot of users here, it seems) I can tell you this is not only THE best looking game ever made on any platform (yes, that includes PC, and I'm a PC enthusiast), it's also one of the most well-designed 3rd person games I've ever played.  Epic story, excellent voice acting and characters, fun well-paced gameplay, brilliant set pieces, great multiplayer...this game has it all.

I found the story engaging, the graphics and animations top notch. The problem I find with these types of game set in real life is that Nathan Drake, Lara Croft or whatever protagonist it may be has to kill hundreds and hundreds of hench men which is kinda unbelievable, it also makes them seem like half- sociopaths for killing all these guys.. i mean i know they are 'bad', but still. At least in TLOU, they kill the infected, and in a post apocolyptic world everyone is desperate for survival, which leaves more varied enemies and also more strategy and different types of gameplay. They also arent forced to vary the gameplay by adding long platforming sequences. Even with a more fantasy type world like Batman  its more believable because hes batman and can use his gizmos and equipment, and well... he doesnt actually kill anymore. Anyway, for what it is, its a good game, and i know and feel they put their hearts and souls into it.

I don't easily give a full score, but uncharted 4 deserves it. It manages to wash away the slight disappointment of uncharted 3 and delivers a worthy finale to the series. Gameplay wise there are massive improvements on pacing, with a better balance between combat, climbing and puzzling extended with driving, diving and most importantly character development moments. You can clearly see the influence of the last of us on this game, as the writing and actngs is top notch and making this the most personal and character driven adventure of drake so far, Troy Baker is a great addition to the cast as Sam, but really Emily Rose steals the show as her best outing as Elena yet. And did I mention the game looks and sounds absolutely gourgeous. The jaw dropping vista really set some new benchmarks for game graphics. An absolutely amazing experience, definitely a GOTY contender and a must buy for anyone owning a ps4. Note, I haven't checked mp yet but really it's the sp experience is what the game is really about.

Do yourself a favor: first look at the metascore. Even gamespot rated 10, which happens once in years. No mixed or negative reviews in sight anywhere – except the satire review from Michael Thomsen of Washington Post (the real review gave Uncharted 4 a perfect score). Then check out the user-score-balance. Get it? Damn right! Opposing industry- or hater-reviews lower the score into regions completely unrealistic. Anyone somewhere close to sanity must realise that a tendency somewhere around 9 or 10 is simply the only way to go for this one. Especially those who realy played the game. Beautiful lore presented with stunning visuals and audio, immersive character design and dialogue creating a suck-you-in-and-spit-you-out-atmosphere unparalleled in the genre. Gameplay mechanics are elaborated close to perfection. Only things negative from my pov are the animations, which seem a bit flawed at times, especially when jumping, and the now and then a bit repetitive mission design. I'd rate 9/10 but have to give it a full 10 to compensate for all the zeros.

I swear to god, i am not overreacting but this is probably the best story/action game i've ever played, and i've play a LOT of them ( M.E trilogy; heavy rain; indigos prophecy; journey;the last of us; and many others ), but the pace on this game, visual art style, effects, and mechanics are all perfect, it's hard to believe

The game is utter crap. Terrible story, characters and repetitive climbing gameplay. I am not even talking about problems the game has with logic and plot. All of the elements that made Uncharted such a strong franchise last generation are here in spades. Uncharted 4 is graphically gorgeous and fluid, the character development is lovingly crafted, and the story is compelling and well paced, even if a slight bit cliche and, at times, predictable. For these reasons alone the game gets my 8 out of 10 and my recommendation that it's worth playing.

If you like the previous uncharted games, you will love this one. In my opinion, this is the best uncharted yet. as everyone else has said, the graphics are phenomenal. the game play is tighter than it has ever been, and the story is really good in my opinion too. It's a definite 10 in my book.

Gorgeous, exotic settings, exquisite graphics and silky smooth gameplay.  Utterly superb audio! (Only DICE does this equally, or sometimes better, IMHO) The interplay between characters amidst the story that unfolds is quintessential Naughty Dog....who is just the best in delivering along these lines. Everything is at once familiar yet more polished and refined in every respect.  I met with 1, maybe 2 glitchy moments on my first playthrough on normal difficulty....which was by no means easy.  Several firefights had me dying multiple times before figuring out how to clear the arena before I could move on.  Or retrying a particularly difficult climbing/navigation sequence to get to the next check point.  I was challenged and remained delighted.  The end felt noble.....right......if a bit post-climactic.  Overall, supremely satisfying as an end to the series.  Well done, Naughty Dog.  Makes me proud and feel lucky to own a PS4 :)

What an absolute gem of a game. Naughty Dog never fails to impress. Their last outing was a different genre and it was amaze-balls and this one too following UC series footsteps and striking the right chord.

#Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is a VISUALLY PATH-BREAKING MASTERPIECE with some spectacular action scenes, excellent music and a fun gameplay that allows the players to explore around the beautifully designed levels especially the stunning city of LIBERTALIA. Naughty Dog’s attention to even the smallest graphics detail is mind-blowing.
Initial notice - I usually give 10s to games that are very unique and are usually "just one in a decade". However, this game is a strong 9/10 that I increased to 10/10 for two reasons:

Lacked the big set-pieces that made the previous installment in the series so —for a lack of a better word— epic. It's not bad in any sense of the imagination, just not super, i guess i have gotten a bit tired of climbing around for 50% of 4 games.

Uncharted 4 is a great ending to a great franchise. The game was not too long nor was it short. It was just the perfect length. This game lives up to the hype. Naughty Dog does it again. It's so far the best Uncharted game that I've ever played. It's a more in depth story telling. The gameplay is really slick and smooth. Naughty Dog has done it again! The most graphically beautiful game released for this gen, an extremely well balanced narrative pace, amazing and unforgettable characters, a captivating soundtrack and a near perfect conclusion for such an awesome adventure franchise.

Unlike previous uncharted games, this game isn't as much about a careless drake who runs around creating havoc. It about an older, mature version of him who knows that he's pushed his luck too far and just wants to settle down. Unfortunately fate would not have it this way sending him on one final adventure. Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is an action-adventure third-person shooter platform video game developed by Naughty Dog and published by Sony .

Uncharted 4 was a great game with excelent writing, only let down by a lack of exciting gameplay (not set pieces, but straight up shootouts). If there were a few more action scenes and a few more guns and toys, the campaign would be near perfect. The writing is fantastic, and I have never felt as connected to these characters as I did while playing Uncharted 4. The set pieces, while non as good as the building falling in Unhcarted 2 or the plane in Uncharted 3, all are entertaining and some of them reach the best in the series. The new stealth gameplay is also good, and the grappling hook makes the platforming even more fun.

Uncharted 4 is no doubt the greatest game of this time. One more time Naughty Dog surpass itself and other today's companies. The most adventurous installment from the series with such gorgeous graphics, effects, art and scores. The spacing of shooting and exploring is well divided. And there are time you can pass using only steath with no kill, giving the players more strategy, as well as many routes to go where you shloud. Characters interactions are huge now, lots of conversations, funny and cute moments as well intriguing times. The adventure  grows insane as much as you advance the story. The only bad side is when you finish the game you missed it, you feel sorry it's the last one. At least it was brilliant end.

What can I say about uncharted 4 other than it's good. Playing through every game in the series, I have to say that is my favorite. What it does right is make the combat more active and fluid then it ever was in the previous titles. Minor/major complaint with combat is that it removed the grenade through and what can be considered a counter when doing hand to hand combat, but other than that the fire fights just feel smooth and constant that depends on the players reaction that simply on just hiding behind cover. Other than combat it's single player campaign is it's bread and butter. It's enjoyable in a "Indiana Jones" kind of way and whether that's a positive or negative it made playing every moment enjoyable for me. If anything this game is a must own for the ps4 if you have one, is it a console seller well that depends is a one of kind adventure story worth the price of admission.

Fantastic game, best Uncharted graphics easily, the combat is still fantastic but now there is also stealth if you don't want to go for gunplay, the story is great but not the best of the games and even thought I really like Sam as a companion for Nathan, Sully is still the best. All in all this is another fantastic addition to the franchise, if you like the games this is HIGHLY recommended, as are all the Uncharted games, but if you're not into this games, this one won't do much for you, this is the same Uncharted but prettier.

Uncharted is a franchise that is a true system-seller for PlayStation. The fourth entry in this franchise does not disappoint and, while not introducing anything new or ground-breaking, A Thief's End provides a satisfying conclusion to the Nathan Drake story.

This game was probably the best thing I have ever played. New mechanics, awesome game play. But what drives the heart and soul of Uncharted is the story. Naughty Dog had turned the series a bit more serious, but it doesn't mean that it isn't as funny as it is the other ones. Your heart is driven to beat at 230 bpm. and the ending is unbelievable. They had tied loose knots together and complete it in the best way possible. if you're having second thoughts on this game, then you are going to miss out. I can't wait to see what they do with the DLC.

This is, as expected, a well told adventure game with good storytelling, mystery, relying on stealth, shooting, climbing, and some puzzle elements.  It absolutely lives up to the franchise.  The length and size of the game are not disappointing.  It is exciting right up until the end.

Good game loved the series. I cannot for the life of me understand how and why they would screw up multiplayer so bad. I mean come on 5 freakin modes and the other games and way more. No team objective, elimination, the lab, co-op arena, co-op adventure or free for all. With all the delays we should have had a complete game not a half a$$ed version. One day I will learn to stop buying digital and get disc so I can trade them in because after the story is complete I can't can see myself wasting time in a this multiplayer. I played UC2 multiplayer for 3 years and loved it.

Naughty Dog is simply one of the best developers in town. Uncharted 4 is simply a trip through nostalgia town. Everything which makes Uncharted from the Nate's quips to Sully's wise cracks is truly displayed. It has some of the best action sequences. . The graphics are simply stunning. I could sit for hours staring at the vast expanse. The attention given to detail is simply spellbounding. This is the best farewell a series can get. It only strikes you at the end that the Uncharted series has truly come to an end. Nathan Drake's long journey from when we first met him 9 years in Drake's Fortune is complete.

Never quite reaches the Among Thieves level of grandiosity, but there are still a lot of awesome setpieces and its focus on story and character development is a fresh change from the action focused original trilogy.

For Nathan Drake's 4th outing, this is by far the most beautiful. Lush green environments, gorgeous landscapes and realistic looking character models: this is probably the best looking game I've ever played on any platform. The environments urge you to explore everything and during cut scenes I forgot I was playing a game as the surrounds and the characters looks life like, as if was actual people not cgi models. Many reviews about other games may have this comment about advancing the boundaries of video visuals but usually they off just enough to make you realise it's a game or enters the uncanny valley where you're at unease, therefore knowing this isn't real. A lot of the time with this game however I saw the characters as plausible actors playing out scenes in live action being filmed in real settings not all cgi and none of it off putting-ly realistic like Until dawn.

It's a real masterpiece and all, but...SAM TELEPORTS! It doesn't matter where am i climbing -especially in combat-, Sam is already there. "Ohh, you came to an entirely new place that almost no man saw before this millennium? Well, too bad, Sam is here already. Ohhhhh, you found the love of your life? Sam was here! Hey little Nathan, you came out of your loving mother? Guess who did it before you? S A M" And it's not just that he is there before you at any given time, but that he just doesn't care. And you know why he doesn't care, Nathan Break? Because he's better than you :)

Rarely does a game immerse you to the point where you actually care about the characters. Naughty dog seem to be able to achieve this feat time and time again. Uncharted 4 has set the bar so high, I struggle to see what can beat it, from the story telling to the graphics, from the mechanics to the characters, everything is flawless. The multiplayer is some of the most fun I've had on the PS4 and offers something a little different from your average shooter. Game of the year? Maybe. Best game to grace the PS4 thus far? Definitely.

Naughty Dog has a long history with the action-adventure genre, and with the latest installment in the Uncharted series, their tenure and experience with this style of game really shows. This is easily the best entry in the series thus far. With engaging characters and fantastic set-pieces, Naughty Dog didn’t disappoint for our last adventure with Nathan Drake. Every segment felt polished, important and intentional, it was refreshing to play a game where something wasn’t just thrown in to be filler. Your companions throughout your adventure also don’t feel like dead-weight, often being surprisingly helpful, whether it’s spotting enemies for you or occasionally lending you a helping hand like throwing a punch when an enemy has you in an arm-bar. Also with tons of extra un-lockable audio, visual, and game play modifiers there’s tons of replay value here for a single-player focused game.

The game looks wonderful the puzzles are fun and the story is interesting. All the locations,characters and themes are fantastic. I just feel like the game drags on at times and 5-10% of the climbing and shooting are almost "filler" but none the less an amazing game and  nice wrap up to the Nathan Drake Uncharted series.

Really enjoyed this game, strong emotional narrative drew me in quickly, nice visuals (especially sweeping natural vistas) and solid gameplay.  Let's not get carried away though, it's sometimes clunky, a little repetitive and  not original (how could it be).  I also feel they stretched It out a little too long (I accept that others feel the longer the better but personally I had less fun towards the end with the limited mechanics exhausting the fresh feeling)  Next gen gameplay is not here yet, uncharted 4 is not the game to herald that, but as I've already said it is highly enjoyable and I actually found it refreshing to play a game I can pause (unlike the persistent online games of current gen).  For me it's a classic one and done enjoy it then trade it in game.  A worthy eight but not the second coming some people are suggesting.

From the get go it was outstanding speechless brilliant game i loved the relationship between the charachters for me is this a good ending yes but every uncharted fan wants a new game even though it have ended see ya drake nice childhood to begin with

I loved it and I got the platinum of it.
Finalmente entramos na nova geração de verdade e quem está puchando ela é Uncharted. Feito com carinho, história e personagens fantásticos, obrigatório pra quem tem Playstation 4.

Ao terminar o Epílogo do jogo e começar a rolar os créditos, uma mistura de emoções apareceram, uma espécie de tristeza pelo final do jogo, uma sensação de "como queria jogar Uncharted 5 semana que vem, uma carência na realidade, mas também, ficou a sensação de como foi épica jornada de todos os uncharted's, como a Naughty Dog conseguiu mesclar as histórias de todos os jogos nesses em uma conclusão fantástica, uma alegria indescritível de ter desfrutado cada segundo dessa que para mim é a melhor IP já criada.

Uncharted 4 is without a doubt an amazing experience. The story, while unoriginal, is extremely engaging due to it's well-written characters, and well-directed cinematics. The game looks and sounds gorgeous, an is a perfect ending to the series. Where it falls short, for me at least, is its unimaginative gameplay. In terms of mechanics, this game is not very original, not at all actually. Everything this game does gameplay-wise has been done better by other games before it. Due to its incredible visuals and engaging story, this game is an obvious game of the year bait, but for me it isn't. Overall a great game that every ps4 owner should experience, but with mediocre gameplay, and little to no replay value, this game gets an 8/10 from me.

Uncharted 4 is a great polished and complete game, Naughty Dog one again show the gaming world how games should be made, there is a lot of love in this game since you can see all the attention to detail, story and gameplay. It´s one of the biggest Drake adventures, very emotional and satisfying, the game is more open now, which allows more exploration and depth, don´t expect a open world game, the game is still pretty straight forward . Graphics are among the best on the market right now, very impressive, sadly music is not as memorable as in the previous Uncharted 2 and 3. I recommend this game to be bought brand new. if you have never played a Uncharted game before, the Uncharted Nathan Drake Collection is a must buy for you, if you play Uncharted 4 without knowing the story you probably will get confused and bored pretty quick since this are Story Driven games. Saying more things about this game is just a Spoiler, so what are you waiting for, run go buy it and enjoy it for yourself.

I got this game with my PS4, and it was such a great introduction to the console. The story is amazing with so many journal entries around the game to help you further understand it. There's a great plot twist at the end of chapter 14. I don't think it's worthy of a 10 as I did encounter a few glitches, but they didn't make it unplayable. Far from it actually. The character development is really good and the characters felt like real people from the real world. I did notice that there was an absence of something supernatural like in the other games, but it's excusable. The rest of the game makes up for it. This game did appeal to me because I love grappling in games, from Just Cause to Spiderman, it's awesome. And, what do you know, Uncharted 4 has a grappling hook with excellent control on it. The combat is really good and the guns have a level of recoil that is just right on the guns. Also, I especially like how you can use guns while swinging on a rope. It's so fun to just swing out from a tower or something at spray at some people. The bonuses you get after completing the game are a really cool addition to it as it adds a lot of replay-ability. My personal favourite is the moon gravity one so enemies corpses just float off when you kill them. Now, I need to say something about the multiplayer part of it. A lot of people said that the multiplayer is absolutely awful. While it is nowhere near as good as the story, it's really not as bad as people say. It's a mediocre third person shooter. It's quite fun to play as the different characters from the main game. I have to say though, it's weird to say 5 Sully's on the same team. But anyway, a highly enjoyable game. I recommend getting it.

This is my favorite frenchize, I can only say one negative thing about it. I wish it was not so linear. Naughty dog makes great games and I played all of them, but their games have a tendency to be very linear. Anyway it's a must have in any PS4 collection!

2016's best game. The best graphics, story, and action. The best story is from Nathan Drake and his friends because of comedy and voice actors. The story has you travel across the globe in many ways. It truly outshines every other game.

Uncharted 4 provided a spectacular conclusion to the incredible Uncharted series. Not only are the visuals absolutely stunning, the story and gameplay are great as well. While the story isn't very original or complex, Naughty Dog has mastered the art of storytelling (as evidenced by this and the Last of Us) and have created great characters that you really care about (esp. if you've played the previous games).   The combat is also very fun and satisfying. Stealth has become a more viable option and this diversifies the gameplay and overall improves the experience. However, there are some climbing sections that stretch far too long and the game takes a while to get going so pacing wasn't the best for this game. The villains are also underdeveloped and not that interesting as per usual for the Uncharted series.
I as a fan of the series I'm disappointed, I miss shooting in the game, this narrative thing sucks. I really wanted to just play! I miss the 1st and 2nd Sony loser.

honestly its visuals are stunning and thats the reason I will finish it, however the gameplay to me is boring, coming from dark souls 3 and into doom right now, those are games meant to be played, but uncharted 4 is more like a movie with some shooting gameplay in between, presentation is top notch but somehow i just don't feel it in this one... sorry

One of the worst uncharted games in the series. The gameplay is non existent, jumping from one edge to another gives no  challenge what so ever. The gun fights are rare and only get exciting till the end of the game. There is a lot of filler, where you just walk around.

I need to revise my early review. I don't know why but the first chapter gun fighting was horrible for me. After moving on a little in the game and changing the default settings the game is playing much better. It's obvious to any one that the game is gorgeous so we'll see as I progress. But my overall second opinion is that the game may be a masterpiece. Sorry for my confusion. Guess I'll go play!

As a fan of the series and the studio (Last of Us, what a game!), I want to start off with saying that Uncharted 4 is a decent game,  but sadly not more than that. It has got beautiful graphics, a compelling story and nice voice acting. Unfortunately the gameplay is way to repetitive, bordering to boring at times. Get ready to climb, meet some badguys at a checkpoint, kill the badguys (with an average at best shooting mechanic and a pretty dull arsenal of weapons), look for a place you can climb for 5 minutes, then climb some more. Repeat until game has finished. One of the biggest drawbacks is the lack of innovation. The game is way to similar to its predecessors, and doesn't bring anything new to the table (except for better graphics and a new story).
People that is giving this game a zero are stupid. At least respect the developer that has put in their soul into making this game for ur. Peace of **** is what you guys are!

Foi um final esplendido, um eredo muito mais forte e lotado de reviravoltas, graficos espantosos, iluminação, efeito da agua, brilho, e tudo mais, ficou realmente perfeito! recomendo 200% pra qualquer um!
Extremely weak and cliche story and dialogue and gameplay that is mostly padding with a handful of really cool moments thrown in. Have fun pushing crates in the prettiest world ever.
To me, Uncharted 4 is a major disappointment in many ways. First of all, some context is very important for understanding why this game is so different from the previous 3 entries in the series.

One word: EPIC!, Uncharted 4 is without any doubt the best game of 2016 and one of the best games of the history. Amazing graphics, gameplay, story, its just perfect in every way. Feel bad for xboxs and pc fanboys, they will never experience this level of graphics, GOTY 2016 for sure, 10/10

I was looking forward to it. And, it wasn't really what I expected. I'm a lover of games focused on stories and Uncharted kinda failed in this aspect. There are a lot of people giving a zero score to this game - they should think again. But the thousands of people giving this game a perfect score should also. I just finished this game, and can't say it lives up to the hype.

Honestly, best game i have ever played by a mile. Everything is balanced just right.  Graphics are jaw dropping, strangly i found the opening boat scene to be the least impressive graphical moment, so i started the game feeling underwhelmed, but give it a few scenes and that all changes..

Me espere a hacer este review despues de acabar el juego, me parece sencillamente la apuesta mas alta y sorpendente hasta la fecha de naughty dog, he jugado todos los uncharted y este de lejos me parece el mejor uncharted a la fecha, me doy cuenta con uncharted 4 que no necesitamos unq playstation 4k o neo, la potencia de la play 4 se deja ver de lleno  con este uncharted 4 pues los graficos son los mejores que he jugado en play 4, es el juego mas elaborado artisyicamente que he jugado en mi vida, la histiria es profunda y exquisita, una obra de arte que merece un 10 de principio a fin, a la gente que le da 0 de calificacion a este juego, enverdad no saben de videojuegos, el mejor juego que hay actualmente para la play4 y el mejor uncharted de la serie.

It’s a good game, but not a great game. This game puts quality over quantity and feels like a chore to get through due to its repetitive gameplay.

Bad, automated platforming that was created in order to extend the playtime, bad puzzles that treat you like a child, linear level design with no freedom or real creativity put in them, mediocre-to-bad shooting mechanics that has every single flaw of those typical console tps from 2006 including over the shoulder camera aka "blind zones generator". Primitive close combat that has nothing on RE6, annoying QTE and general lack of difficulty even on hardest modes... I hate this series.

Uncharted has in this sequel been stripped from its colorful adventurus tone and graphics. Nathan is suddenly reclined to brake any rules or stray from home, and gives the game a negative and boring feeling. Uuuh, another adventure... Towards the end the graphics gets better, and is in the dense green foliage truly quite amazing, but level design is not great. The semi open levels become a tedious shore to investigate. The epilogue introduces an intresting character. I would still hold Uncharted 2 as my favorite, an this 4th installment as my least favorite one. For the first time in the series I also experienced motion sickness! Great job on adding that to the mix ;) 7 or 8 would be my score, but I settle for 7 because I know the dogs can do better.

The story is wonderful. The visual is gorgeous. Voice, dialog, even face expression of the, all state of the art. But there is way way way too much climbing. Finding which rock to jump on is NOT fun, especially when you have unlimited time to think. I often found myself doing nothing but climbing for 5 minutes. Shooting is mediocre, can't really tell the difference between different guns. By the way, driving that jeep is surprisingly fun.
This game is a masterpiece! Hands Down the best Naughty Dog game to date.

Could have been much better, the graphics is blurred down by annoying  chromatic aberration photo filter ,focus like blur and compressed visual dynamic range that makes half of the game an annoying last gen looking crap, the other half shows graphically what could have been if they wouldn't overfilter the other areas.

Uncharted 4 is an average (not bad but not great) game with stupid puzzles and dated gun fight arena. After the excellent Last of Us I was expected a lot more from Naughty Dogs. Uncharted 2 will stay the best Uncharted ever and the third one the worst.
Everyone is saying that people who rates this game lower than 8 is trolling, I'm gonna prove this is wrong.

So I've beaten this game once already and I'm on my second time going through it, and for the most part the game lives up to and surpasses the hype. The graphics, audio, controls, voice acting, gameplay, and action are superb.  The only small complaint I have about the game is that most of it feels too much like past Uncharted games.  The rope swinging, sliding down mountain sides, and the welcome addition of auto aim/lockon are all welcome additions, but they don't do enough to make Uncharted 4 seem like a huge step forward.  Nonetheless though, it's probably the best PS4 game so far, and one of the top games I've ever played!  Well Dunn Naughty Dog, 10/10!

It is very obvious that the creation and subsequent success of The Last Of Us has had an enormous impact on Uncharted's development. The development and depth of the characters involved is more immersive and compelling then the entirety of the last 3 games put together. At its heart is a very polished and accomplished control system that succesfully implements some new gameplay elements (while relying quite heavily on some old concepts, gotta love those crates!) and gives you as a player a meaty selection of options on how to progress through each set piece.
Don't be fooled by these fakes here giving this master piece a hilarious 0 score, if you liked previous uncharted games you'll like this one.

Graphics and story line is good, pretty much what I expected. However, online game is very disappointing. The online game is very primitive and you get bore too fast. If they can improve online gaming this game could be really good. I bought this game instead of renting it, because I thought the online game was going to be pretty good and  I could spend more time on it and not  just finishing the story. I bought this half price and still had buyer's remorse. Clearly the developers want to make movies but if this had the gameplay elements and mechanics removed it would be an even worse movie than it is a game. The gameplay itself is shallow, boring and repetitive. The story didn't know if it was a action adventure or a relationship drama. Just amazed at the high scores people are giving this.

I don't know how Naughty dog keeps doing it but they did it again, this game is a masterpiece from the moment the opening text popped up on the screen to the end of the epilogue... this game is great by itself but if you played the first 3 prior to this game it gives you a sense watching a great TV show that wraps up a excellent series with one hell of a series finale. this is how to do nostalgia, there were so many references to past games and moments that if you experienced the entire story it just hits you right in the feels, every sequel they improve on the one that came before and this one is No different, This was the best Uncharted story of the 4 and I feel edged out Uncharted 2 as the king of the franchise, so many games have a great beginning and middle and then drop the ball on the ending and that's always disappointing but Uncharted 4 didn't fall into that trap... the beginning was great, the middle was excellent and the ending was superb, I know games often get criticized for their story telling but the uncharted franchise can teach clinics on how to do stories right in games, if this is the final uncharted game it was a perfect send off... 10 out of 10

I am usually a big fan of the Uncharted franchise, but I can't help but being quite disappointed with this one. Everything is very much predictable and the gameplay was a bit tedious to me and the quests almost felt more like a chore or burden rather than enjoyment. Also what's with the rope/spiderman thing? The game is filled with boring clichés and it is as if every time you're climbing then a brick or a piece of rock break and you know you are not gonna fall down anyway. Great great graphics - glad I'm done with this game and the fact I borrowed it from a friend.
Simply one of the best games of all time. Best uncharted yet. Fantastic visuals gameplay and story. Trully art. Don t listen to fools which give 0 or 2 to 10. Must buy

Uncharted 4 if a final homage to the series, and a great one at that. All that being said there still alot of help me lift this, give me a boost, here i'll catch you which is kind of a trade mark of uncharted but just seems like a chore at this point. That's my only real gripe with the game.

Best Uncharted to date, a true must play. Naughty Dog is MASTER...A MASTER of the craft that is video gaming! Very few games around this day and age deserve a perfect score but this game has earned the **** out of it.

I have some reservations with the narrative flow of the game and the absurdity of the setting, some reservations about the fact the magical/supernatural totally disappeared from this episode, some reservations about the flavorless antagonists (plot wise and action wise), some reservations about a number of little aesthetic or narrative missteps (the like or which were almost nonexistent in The Last of Us), BUT two things shocked me in this fourth installment:

Uncharted 4 is a masterpiece of storytelling, design, graphics, sound and pretty much everything else. The first 3 were great fun with simple stories and basic character relationships however Uncharted 4 thank to Neil Druckman delivers a more adult story and relationship themes which as a 31 year old bloke had me emotionally involved. Gameplay is greatly improved as is the climbing mechanics from previous instalments.

el mejor juego de accion creado hasta la fecha sin duda el mas frenetico y divertido grandes graficos mejor historia y un gran exclusivo el cual no llegara por desgracia ni a microsoft ni a nintendo toda una gran pena, volviendo al juego es un 10 no hay mas palabras que definan a esta gran Obra Maestra

Uncharted 4 is a wonderfully crafted adventure, about family, sacrifices, loss and maturity. Set three years after the events of Uncharted 3, Nate and Elena are married. They live in New Orleans, where Elena is a free-lance Journalist, and Nate works for a salvage company called Jameson Marine. Their normal, mundane life comes to a halt when Sam Drake (Nate`s older brother) comes back into his life, who was thought to be dead for 15 years, who needs Nathan`s help to find Henry Avery`s $400 million worth in treasure and jewels. The story in Uncharted 4 and the way it arcs is the best in the series by far, as it has a deeper and more engrossing plot, with more at stake this time round.
The game is very good, but not enough for a perfect score.

Excelente jogo para fechar a franquia com estilo. Claro que o jogo também tem seus problemas, mas isso não tira os méritos da Naughty Dog e todas as pessoas envolvidas no processo de criação desse game. Pela primeira vez nessa geração de consoles consegui perceber a qualidade gráfica. Outro ponto que não passa despercebido são os pequenos detalhes de colisão, destruição e gravidade, o que faz com que a experiência no jogo seja completa e fluída.

Beautiful game, with many plots, and contains an amazing story and a super graphic.
Jogo lindo graficamente, linda historia, belos combates. Simplesmente o melhor jogo ja feito de 2016 e se bobiar melhor dessa geracão de consoles!!
Easily the best game of this generation by far.Bravo naughty dog.Amazing story graphics gameplay set pieces.The second best uncharted only to uncharted 2

Worst game ever. It offers nothing new to the franchise. Music is bland. The story is boring. Options are poor. This is the worst game i have ever played. Most people who play this are letting the previous game's in this franchise dictate how good this game is. Not worth the money i put down.

Uncharted 4 is a good and solid game. But in light of the previous installments in the series as well as Naughty Dog's The Last of Us, it unfortunately does not reach the bar of excellence that was rightly expected of it. I would (regrettably, but objectively) score this game a 7.5/10. Here is my breakdown of some key aspects:
muito  muito chato parece a copia do 3 pouco se fez para esse jogo ser muito bom . o multiplayer nossa não tem servido dedicado aqui no brasil ta muito ruim de jogar

After quite enjoying the Nathan drake collection and seeing the gameplay trailers was certain this was gonna be a complete classic. Unfortunately after the 2 hours of cut scenes you have to get through to even start the game I was already gutted. If the story was made into a film it would be totally unwatchable and does not even compare to something like National treasure 2 with Nicholas Cage.

Fantastic looking game, but that is about it. The game is amazing the first 4 hours until the constant combat and climbing gets boring. You do the do the same thing all the time, the climbing is not challenging at all and the combat is fun for a little while. The story is meh, the characters are meh. The only change in combat is the last fight and it's not even cool or a fun fight. The story is alright.

Drake is an orphan. He was raised by SULLY. This was obvious in the first three games but this was abandoned for a weak sub-plot including an orphanage and Drake's loser brother, Sam,  The entire design of this game echos The last of us" since the men behind it created that game. It is DARK. The characters are designed darkly. Pretty Elena looks awful. They didn't use Greg Edmond's fantastic uplifting major key score and instead went with depressing minor key themes by Henry Jackman a third rate composer compared to Edmond. Regardless of game play, they have destroyed what Drake was all about and introduced a loser brother to drag the plot down into satisfying drug lords. Drake wanted treasure and to follow history not to be forced into finding loot for a scum drug lord to get his idiotic brother out of trouble. The entire plot is so unlike the characters we loved from the first three games that it is unrecognizable. I was fearful from the start when I read the the producer for the first three was replaced and what I expected is exactly what I found and it is not a good direction AT ALL. These characters meant something to me in the first three. In the fourth, I do not care at all.

Amazing game for the little you get.  Fast paced action, great story.  beautiful graphics, half the time i cant tell when a cut scene ends.  BUT... its only about 15 hours.  Not nearly long enough for a 80 dollar game.

This is an enjoyable linear platformer that regular turns into a shoot Em up. Not as many 'woah' moments as number 3 (I think there were only 2 of these). Very good graphics, brilliant voice acting. But an only okay storyline, and it's hard to really care about the quest. I suspect the high ratings are a result of critics getting caught up in the hype and we will see scores head south as the initial gloss wears off. It's not a game I plan on replaying but it was fun for a time and it's a decent length. It's exactly what you expect it to be; which is a fun romp around the world, shooting a lot of goons, solving simple puzzles, good acting and an interesting story to follow. This isn't going to set the world on fire though.

Graficamente é o melhor que já vimos nessa geração, tudo muito trabalhado e extremamente cuidadoso nos detalhes, a parte sonoro é muito pouco notada e na maioria dos momentos tem apenas o som de ambiente e mais nada, a jogabilidade é idêntica as versões anteriores e nada foi acrescentado exceto a mentirosa corda by Spiderman "ridícula", a história pouco tem a acrescentar e tudo torna-se previsível e chato no qual os próprios aliados que nos acompanha no jogo nos diz onde seguir bastando-nos apenas colocar o direcional para frente e apertar o botão de pulo ou escalada, até a metade do jogo tudo segue relativamente bem, porém da metade para frente o nível técnico e realista começa a cair e não se mantém mais e assim segue até o final num estilo chupinhado de Tomb Raider, realmente um jogo sem nenhum valor de replay, pois não é prazerosa sua jogatina e o torna apenas um game de visitação nas fases abertas afim de visualizar seus gráficos e isso sela a história de Uncharted nessa nova geração falida dos consoles!

Uncharted 4 really is a beautiful game with a good adventure story. The Graphics are maybe the best so far that I have seen on PlayStation 4 system. The characters are really well made and also their voice acting and animation on cut scenes are pleasant for the eyes and ears (got slightly exited that Troy Baker was playing Sam).

Disappointing and predictable as usual just when you jump, climb and have more near fatal falls than a drunk hiker, you go on solves the puzzles and bang a wall falls and the enemy just happen to rock up all the time. They absorb bullets like COD and just become repetitive and dull, The fight scenes are sluggish and too long. Better than Drakes fortune not as good as uncharted 2.
Here are some thoughts from a screenwriter's perspective.

Remember when Naughty Dog made good games? Crash 1 was a classic, same with Crash 2, Crash 3 and Crash Team Racing. The Uncharted series is a bad joke, a Tomb Raider clone with more dumb shooting and the most generic protaganist ever.

I loved the original 3 Uncharted but I can't help but feel that something dirty went on between Sony and review sites with the amounts of undeserved critical acclaim this game has received. Why do I say that? It feels phoned in, it feels like a game where the Last of Us creative team took over halfway through development. Because this game goes for long stretches where it is just completely boring. One level should have been called Nathan and Elena take a leisurely drive. If it wasn't for the opening sequence the first hour of the game wouldn't have had any action at all, unless you consider playing the original Crash Bandicoot exciting.

If not the fact i was gonna buy it anyway to see how story ends, i would have felt kinda cheated by all these 9 and 10 reviews. Game is quite boring, i dont care about story and characters (especially Nathans brother) and im kinda forcing myself to finish this game (im near the end). Gameplay is dull, repetitive and not fun at all, stealth sucks, shooting unfortunately also sucks (enemies can respawn from all sites even if 5 seconds before they werent there), climbing looks ridiculous and kinda impossible to perform in real life (its not that fluid and looks worse than in other games, you dont feel that you are using muscles to jump or climb up, animations of jumping/climbing can be horrible if game decides that you grabbed impossible to touch ledge).

Not a BAD game, but absolutely generic and blown out of all proportion by hype and marketing. I was expecting something amazing after the years of anticipation. In reality it held my interest sparingly at times, and pretty good at others, but overall it wasn't the best game I have played in the last 12 months. In fact it wasn't in my top 5.

Despite all the hype/fuss bout this game's reputation, uncharted 4 is one of the most over-rated games, despite the fact that this game has one of the best visual experiences ever and a very good plot when comes to the story, it still lack the ability to stand up for its game-play, it actually has a more movie-game approach. In uncharted 4 you're bound to do only 3 things, firstly find your way through which is most the time is just right in front of you and I personally didn't spend much time looking around when searching for my way around, secondly very low amount of super easy puzzles with "hints", finally killing some enemies, which makes this game basically a movie-game where you spend $60 to get and 12 hours to finish.

Uncharted 4 was an alright game in some aspects but fell flat in others. The story was pretty good and I enjoyed the characters, however the gameplay aspect of the game is where it fell flat. Cover detection was pretty bad so Drake would end up blocking himself somewhere I didn't want him and I would wind up being punished for the controls making a decision that I didn't want to make. Climbing was also frustrating at times in the game with the detection not following through on several occasions. Another thing to add is the gunplay. compared to other shooters the controls for aiming felt stiff and up close fighting with opponents just felt really sloppy. The reason i'm giving this a 6 is because this is a video game, not a movie, so if the gameplay is flawed then it hurts the game altogether, no amount of cinematic marvel or emotional story can make up for those faults.

When I learnt that Amy Hennig was replaced by Neil Druckmann during the development of Uncharted 4, I feared the worst. A globe trotting adventure filled with wonder, mystery and excitement like Indiana Jones was going to turn into a chase movie called National Treasure. Yes, some of the action sequences were very well crafted and amazing to play through. Uncharted 4 was the most technically polished installment and a sight to behold in the whole franchise. However, it was the pacing of the story in the third act that dragged it down like a 4x4 jeep struggling through thick mud.
Simply amazing graphics fail to make up for the hollow characters, predictable plot line, simple puzzles, and linear in-game play.

Heres hope'n they take that story telling swash genius to different genre. A space adventure would be nice.

On day one you wont find dynamic maps, horde mode, co-op , machinima video editing or customization in its multiplayer Nor will you find more than 4 multiplayer modes .What you will find however is a microtransaction store begging you to spend uncharted points the new currency to unlock fan favorites characters from the series . Most of the reviews for this title seem to concentrate on how the game looks, rather than the experience. There is no doubt it looks stunning, even though some people might criticise the game for running at 30fps, it feels smooth throughout. There is absolutely no doubt the game is a well crafted and a lot of time and passion has gone into giving the series it's final chapter. My problems with the game is that it is just so underwhelming. Once the credits rolled I looked back on my adventure, compared it against others of the series and felt hollow. The large scale ridiculous set pieces that the Uncharted series is known for are unfortunately sparse. As a result, it fizzles, instead of bangs. A damp squib. On top of this, the puzzles aren't nearly as well crafted, often only taking a small amount of thought to solve. Most of the game revolves around climbing, walking and shooting, which although was exciting in previous adventures, feels frankly dated. The storyline (no spoilers) does excel, due to Naughty Dog reigning it in a little. With the last of us Naughty Dog have seemed to really hone excellent characterisation and some more poignant, sentimental moments. The same applies here. Overall, the story is not quite as ridiculous as the other games. This foot planted in an element of (far fetched) reality does give it the grounding it needs, but does make it a little dull as a result. It's a good game, enjoyable no doubt. Just don't expect to be as blown away as the critics make out.
