This game is decent. The gameplay is generic and repetitive. "Go here, get confused, climb, shoot." I've played a lot of games like this, but it's striking in this game. The gameplay literally never changes thing up (except for that part where you play a different game), and at least one part of it, the climbing, is a dull mind numb. The story is a throwaway, and the cinematics are overly long and boring. I couldn't find myself caring about the characters, because I disliked the repetitive gameplay so much. The twists in the story aren't predictable, but they are dumb. In hindsight, I still never would have guessed them, and, yet, I wasn't surprised in the least. I was more focused on finishing this chore than enjoying the ride.

Imnecesario y olvidable, va de juego maduro y serio para acabar en estupidos tiroteos palomiteros rematando una historia mediocre y anodina. El juego carece de personalidad copia y en esta entrega acaba copiando elementos como el sigilo de los Batman, el plataformeo de Tomb Raider (Gancho/escalada con herramientas) o marcar enemigos a lo Assassin's Creed. Los puzzles son irrisorios, del nivel de niño de 5 años y la IA enemigo es completamente inexistente. El juego en si es un desproposito que ni siquiera cumple graficamente, las pobres texturas, un motion blur horrible, un patetico framerate de 30fps y el 90% del tiempo lo pasas metido en cuevas con texturas de rocas. Para colmo el juego termina con un QTE, si, un QTE como The Order. Esperemos que ND pase página y deje de arrastrarse por unos cientos de miles de dolares, el peor de toda la saga, incluido el de VITA.

in my opinion, its a one-day game. After 10 hours you can throw away it, and never comie back. Very poor gameplay and boring story trying to hide in not bad visuals. Its NOT a game its a MOVIE.

Uncharted makes a return on PS4. While it may not do much new for the series in terms of gameplay, developer Naughty Dog is at the top of it's game yet again ensurign there's plenty of fun to be had here. Whether you're looking for satifying storytelling, tense multiplayer, or a grand, treasure hunting adventure Uncharted 4 delivers. To make things even better it does so with some of the best graphics on the market.

Several years after his last adventure, retired fortune hunter, Nathan Drake, is forced back into the world of thieves. With the stakes much more personal, Drake embarks on a globe trotting journey in pursuit of a historical conspiracy behind a fabled pirate treasure. His greatest adventure will test his physical limits, his resolve, and ultimately what he is willing to sacrifice to save the ones he loves.
Uncharted 4 is a very good piece of story telling with a very limited, simple game tagged on.

Anyone who has gave this game a 0, is either 1: an Xbox fanboy, who is absolutely salty that the best game this generation is not on Xbox or 2: Hasn't played the game and is just hating. They also contradict themselves by saying positive things example graphics, gameplay etc but still drop a 0.
A mixed bag of an ending. Lots of haters/fan boys as usual,  I’m sitting on the fence with a 6.
My take on this game ... YAOOOOOOOOOOO!

Too much boring story and repetitive game play in between. Glad when it was over... but no.. epilogue... I almost died. When do they finally stop this? 7 because of excellent graphics and animation. But Rise of the Tomb Raider easily is the better game.

It might be the BEST looking console game ever, voice acting is better than many Hollywood movies, and the story alone is a 10. Greatness Is Here!! Uncharted 4 is a MUST HAVE!

esse sem sombra de duvidas e o melhor uncharted da franquia graficos estao absurdamentes incriveis, historia envolvente, personagens marcantes e gameplay divertida fazem desse game um titulo obrigatorio pra qualquer dono de ps4, naughty dog obrigado por existir e obrigado por fazer parte da familia playstation.

The game is beautifull and the story is amazing, specially if you play the trilogy before. But it's suffer the same problems than before: shooting is not so good;  stealth is too simple, you don't have elements to do it well and you have none benefit of doing it; the game still pushing off of the history with useless treasures and "pixel-hunts", despite it's don't make sense when you think how Drake is diferent here than the other games. But still worth it.

Love this game so far. Great addition to the series and cannot wait to finish it. There are some great easter eggs such as one scene where you sit down and play a Playstation 1. Sounds just pull you back in time!

Uncharted 4 is like the next action movie hit. It comes all in and entertains you from start to finish, you might even play through it or sections of it again, but once you are done, unless you are into this type of 3rd person multiplayer with superpowers, you won't replay it anytime soon.

In Nathan Drake's final chapter in the Uncharted series, Naughty Dog says goodbye to its protagonist of 10 years in a beautiful display of technical mastery. The swan song that the franchise deserves, Uncharted 4 wraps up Nathan's story as well as answers questions that long time fans have been asking over the years. A bitter-sweet end to one of my favorite action adventure games, but one that left me satisfied with an ending that I'm grateful for.

I am left speechless. Everything about this game, the story, the characters, voice actors, animations and last but certainly not least the graphics are amazing. I both hate and love the game. I love it because it's one of the best games I ever played. Hate it because it's ruined other video games for me. The characters are so lifelike they feel real. You get attached to this story about the bond of two brothers that you're left with a sad feeling in the gut when you realized the story has ended :( Well done ND, there hasen't been a video game to impact me in such a way like a good novel or film would until this game and Last of Us. You deserve all the praise for your hard work!

Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is nothing short of a video game masterpiece! A remarkable work of art both visually and storytelling wise. I have beaten the story mode twice and I am still flabbergasted by how outstanding it was. The introduction of Sam into the series was superb; it did not feel awkward or rushed. Sam is a very well crafted character that I loved right from the start. Rafe and Nadine were also introduced very well as strong antagonists. Rafe totally stole the show though. He was a genuine sociopath; I could tell he was off from the get-go. I would not want to cross that guy in real life. I really learned a lot about Henry Avery, Thomas Tew, and all of the other pirates that were presented in the game. The historical aspects of the game overall were perfect. The storytelling was the best I have ever seen in any medium. It kept me captivated all the way through and I personally could not wait for the next beautiful cut scene! The best action-adventure video game ever made. Naughty Dog has done it again!
Great ride from start to finish. Pretty varied to in terms of gameplay.

Good graphics and physics . Bad shooting . Headshot is so hard . Good story . Good game overally .multiplayer is fun . YOU SHOULD PLAY IT .i want to submit the damn review but . Cant cause i didnt reach 150 words .

Let's get the obvious out of the way, Uncharted 4 has the best graphics I have seen to date on the PS4. Uncharted brings back the magic of games for me, it leaves me picking my jaw up off the ground over and over. I love uncharted games for the excellent visuals and intriguing story, Naughty Dog have delivered another classic game that is a MUST play. The best game from Naughty Dog whitch I played on PS4. This game is the main reason for buying PS 4 console, great graphic, great dialogues, great everything!

Uncharted 4 tells us magnifically the ending of Nathan's adventures (at least in games), it has gorgeous enviroments, excelent mechanics and a great story letting us know more about his life. it's fun, interesting and captures all our attention from the begining until the end. The multiplayer is very fun and I haven't seen any bugs but it misses the survival mode like in Uncharted 2 and 3 to play with friends and it has less maps, but maybe we'll get them as dlc later.

Uncharted 4: A Xbox's end. This is a console selling game which puts the Xbox owners to shame.

I absolutely LOVE this game! It has great gameplay and an even better story. it focused more on the story than the action. And don't get me wrong the action was truly amazing too. The graphics were the best I have ever seen. The game was way better that the previous 3,

Reading the negatives, I get what they are saying, but as an Uncharted fan who doesn't do multiplayer, I loved it. It was Uncharted through and through, and you'd better like the series if you want to enjoy this entry. It was a very satisfying close to Nathan Drake's career. I've replayed the other's three times each over the years, and I'll replay this one as well.

I first beat U4 on Crushing difficulty, which is the hardest possible difficulty. And one thing I wish I was told before going down this path is to not do the first play-through on Crushing. It is not as rewarding to beat the game on the hardest possible difficulty on the first try as it is in other games. The reason for that is because there is one key elements that is removed in Crushing that is available otherwise. That feature is the stealth mode. In Crushing, stealth mode is almost useless many of the times. U4 makes stealth a bigger part of the core gameplay in comparison to previous tittles. You are still able to stealth through certain levels and be able to maybe kill a few guards before essentially being forced to go commando, but the ability for guards to notice you in Crushing is significantly easier and there is no detection meter nor marking capabilities. If you really care to stealth 100% of the time then you may, but it will take a lot of practice without the two features mentioned prior. Not only is it excrutiating to stealth on Crushing, but there is no real reward for doing so. The game does not even encourage stealth gameplay like others do. For example, you will never find a silenced weapon and there is no penalty for going guns blazing shortly after the encounter started Please heed my advice and enjoy the game on another difficulty before Crushing on your first play-through. The game is absolutely beautiful and the story is amazing. I just wished I didn't play it on Crushing the first time so I could enjoy the game more.
the story doesn't seen so complicate but it is!!!you have to search for that .the graphic is fantastic no words can describe it .long story short you 're gone live in this game :))

I have yet to play this games but confident we have another masterpiece here. The franchise is my all time favourite. Now as so many user reviews have given it 0/10 without playing the game as they are xbone fans only, i feel i can also score this game without playing it which I give a 10.

I started the uncharted series this year with nathan drake's collection. I have never played the ps3 versions so ı've played the whole serie in 2 months. The main subject of uncharted is really cool. Sure, climbing and sliding feel extremely fun at the beginning, but it gets tedious really fast. At some point of the game, I felt so underwhelmed that I almost gave up on the game because I don't want to climb over a freaking hill to progress the story line.
Really,really good game and one of my favorite  franchises.The story and graphics are great but sometimes it can be a bit repetitive Overall one of the best games of the year

My favorite UC game to date.  The story telling and voice acting is superb.  The game looks very good and the stealth combat is fun.  The game is not without flaws however.  The non-stealth combat is very clunky and not fun.  The cover system is borderline broken.  Often you'll stick to the wrong wall or simply roll past it out into the open to be destroyed by the enemy....on the flip side, when you don't want to stick to something you'll get caught on a corner when running past.
Visually & Technically decent, even gorgeous at some moments, but short, empty, repetitive and a bit boring.

Climb Climb Climb shootout shootout cutscene climb climb shootout climb cutscene shootout cutscene climb climb climb, that's uncharted 4 in a nutshell a tired old formula with nothing new. It's enjoyable at times but never reaches any great heights.

Uncharted is, perhaps, the best game i ve ever played. Gorgeous balance between drama and adventure. This game  definitely deserves to be played and can be considered as a full cultural phenomenon.

Uncharted 4 is a self-aware action/adventure romp. It knows its strengths and its weaknesses. The graphics are some of the best I've seen on a console, characters are mostly believable and the action continues at a workable pace throughout. As far as gameplay, the climbing could become annoying if you don't enjoy variations of the same thing. For the most part, I could understand why someone wouldn't like this aspect. Everything else such as the shooting and movement is very well-done. The story is in service of the action, which is what a good action film should be.

Compelling narrative. Beautiful. Perfect send off for Nathan Drake. The game was fantastic through and through.  A must play and makes Uncharteds 1-3 a must play in order to truly love and appreciate how good this game is!

Una de las mejores sagas que yo he jugado a lo largo de mi vida, esta ultima entrega (espero salgan mas) me ha agradado para poner fin a las grandes y emblemáticas experiencias que hemos pasado con nuestro protagonista " Nathan Drake"

Un bon filme .... a oui il faut joué pardon je n'avait pas remarqué vus la facilité déconcertante du jeu et l'impression que le jeu joue  notre place malgré un jeu très beau et parfois très cool mais dans 60% du temps on ce fais chier !

The game suffers a bit from pacing issues and maybe lacking a few more gunfight sequences but nonetheless, a masterpiece from a gameplay standpoint with the climbing, rope swinging, other fun and varied gameplay moments on the boat at the start of the game, the car chase scene hanging from the rope, the collapsing bell tower and the chase set piece while on the motorbike. This backed by the best story telling in video games today with top quality voice acting. The technical levels of this game achieved has also help you appreciate the game even more not just because how good the graphics are but how the level of detail and physics helps you become more immersed in the game. Immersion is also further assisted by the second to none facial animations and motion capture which is important when looking at the characters and caring about their journey. Overall a near masterpiece with great multiplayer as a bonus for your moneysworth.

Another work of art, by Naughty Dog. I love this franchise since the first game. The second game is a complete masterpiece, the third one is still good (though not as great), and the fourth one is just incredible.

There are a few pacing issues, and the gun-play isn't quite as solid as it could be, but the highs more than outweigh the few lows making for a fantastic action adventure title. If this is indeed the final game in the series it is certainly a fitting end.

Naughty Dog has proven yet again that they're masters of game storytelling. Amazing story, amazing gameplay, environments/graphics have never looked better in any other game. Every little detail has been thought out. The whole thing plays like a AAA action adventure... reminds me of Indiana jones often. It's insane how much painstaking detail each environment has, completely immerses you in the story with characters that you actually feel for, characters that developed since the past three games. Amazing voice acting and animations, most real life I've ever seen atleast. Absolute must play and the best action adventure game you can get right now. And the closure that undying UC fans got is brilliant.

This is beautiful game. I've must have said to myself "OMG How beautiful this game is" a 100 times when playing it. Truly 10+ title. Acting is superb, music is superb, story is superb and graphics are just gorgeous. This is the closest it can get to blend movie with games. The only negative of this game that i can think of is that it will eventually end.I want more of Drake adventures.

Ever wanted to see a good adventure flick lately? Well, you won´t find it at the cinema, but on PS4. Beautifully animated, lovely characters, nice voice-overs, interesting story and everything combined with state of the art technique. This is how a good action-adventure game should look like nowerdays! Thumbs up!

Naughty Dog delivers yet again with great gameplay and storytelling. Nate is back, rusty but lovable as ever as we hunt for pirate treasure in the beautiful land of Madagascar. You have amazing companions like Elena, Sully and the newest addition, Sam. He has already become one of my favourite characters in this short time, so much so that he absolutely deserves his own title, just as Sully does. This is a must play because of a superb story, great gameplay and an impeccable cast back together one final time. Can't miss this one.

In my opinion, GOTY 2016. Well crafted narrative story and the gameplay mechanics are so fluid. The AI companion is very good just like in The Last of Us. The only negative I can really say about this game is the occasional dip in fps. Other than that, you're definitely missing out on a fantastic game if you have not played it.

The fantastic presentation feels like overcompensation for bland, uninspired gameplay. Two games ago, this series went all-out on incredible set pieces. And Uncharted 3 somehow took the set piece virtuosity to the next level with its ship level.  But in Uncharted 4, it feels like everything about the adventure got more chill and predictable. The only big improvement is in details and smaller effects. Overall, it's kind of great, but also run-of-the-mill and a retread of past classic games that were truly inventive.

Uncharted 4 is Naughty Dog's latest Uncharted game, and features Naughty Dog's trademark high production values applied to an Indiana Jones style action-adventure game. Art, sound, animations, and cutscenes are excellent all around. The cast deliver superb voice and mocap performances. The story involves Nathan Drake going on one more adventure to look for pirate treasure, in an effort to save his older brother Sam. Typical Uncharted fare, though the addition of Nate's brother and the exploration of Nate's relationship with his wife Elena helped bring some depth to a main character that's always been fairly generic. The antagonists this time around were not as compelling as previous games. The character Nadine in particular felt like a "badass chick" trope that was thrown in to appease the feminists. The game itself was too long, and could have been 14 chapter game instead of 20. There were some overly long walk and talk sections, and many of the platforming sections started to repeat themselves. The gameplay remains a mix of combat with platforming and some puzzle solving. There are also some new Tomb Raider style mechanics in the pickaxe and the grapple rope. The platforming and puzzles are the series biggest strengths, and they are showcased well in this game.

7.5/10. What you see is what you get with this one. It is a blockbuster action movie played by you. That doesnt sound too innovative and amazing, but many games dont have it, at least not on the same scale, and if one wants to play a blockbuster action, instead of watching it, he will have a good time. Downsides: like any action blockbuster, 1 go is enough, theres little replayability. But that 1 go is an exciting, adrenaline pumping, kinetically spectacular go through epic, bullet sprayed locations, and dank hideouts of legendary killers of ages past, that are still carrying their old glory. Thats the upside. But its a 1 ticket flight. There are little variations in how the enemies can be engaged, but thats it. Its a rail action adventure, but one of the best.
Five Word Review: What you expect from Uncharted.

Having played every Uncharted except the PS Vita game, I can say firmly that Uncharted 2 and 3 are the best starring Nathan, perfect 10s. Uncharted 4 has the best, most personal story, but the pacing is off and the gameplay, though it has a few bright spots, is overall just average. There is nothing like the tremendous set pieces of Uncharted 2 or 3, or of Lost Legacy.

Naughty Dog delivers again in my opinion.  Stunning Graphics, Great Story and Fun Gameplay.  A fitting end for one of my favorite characters of all time.  If you hate this game I really don't know what else you would want.

While much game play remains unchanged, the addition of a grapple line, stealth and driving work really well in UC4 and where the game really shines is in the storytelling and pacing.  A well crafted and fitting end to the series.

Uncharted 4 is a pig with such exquisite lipstick you won't mind rolling around in the mud with it for a day or so. Production values, especially with the animations, voice acting, lighting and textures, not to mention bombastic set pieces, are so mesmerizing I often wandered casually around the levels just to soak it all in. In this regard, the game truly feels next gen.
Uncharted 4 is a very good game but does not live up to the greatness of Uncharted 2 and 3. The cutscene/acting are top notch ! It's technically impressive and is the best looking game out there!

The same old story structure. Another gigantic lost city that is NOT discovered by modern means like satellites... and off course massive destruction of old building around the globe... I don't know. It's a game already done 3 times. The form is perfect, the game is really neat and beautiful. But the rest of it just lacks inventivity, renewal. I liked the game but was disappointed in the end. Naughty dog should have done a new IP instead and just let Uncharted a trilogy.

Sony has been getting a reputation for its story-driven games, and in that regard the Uncharted series is the company’s crowning jewel. I’m usually not very fond of such titles, as they can often get lost in their movie-wannabe aspirations to the point of severely affecting the gameplay. Uncharted 4, however, won me over by combining pristine level design with an unusually slick amalgamation of gameplay and storytelling.

The game has the best visual and the smoothest gameplay of all UC games. The level design is also quite good, the story is decent. As the last UC games, I found the ending is fulfilling and satisfying. However, I felt the pacing is odd and as epic as the setpieces are, it didnt blow me away like UC2, or even UC3. IMO, I enjoyed uc2>uc3>uc4>uc1. Maybe the change of the director made UC4 a little bit too serious for me. still a must have game for ps onwers...
Uncharted 4 is a fiting, yet at the same time unfulfilling, end to the series.
The most anticipated game for the PS4 delivers on all counts. Naughty Dogs final Uncharted game, presented on a grand scale! Epic storytelling, epic graphics, epic sound effects and music.

Увидел игру еще при анонсе, но пока было во что играть не покупал. При очередной распродаже приобрел. С 1 минуты я был очарован этим произведением! Naughty Dog vuelve a hacer una gran obra con unos personajes que podrían ser los más humanos que hemos visto hasta la fecha en un videojuego (aunque no hay que olvidarse de los de The Last of Us), una ambientación brutal, con unas localizaciones cuidadas al detalle, un soundtrack sublime y una historia excelente. I gave it a 9/10 simply because if I gave it a 10/10 that would mean I found it on par with Uncharted 2 which wouldn't be the case but very close.  For each title in the series I would rank them (from best to worse) Uncharted 2, Uncharted 4, Uncharted 3, Uncharted 1 so the second best game of the series in my opinion.  Definitely a great conclusion to a series I thoroughly enjoyed playing over the years and it's always been great to follow Nathan Drake on his adventures and this one is no different.

Just finished the game 3 days ago. Uncharted is a very good action-3rd-person game, but it is not like the overhauling of other games in its genre. Graphic is what most worth praised of the game, especially facial detail. Many scenes are colorful and beautiful to stop and sightseeing for a while. The story is ok, not bad but not so good. If you watch a lot of action movies, you may be able to guess what is going to happen next. Nothing feels truly unique here (Tomb Raider or Last of us have better stories in my opinion)

It's hard to put words together on how impactful Uncharted has been. It's really over and it's tough to put away. But I like to remember the certainty of there being new, equally affecting experiences in the future. All our things used to not be there. Uncharted 2 was a very alluring prospect when it came to be. I trusted the praise of all the critics and fans. But it's not worth getting another console for one game. Not too long ago, I was at a friends house with a PS3. I searched through, and it was there(this is sounding like a 5th grade personal essay example. Difference is, I mean it). It felt surreal to have the opportunity to play it. Yet in a very real way I already experienced it. I held it in a high esteem for it's cinematic action that seemed to might even match that of the unparalleled Modern Warfare 2. I saw the E3 gameplay demos and read the reviews. I already had my opinion of Nathan Drake being a cocky protagonist that ignored the more recently realized moral aspects of killing. An EGM editor put it simply, that he is a mass murderer. But yeah, maybe saying "sweet" while grabbing an AK is just his easy-going self preservation. I managed to rush through a few chapters. I agree that it's 9 probably even 10 out of 10 material in 2009. Now it felt like a inoffensive run through of action and platforming mechanics and level design that Tomb Raider and others were happy to pick up. So when I recently bought a PS4, more in earnest of used games to play before the amazing looking upcoming exclusives, I wasn't really excited to play this game that was bundled in. Though right away, I was thankfully proven wrong. No, it didn't make any leap forwards in games like Spec Ops:The Lines crushing narrative or the incredible exploration of Skyrim. But the way Naughty Dog put it all together made it become a superior single player game. I still feel a little spoiled seeing the amazing graphics, which are combined with a more down to earth yet still stunning art style. The traversal mixed with open combat or  fast initiative taking stealth felt like a new progression of 3rd Person action. Even from the announcement trailer with Nathan coming to in a dark and quiet setting, the game seemed to be more reserved than in the past. It gave the impression that this wasn't essential canon or had anything truly new. But especially towards the end, it makes up with huge explosive sequences that take on a higher level of power with modern graphics. The pg-13 Spielberg/Pirates of the Caribbean tone pervades throughout the game and is as important as the use of the gun play. This really is what makes it stand out among the ultra violent comparatively grim crowd. And that is a great strength. However there are times when the dialogue detracts from the mystery or grandeur. It hard to get invested in the scene when Nathan continually exclaims "Jesus!" or makes a dumb observation of Avery's work I had to mute the dialogue while repeating tough sections, which helped me get through. It's all over but I'm certain we'll all remember Nathan's adventures. Uncharted's light hearted tone really stands out to me when so much else that I love to play feels harsh when compared. Not too bad, maybe I'll try to have Nathans outlook on things.

Questo quarto capitolo della saga é quello che da un senso a tutto e chiude (cosí si crede per ora) in maniera magistrale tutto l'arco narrativo, in quello che per me é il migliore dei modi. Il gameplay é quello classico di Uncharted, ma é migliorato sotto tantissimi aspetti. Cambia il modo di arrampicarsi e di muoversi di Nathan, che ora é estremamente realistico ed appagante. Il gameplay é abbastanza variegato, con tanti enigmi, sessioni di esplorazione tranquilla, sessioni di guida e altro. La storia é raccontata benissimo, con flashback e colpi di scena, oltre che recitazioni perfette che unite alla grafica spacca-mascella rendono veramente qualcosa di unico. Paesaggi sempre diversi, tutti realizzati in maniera perfetta. Level design al top, come sa fare Naughty Dog. Un gioco che ha un gameplay cosí variegato e curato, un'aspetto tecnico che rasenta la perfezione ed una storia estremamente interessante, che riesce da solo a far apprezzare di piú anche tutti e 3 i capitoli precedenti, poiché finalmente si sa quali sono le origini di Nathan e cosa ha dovuto passare nella sua vita. Ah, che TUTTI prendano nota di come si realizza un finale di un videogioco. Uncharted 4 ha il migliore finale di sempre per quanto mi riguarda: perfetto. Spero onestamente che non sia vero che questo é l'ultimo capitolo della saga. Stupendo.

Having played many recent AAA games, I still found myself deeply impressed by the attention to detail throughout the world, the graphical fidelity and the thrill of several action scenes that almost feel like playable cutscenes. The combat gameplay is probably the least enticing part of the game, and I did the mistake of completing it at hard, causing a lot of cheap deaths and necessitating a very sitting-behind-cover style of play (or stealth, but it is impossible to rely only on that). I think combat is more enjoyable on normal. All in all amazing storytelling and fun gameplay.
Rated this a 10 to offset the bad scores from rabid fanboys that start boiling inside every time there is a good game for a console they don't own, but I'd honestly give this a 9.
The best of Uncharted franchise. The graphics are the best of ps4 games. It's a more enjoyable and replayable than previous games. Also, multiplayer is a blast!

all the negatives people have for the game, to an extent are true. Terribly priced micro-transactions are the worst part of the game. The story is fresh to me (possibly since its the first time playing an uncharted game). The idea of treasure hunting is something that i would love to do in real life, which could play some part in my enjoying the game. Short, But amazing! Best looking game this generation HANDS DOWN

Uncharted 4 is the most ambitious title in the series, with a more focused story and refined gameplay. The story starts out in a fantastic manner and keeps going down that road of success. The first two thirds of the story are amazing and engaging. However, the third act overstays its welcome and drops the ball story-wise. It is evident that the third act was changed when the game got delayed. So many plot points are never explained (I will not spoil these points but the reasoning behind Sam's big reveal, Rafe's sudden motives, Nadine's moment, Sam's beef with Sully, etc. are never explained) So the story is the best in the series. However, it is overall an average story thanks to the third act. Also, the villains suck. Sorry to say but they do. They barely have any impact on the story and they are just boring, unmemorable, and silly compared to the villains of Uncharted 2 and 3. However, Nate, Sam, Sully, and Elena are all wonderful to see and interact with.
I have finished this game few days after launch but never put the score here, so doing it now.

Well, what can I say? It was the best game 2016 by far (Blood and Wine was a worthy competator). The story was great as usual with ND games, the graphics were top notch and so was the soundtrack. I came for the single player and only tried the multiplayer a few times (can't say much about it, different from Uc2 and Uc3). The only small thing I can complain on was the long chapters towards the end, but that wasn't enough to lower the score.

The last chapter (although i think there is too much money involved to just ditch Uncharted) of Nathan Drake's adventures. It is an absolutely amazing, stunning game full of epic moments. It is not perfect like second part, but it is pretty damn close to it. Second best part of the whole franchize.
Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is by far the best in the Uncharted series and one of the better games I have played in a long time. The game refines what the Uncharted formula and then some.

Uncharted 4: A thief's End is a beautiful game and it is a game that really lets the PS4 power shine. The title is a bit misleading though as I can assure you that they could be a squeal and DLC is already in the works, in other words, Nate dose not die at the end.
Great game, story and graphics, hard to fault maybe a little to much climbing and gunfire could be slightly improved, but still a great conclusion to the series.
Good game, graphics are amazing. Story is pretty engaging as well.
Story was very good written, it give a mature vibe (maybe thx to the last of us).

This is a stunning entry into a fantastic series. Naughty dog have further refined their winning blend of adventure, dialogue and gameplay. In addition to this they have crafted a  game unrivalled in its beauty.

Uncharted 4 is a game that generated a stir, immediately. Many were waiting for it, others didn't think it was necessary. The important thing, as far as I'm concerned, is that it came out of a good game. A masterpiece, of course, but this doesn't mean it's perfect.

Uncharted 4's arguments are its graphics, and its attention to detail. Background music, background noise, beautiful interiors, light effects, characters animation, faces, dialogues. All of this is a success.
I have only got to Chapter 17, because I have exams, that is why I have not finished the game yet. But so far I am loving this game.

The best installment of the series for sure. Uncharted 4 manages to bring back the fun from the other games with also improving in every way, on the engine, on the gameplay and the story, with a much mature view on our characters and an intriguing mystery. The graphics are absolutely beautiful, and the level of details is unbelievable, I mean, even the simplest most insignificant things. And although the story is always the main focus with Uncharted, the multiplayer was also greatly crafted, with a lot more attention from the developers than in previous games, having a lot of brand new features. Hell, they added a grappling hook, I mean, which game doesn't get better with a grappling hook? I love this freaking game to death, GOTY for me

Uncharted 4 is indeed something really special. While I think people are getting carried away with how good they are proclaiming it to be, it cannot be denied; Uncharted 4 is a fantastic game. It certainly has it’s flaws, but it’s something that greatly surpassed my expectations, and it’s a game that anyone with a PS4 should own. It’s pretty much required to own even if you’re not a big fan of action games. You, like myself, may just be surprised at how much the game really has to offer.
Great game, great graphics, good welcome to stealth system (pretty good implemented)

Technically revolutionary, but unfortunately it lacks a lot when it comes to satisfying gameplay. Naughty Dog clearly favored a perfect presentation, so you might even die because you don't follow their chosen path. The story is honestly worse than the fourth Indiana Jones and the rope just a mere substitute for Lara Crofts successful new bow. Uncharted 2 remains by far the best game of the series.
A masterpiece in story telling - An epic adventure full of everything Uncharted previously offered but with the most incredible story an Uncharted game has seen, I loved this from start to finish.

This was my first Uncharted adventure, but having played The Last Of Us and loving it I had high hopes for this one. In the end in some ways it really delivered and in others it didn't. The visuals, sound and voice acting on display here are all top notch. Presentation wise it's hard to find fault with a naughty dog game. The gameplay for the most part was fun and cinematic. The near miss jumps constantly had me biting my nails. The puzzle solving was a hit and miss aspect with some puzzles being satisfying and others too easy or boring. The combat in this game I felt wasn't as strong as it could have been, and it lacked a crafting system or inventory I feel could have really benefited it. All in all it was a fun story with beautiful locations but ended up on the repetitive side gameplay wise as the game progressed.

As an Uncharted fan who had extreme high expectations for this game, I can easily say that fans will not be disappointed as Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is a masterpiece. I just love how Naughty Dog is able to take something amazing and make it even better. The story, the acting, the graphics, the gameplay, everything has been improved from previous games in the franchise. Now, since this is the last Uncharted game made by Naughty Dog, they did somewhat leave the game open, from the ending, for other developers to pick up, which kind of worried me, because I know that no one can perfect Uncharted like Naughty Dog can. Other than that, Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is a must own for any PS4 owner, and is an easily the best game of 2016 and this console generation.

This game is well deserved in the praise it has received. It looks fantastic on PS4 and the game mechanics are just overall still fun. The only drawback I find is I found myself growing bored of the story really quick. I found the new uncharted lost legacy to have more fresh of a story. Only a small drawback to a otherwise fantastic game

For me, It's pretty close to Uncharted 2 in terms of quality, which means It's another goddamn masterpiece! It's end the series on a perfect note personally. The game does take a slower pace, leaving you plenty of time to breathe, enjoy the view, find collectables and even triggering specials dialogue. And for the combat part, It's still there and It's still awesome to see those set pieces in action! Finally in the series, you can do most combat stealthy. It's still pretty basics, but It's better ( like you can cover in high grass, they have gauge detection and you can lose them if they detect you.). And this is one of the best, if not the best looking game ever! The facial expression of the characters make them truly alive, along with the excellent work of the voice actors! The multiplayer is still not as complete as the others one, and is more cooperative, but It's still fun. Don't expect groundbreaking stuff though in multiplayer. It's a must buy for anyone with a PS4!
Um jogo fantástico e que dá uma grande adrenalina. Um dos melhores jogos para  a PS4 que já joguei.

Some people review games based on their emotions without considering any other dynamic of the game - whether it be good or bad. Ignore them! Those people rate the game zero (the worst score you could possible give) based on if a game is "ground breaking" or not. Not every game has to be "ground breaking" to be good. Uncharted isn't ground breaking, but it's honestly one of the best looking (if not the best) looking game in terms of visuals I've seen on the PS4.

Look this game isn't for everyone, in fact it will probably lose a lot of players in the first couple of hours which really pushes story rather than action, but please it does get a whole lot better. Honesty I didn't like the other games that much, they just didn't have an amazing memorable story and the game play ended becoming really repetitive. But this game does so well to alleviate the others "short comings". The story is so well paced, memorable, and for the first time I was really like really invested in the characters of the uncharted games. The game play was a hell of a lot more dynamic than just finding a wall to crouch behind or at least being behind a wall wasn't the only way to survive. And the action pieces, jesus christ I was so glad I didn't watch any trailers, they were so well done and heart  pounding. However, it's not like the game had negatives, there was almost to much climbing, although I also liked those sections too, and some moments dragged a tad too long... well thats about it for me. Even the multiplayer is pretty fun. I'm gushing over this game because I should be, it's literally hands down the best looking game I've ever seen, has an awesome story, fun gameplay, and is a great send off for Nathan Drake. Even if you hate the game it really doesn't deserve a 0, because you can physically see the love, blood, and sweat that went into this masterpiece.

This game is a masterpiece. It's so good that it can rival The Last of Us. Uncharted goes out with a Big Bang. The graphics are spectacular, and the characters are more realistic and fleshed out than ever.

By far, one of the best games I have ever played. The Uncharted series will forever be one of the best story driven franchises out there. Well done to Naughty Dog on a very successful game. 10/10 must play for ALL PlayStation owners.

Simplesmente incrível. Uncharted 4 faz a gente viver uma história de aventura e sobrevivência impressionante. O jogo conta com um enredo muito bom, personagens muito aventureiros e descontraídos como Nathan e em especial o Sam (o qual é ainda mais piadista que Nathan), suas aventuras são simplesmente impressionante, a cada coisa que quebra e vc ia caindo em outros lugares ou parecia que iria cair era um susto, vc realmente entra na aventura. O jogo também contém uma boa trilha sonora e gráficos de tirar o fôlego e um modo online muito divertido e variado. Meus parabéns para NaughtyDog e Sony.
In this generation, Uncharted 4 arguably the best game ever made. The story, the characters, the music, the game mechanics are all unique on each side.

I Played around 15 hours of the game and I loved all of it the story was amazing and the multiplayer is surprisingly good its so addictive and doesn't require micro transactions as of the ending of the game it was a great way to end Drakes final adventure with the ending being happy and him having a normal life but still go treasure hunting he buys the docs and non of the main characters dies (Sully,Elana,Sam and Nate) the ending you play as drakes kid called Cassie then you find Drakes gear with all of his treasure and the ending is amazing to end the franchise and thats why i gave it a 10/10
A beautiful game with an amazing singleplayer and great written characters. This game is worth buying for the singleplayer alone.

I can't give it a ten because it doesn't have much replayability, but aside from that, everything else is great.  The graphics are unbelievable, the pacing is far better than previous games and the story is nice and engaging.  The story is a decent length but as I said once you are done there's not much point doing it all again.  The story is not quite as powerful as The Last of Us but it's still miles better than 99% of other games.  I will be selling my copy on now that I've completed it, but it's well worth the ride- basically it's another really well-made 15 hour movie you play through.  You don't need to have played the previous games but it will make it more meaningful if you do- although sitting through all of them back to back would be too much.  I would recommend getting the Nathan Drake collection, playing through those at your own pace and then waiting a while and getting this when it's a bit cheaper.

Como hace Naughty Dog para que cada Uncharted sea mejor que el anterior? La verdad que no lo entiendo, pero por tercera vez y lamentablemente última voy a decir: "Este es el mejor Uncharted que he jugado". No solo es emotiva, atrapante, con un gameplay increíble y excelentes personajes, es también el fin de una era, el fin de una hermosa saga, el fin de uno de los mejores personajes de los videojuegos, el fin del ladrón.

Uncharted 4 is an awesome game. Truly a 10.It's one of the best console games ever. The graphics are the best i've seen so far on a console. The gameplay is incredible and the story is so damn good, probably the best one of the Uncharted series. Naughty Dog can really create compelling characters with whom you can establish "emotional" ties and compelling stories. That's role playing. If you haven't play it so far what are you waiting for? Oh, and I 'm looking forward to see the Uncharted and The Last Of Us Movies.

Without a doubt the best of all four. The shooting/climbing/puzzle balance was good even though the gameplay was nothing new. It remains pleasant and effective. From a technical perspective the game is the best ever developed on PS4.

Uncharted 4 is a true example of what a AAA game should look like here in 2016. Uncharted 4 is my first Uncharted game. Yes I was late to the party but better late than never right :) For some reason, Uncharted 4 interested me enough to give the series a try something the previous games never did. I'm glad I decided to give it a go.

Una obra maestra infravalorada por algunos, el mejor de la saga sin duda, el mejor final para nathan Drake, graficos, diversion, historia, casi todo, lo unico que le falta son los puzles. Una forma perfecta de presentar a los personaje y gran nivel de exploracion.

My first ps4 game, I played all the uncharted games on my ps3, and was eager to try out the last instalment of the series. I spent so much time look how beautiful this game is made, has the best graphics on the ps4, the details are amazing,the story is also really good loved it. THANK YOU NAUGHTY DOG!
An amazing game with fantastic gameplay, story, graphics and animations. The multiplayer is amazingly fun with not a lot of lag issues. Well worth the money!

Sin duda este juego marca lo que es capaz ND, sera un juego innecesario, pero desde luego es bueno. Innova en justo, y tiene uno de los mejores momentos de acción peliculera de toda la generacion. Técnicamente es brillante, absolutamente vistoso. Los guiones, personajes y direccion de la historia esta al nivel. Tiene un multi solido, y con mucho contenido.
This game is amazing. The best Uncharted game. It's even better than among thieves IMO.
Great game, as expected. Nathan Drake at his finest. Smooth gameplay, a great storyline, really can't say much about the graphics that hasn't been said before, absolutely gorgeous game.
Absolutely loved this game. Incredible visuals, great Uncharted gameplay with some new additions and a great story to round it off. Low scores are meaningless deliberate sabotage.
nunca vi um game tão detalhista e realista como uncharted 4! (exceto pela física) oque não me encomoda pois os saltos são incrivelmente fantasticos!

Definitivamente un excelente juego, ver la evolución desde el 1 hasta el 4 hace que la delicia de saborear este juego sea toda una autentica experiencia, los mejores gráficos, gran ambientación en sonido, detalles por todas partes, jugabilidad mejorada aunque es la misma desde el uno pulida mas a fondo, no me disgusta al contrario es su estilo de juego, los comentario de los compañeros y la ayuda de estos se ve y se siente siempre en el juego, gran historia con momentos inesperados, puedo decir que falto la dificultad en los puzles y unos cuantos capítulos mas(esto es solo porque no quería que acabara)

This game was amazing. I was on the edge of my seat and played the whole thing through in like 2 days. It's the best thing since The Last of us. It's an adventure game, an action movie, and a puzzle game all in one. If you haven't played the first 3, you won't understand why we all love it so much.
t is one of the best games that are currently on the play station four, great visuals for a console game, also great controls and story, about the multiplayer really don care
This is just the best game I have ever seen, as a fan of 'linear' story driven games. I know it will be unlikely but I sure hope for another Nathan Drake story.

I'm going to be honest because that's just me I've always wanted to beat Uncharted 1 and 2 and each time I played I would get too frustrated at times and just give up so I never got the chance to play Uncharted 3..so I was a little skeptical to play 4. I'm glad I decided to ignore my skepticism and dive headfirst in probably the very best video game I've ever played. To any and everyone involved in making this game from the lead designers to the guy crunching a leaf into a microphone for sound effects....KUDOS! Everything from the game play, to the voice acting, to the story was excellent. Well done Naughty Dog!
This review is strictly based on the single player alone
Uncharted 4: A Thief's Ending is a great game, and the technical benchmark of this generation so far.
Hi guys I only ever comment on a games flaws.
A great end of the franchise, but I felt a bit disappointed towards the end. For me it lost breath during the last chapters...
The story of Nathan Drake comes to an end, after several years, he is dragged by his older brother Sam, back into the action.
My favourite game series of-all-time returns and brings with it the amazing: graphics, sound, action, plot, story, gameplay, adventure, I've come to expect.

This was my first uncharted game, unfortunately. After playing this masterpiece, I will definitely go back and play previous installments. The touching storyline, breathtaking graphics, and unbelievably fun gameplay add up to an unforgettable singleplayer experience. Multiplayer is also very fun, but not the main focus.

I don't know what it is, but Uncharted 4: A Thief's End is the best game i have ever played since The Last Of Us. With amazing visuals ground breaking action and amazing characters, Make this not only the best game of 2016, Also best games this generation, and best 3rd person Action-Adventure game. the most beautiful game i played from long time the story and graphics are amazing and i enjoyed every part of it this is a most buy game and goty competitor
This game is one of the best games ever, in this particular game as well as "the last of us" there are bigger parts of u & ur emotions take part in the experience than any other games.
Esperaba mas de este juego,historia y graficos excelentes, multijugador bueno pero quedó a deber.... muy recomendable para rentarlo, no recomiendo compra.

Naughty Dog is to be applauded as they have brought the Uncharted series formula to its pinnacle. They have used the advanced technology of the next generation in tandem with their positive history of game-based storytelling to create the new standard for cinematic adventure gaming. My recommendation is if you have a PS4, this is unquestionably a gaming investment you should make. With carefully thought out gameplay mechanics and writing, eye-popping action sequences, and breathtaking audio and visual presentation, this game has proven itself worthy to be recognized as the ultimate Uncharted game.
Genuinely best game i have ever played.

Uncharted 4, Athiefs end, un juego espectacular en todos sus aspectos, un trabajo explendido por parte de Naugthy Dog, para mi seguiran siendo el mejor estudio de Sony, a al espera de lo que haga Guerrilla games, o Santa Monica Studio.

Another masterpiece from Naughty Dog. The story and the progression is right on, although some say it progresses slowly, I disagree as you travel different parts of the globe, it gives you right amount of exploration as well as action. There is a stealth possibility for some of the levels if you like, so run and gun haters will be happy to approach the game from a different perspective. I think the guys over Naughty Dog are true day dreamers and story tellers. There are lots of moments you will say to yourself "wow", some of them will be action packed, some of them will be emotional, a great ending for a great character in Playstation's history. A must buy for PS4 owners. Cheers.

Let's be honest, if you're a fan of the first 3, and even the one for the Vita (which I actually enjoyed more than 3), then this is one of the best games to come out since The Last of Us. The story is, finally, grounded in a sense of reality that the first three always strayed away from in its final act. The gameplay is, while more cinematic, more compelling, telling a complete, thorough story. This is the perfect ending for a beloved character. I don't want sequels or spinoffs. I want it to end the way it ended, as it's brilliant. Fans of the series will love it.

The most ambitious game I have ever played, and it pulls it off in every single way possible. Naughty Gods have done it yet again, this time creating an Uncharted that is the best in the entire series. The story telling is personal, deep, and emotional; learning many important things from The Last of Us. The 'wide linear' environments are a beautiful addition to the game making you feel like you are on a true pirate adventure. Henry Jackman's music is stunning, fitting perfectly throughout the entire game; especially during the opening credits. I like how they chose to create a new main theme for this game; titled 'A Thief's End' rather than creating Nate's Theme 4.0. This new theme is far superior in my opinion. And I don't even know where to begin with the graphics, the game looks life-like; boosting the best looking graphics of any game I've ever seen. Uncharted 4: A Thief's End offers more than just a game does, and it offers more than a movie does; it offers an experience. It is an experience that far surpasses films and other forms of story telling, which is why I am so passionate about the video game medium. It is a medium that allows you to fully immerse yourself in a story and world. Uncharted 4: A Thief's End does this masterfully. I hope Naughty Dog continues to exel pushing other developers to strive to make better games in the future.
Greatest PS4 game?Yes.Greatest game in playstation history?Yes.Greatest game in gaming legacy?
Melhor jogo que já joguei ate então. Melhores gráficos. Nota dez em todos os quesitos. Quem comprar não irá se arrepender. Com certeza será o melhor jogo do ano.

This is a fabulous game , just what you would expect from a dev like Naughty Dog,don't be fooled by the median score which has been lowered by trolls leaving a 0/10 score,try it for yourself and see!!

Naughty Dog keeps its 10 streak running with Uncharted 4. This game is another Uncharted game, however, from the get go you can tell that The Last of Us has influenced it A LOT. The story is a much bigger part of the game than the last 3. But don't get confused, the game highly benefits from this. Giving us the final adventure with Nathan Drake, that has twist and turns and some great characters and story telling. Don't worry though, game-play has not suffered one bit from this. It still is, if not better, awesome when beating the crap out of some bad guys or jumping from one massive gap to the next. 10 out of 10

Conflicting game: fun, I say to myself, but also noticeably imperfect for all the critic fanfare about it.  The game is repetitive, not in a minute way that you notice frequently, but in bigger chunks - almost every grouping of 3 or 4 chapters includes a vehicle part, then a big puzzle, a shootout and an escape.  The escapes are also pretty predictable - see a bridge?  It'll collapse, and you'll get separated from your partner and have to find your own way up.

Uncharted- easy to play, but absolutely not easy to win. Creative play-style, a lot of breath-taking scenes from the game, well connected from uncharted 1 to uncharted 4. An absolutely must have for die-hard parkour and adventurous gamers.

I have played all of the Uncharted games, and this is my favorite! the second Uncharted game was awesome but I think there was big improvements on stealth missions! I already almost finished with the game!

First review shall be of this game that sets the standard for gaming. Sure, the gameplay is exciting! The graphics are amazeballs. But at the heart of this game is story, relationships, and character. Basically, this game has heart. After investing so much time in these characters, this game delivers and seals the deal ending in a way that is truly perfect. If you haven't played the other games, you're missing out on the investment of story and characters. It'll still be a fun and exciting game to you. But this is the end of a nearly flawless and perfect franchise!

This is simply the greatest game to ever come out on the PS4. Obviously, that is my opinion only, but I have not plugged into a game like I did with Uncharted since I was a kid. I am a casual gamer, like to play some just to chill when not at work. This game made me hardcore. Uncharted 4 Thief's End as the title implies marks the end of the Uncharted Series. The last adventure of Nathan Drake takes him to a pirate treasure hunt where he scouts many parts of the world to uncover the secrets left by the most notorious pirates of the world.

Uncharted 4 is a great game that excites and thrills your senses just like a movie does. I know this game takes a much different approach than the first 3 games in the series but kudos to Naughty Dog for taking the risk of building the story by going with a slower pace in the beginning. After the slow start it's pretty much a non-stop thrill ride that's better than the first 3. And they wrapped up the series really well and with meaning especially that nice epilogue at the end. Also I just LMAO at all these fake negative reviews complaining about not enough options and exploration. They don't get that Uncharted 4 is all about Nate going with the flow, not mastering the environment with massive ability/weapon upgrades (which would've greatly slowed down the game's momentum). Instead Naughty Dog has taken the right risk at the right moment to make this game super awesome. For a game like this it's done exceptionally well and no other game comes close to that. Well maybe Call of Duty Black Ops1. So yeah this rollercoaster of a game deserves a 10/10.
Uncharted 4 is the best game in this franchise. And right now I will shortly explain why.

Overall the game doesn't fail in the entertainment department but is unable to live up to Uncharted 2 or 3 with execution. Still hoping for the Last Of Us 2 to be announced.

Honestly, I don't usually write out reviews, but exceptions had to be made. As a huge fan of the Uncharted series, I could not have asked for a better conclusion to my favorite franchise in gaming. The story is by far the best out of all the Uncharted games and gunplay, platforming, and puzzles are all improved. The theme of obsession, from Avery and fellow pirates to Sam and Rafe in the present is beautifully illustrated. I have never cared more about the characters and their actions as I did in the fourth (technically fifth) installment in the series. The villains are some of the best in the franchise, with Rafe rivaling Flynn as my personal favorite in the entire series. Expert voice acting and writing helped enhance my experience even more, making Nate, Sully, Elena, and company feel like real people. Most obvious is that the game is simply gorgeous with certain vistas throughout that will have your jaw dropped. Does the game have flaws? Totally. There are pacing issues with slower moments in Scotland and Madagascar and Sam may not be as important to the Uncharted fan as say Sully. But no game is perfect and despite its few flaws, Uncharted 4 is a masterpiece to remember and an experience that I will never forget.

I have never been a fan of linear game-play that shoves you down a scripted path with little to no choice in the destiny of your character. With that said, A Thief's End is one of the most beautifully crafted paths I have ever experienced. The various environments and landscapes are simply stunning, integrating top-tier graphics with both scope and detail. The story is provocative and well written, the dialogue is engaging, and the transitions between game-play and cut-scenes are seamless. The mechanics are fun and easy, with simple and sensible controls. The A.I. is intelligent and will operate as a cohesive unit to surround and destroy you. You can approach enemy strongholds as a stealth assassin, or guns blazing. Both strategies are rewarding and challenging for different reasons.

I haven't played a game that captures my heart for a long time since Assassin's Creed III. This is my first encounter of the Uncharted series. I gave this game a shot because hell yeah, it's game of the year 2016 on Metacritic! And to me it deserves it. The performance of this game is very smooth, even with amazing graphics, long cinematic scenes and large map. No loading is a huge plus for me. The game delivers a huge quantity of content - 22 chapters, and they are captivating enough that you just want more (sadly the game developers said it's the last game in the series). Gameplay features a wide variety of challenges, shooting, puzzles, climbing. And it keeps it simple - no minimap, no map, no 'new objective' thing. It's an adventure! Story is very decent, emotions are expressed very well, Nadine and Rafe steal the show for me. 15 hours of gameplay and the experience is so memorable. I don't really care for the multiplayer and survival mode, though. 10.

A masterpiece in gaming. Naughty Dog has made one of the best game sagas of all time with Uncharted, and after the third game, I thought they were done. When they announced the fourth installment, I was worried, because I thought there wasn't much else for them to do. I was wrong. Uncharted 4 became one of my favourite games of all time, and surely the best one in the series, it manage to make everything from its predecessors better, bring a new fantastically written story, with a lot more maturity than in previous games, while still having one hell of a fun gameplay both in single and multiplayer, and all of that with one of the most beautiful graphics I have ever seen. Just brilliant

An amazing finale to an amazing series. The game looks gorgeous, gunplay and mechanics are fluid as ever, and I cared about the story (for the most part). I have to knock a point because there was a point in the final 1/3rd of the game where I just lost caring about the story and just cared about getting to the next checkpoint because it felt tedious and long. I also felt the "betrayal"/"redemption" piece from Sam just wasn't as fleshed or satisfying as I hoped it would be. I also saw it coming from the start of the game.

Uncharted borrows heavily from The Last of US. In Nathan Drake's final treasure hunt,  the story feels more emotional and personal than ever. The game mostly succeeds in telling this story; brilliant motion capture along with great voice acting make the game really shine. The main characters are really wel developed and engaging. The antagonist was, as per usual, forgettable. Naughty Dog seems to have difficulty finding Nathan's Joker. I wouldn't call it the best Uncharted in the series. The game can really slow down to a crawl at certain points. In The Last of Us, moments like these helped to tell the story of the world and also gave you a chance to gather supplies and what-not.  In Uncharted this felt different; exploration was only rewarded with collectibles or optional conversations that did not contribute to the story. Uncharted really shines in its action driven, almost on-rail, combat sequences. Even though the game was the longest Uncharted yet, the action sequences were sparse to say the least. Another issue that I had was that the game relied very heavily on stealth, making combat feel more Assassin's Creed than Uncharted. Especially on higher difficulty levels i found myself hiding in yet another patch of tall grass, waiting for a non suspecting thug to come by. One of Uncharted's strong points, as always, are the graphics. This is one of the most visually pleasing games on the PS4 out there today. I haven't played the multiplayer, and (like most) probably never will. Definitely a buy for anyone who wants a solid single player experience accompanied by great graphics and sound.

I really liked this game. It was very cool to see the graphical update on this game from the older games. My favorite part of the game was the combat, I was having a blast whether I was shooting enemies or just jumping around ( there's a lot of that ). This game is in the bargain bin these days so you have no excuse if you have a PS4- play it.

The game looks astonishing. Breathtaking vistas and environments. Kudos to the graphics and animations department. Voice acting also nicely done. The main problems are with game mechanics and an overly simplified game story. If you have played Prince series and all the Uncharted games, then all these parkour like jumping feels ike you are having a deja vu and definitely boring after the first hour. Essentially nothing changed in the series in this regard. Zero diversity. You jump up, down, face some sub-par puzzle challenges and sometimes you'll face some shooting now and then, but nothing new, nothing unconventional slaps you in the face that shakes you up and makes you shiver. Just a simple story told and pre digested to and from 8 year olds. If this will be your first action adventure, then you'll enjoy it, if you have played all these games before, you will bore to death.

Uncharted 4 es el mejor juego de 2016, de PS4 (a la fecha) y uno de los mejores trabajos de Naughty Dog que seguramente quedará en las páginas doradas de la historia de los videojuegos, la historia aunque tiende a caer en clichés comunes de los juegos de acción se mantiene como una magnífica campaña que te puede generar felicidad, nostalgia, interés, etc; presentándonos una nueva aventura de Nathan Drake que vuelve después de varios años inactivo junto a Sullivan y Elena, personajes muy queridos en la franquicia y añadiendo a Sam que inmediatamente se vuelve un personaje muy importante; los antagonistas del juego son Rafe y Nadine, un egocéntrico millonario y una mercenaria que, aunque no sean los mejores villanos de la historia, sí presentan "autoridad" y rivalidad; los personajes están tan bien desarrollados al punto en que Nathan Drake ya puede ser considerado como el principal ícono de PlayStation (con permiso de Kratos por supuesto).

Uncharted 4 is a game that would worth every penny you spend on it. From a person who never played any of the other uncharted series, the game did a good job in it introduction and it's not hard for people who are new to the series including me to get into the game. The strongest point in this game is of course it's story, from the beginning to the end there was never a dull moment at all. As a 3rd person shooter game, the stealth mechanics in this game is well done which in my opinion is a good thing since most of today triple a games don't really focus on the stealth mechanics in games. There are a few reason why i din't give this game a 10 out of 10 it because that some of chapter could feel a little too repetitive with how they drag out the game length with unnecessary obstacles which could be frustrating at times. The puzzle in the games is well design but there are a few puzzle which i personally think was too easy at times or just plain boring. Overall this game deserve the praise it gets and i think it's one of the few better 3rd person game out there. If you own a ps4, please do your self a favor and get this game.

Despite that Naugthy Dog surely delivers with a very well written and executed Indiana Jones like adventure. The graphics are impressive, the movielike cutscenes are perfect and there are ton's of opportuities to get on likable terms with those wacky dudes. It's my first game in ps4 and I'm absolutely loving it. The cut scenes are amazing and the way the story unfolds always keeps you on the grip. The graphics are very realistic; the forest scenes in the game-play looks very realistic and naughty dog has done a good job in game physics. The characters movements looks and feels real. Мне очень сложно оценивать эту игру, так как я являюсь не то , что бы фанатом , но любителем и ценителем данной серии - это точно. Прежде всего игру стоит оценивать как последнее приключение Дрейка и роль , так сказать , последней главы в его истории эта игра отрабатывает на ура. В игре очень много времени уделяется раскрытию Дрейка как человека, а не как аналога Индианы. Мы узнаем о его прошлом , о том как жажда приключений поглотила ум маленького мальчика. Узнаем больше о его личной жизни с Еленой , ведь в прошлых частях было понятно , что они будут вместе , но как такого развития отношений у нас на экранах не происходило,а тут мы уже видим их как семью и проблемы их совместной жизни. Узнаем о человеке , о котором Дрейк предпочитал молчать на протяжении аж 3-х игр Серии. Более полную картину получают и его отношения с Салли.

Uno de los mejores juegos de PS4 (si no el mejor) sin duda. Es una gran película de acción con personajes sobresalientes. Es un juego que te absorbe y que no puedes dejar. Naughty dogs did it again,the story is the best and all the adventure u play through, the gameplay is soooo smooth and good all the climbing and shooting and hiding and stealth,my favorite looking game I mean gosh the graphics the characters the everything in the game are really good ,the best way to stop the series white my favorite uncharted game of all the other 3.

Uncharted 4 at the end of the day is a great send-off to the Uncharted series and keeps its insanely amazing voice acting and characters (the villains are my favourite in the series) The story is interesting and great and the gunplay is so fun and is really nice to see a fighting scene the problem is that there isn't to many due to pacing issues for the first few hours of Uncharted 4 is climbing and chapters such as Scotland and the first chapter in Madagascar drag on WAY to much another negative is the multiplayer that kept me entertained for a few mins then after that it was nothing new and was incredibly boring but Uncharted is focused on story so if you don't care about the multiplayer this is a solid 9/10 on the plus side these graphics are amazing you could sink so many hours into photo mode alone on how beautiful the graphics and scenery are.
great From Beginning to end Uncharted 4 is a great game 10 out of 10 is what the score is because it is. so it is a great and amazing choice to play so yeah
This is a gaming masterpiece. What a fitting finale for such a great series.
Great game play. Beautiful graphics. Great set pieces and awesome story! A fitting end to Nathan Drakes story! One of the best looking games ever made.

This Game.....THIS GAME.....Naughty Dog you've done another masterpiece...but not as good as the Last of Us..Positive: The story, the Gameplay and Platforming (even if it's the same as the previous Uncharted), The Characters, the Settings, the Graphics, the Narrative/Dialogues is what make this game special

Uncharted 4 is a landmark title that anyone remotely interested in interactive storytelling should invest in. Naughty Dog has once again raised the bar across the industry. Thrilling shootouts, a staggering level of detail, breathtaking visuals and emotional depth come together to make Uncharted 4: A Thief's End a must-play masterpiece.

A masterpiece, Uncharted 4: A Thief's End transcends the video game genre to create an incredible experience. Its sad to see Nathan Drake go, but he sure as hell went out with a bang. Not only is the story and gameplay fantastic, the graphics are still, one year later, the best in any game. Nothing comes close in terms of character animations and environments. To sum the game up, it is amazing and you need to play it!

The Uncharted series and the Metroid series are probably my favorite game series' ever because of their story driven gameplay that never lacks ideas. Every single Uncharted game in the series is a strong entry that has a great story and typically improves on the last in some form or way. With 4 there was a lot of hype surrounding this game and the hype was proven accurate as the game blew me away with advances in almost every aspect when compared to the older games in the series. Some have complained about the story of this game being to forgiving on Nathan Drake, but this is something I did not personally notice. The mechanics of this game are near perfection with the introduction of the rope and swinging which allows for fun takedowns of enemies. This game's graphics are probably the crowning achievement mainly because the graphics remain life like throughout the entire game without frame rate issues. To all PS4 owners this is a must have game even if one is not into shooters in general. I also highly recommend purchasing the Nathan Drake collection which has the previous three games remastered on PS4.

Naughty Dog has made another masterpiece with Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End. This game looks amazing and it has an amazing story to go with it. This game does a great job at getting you to know all of the characters very well and that’s why it’s so compelling. You care a lot about what is going to happen to these characters on their last adventure. This game also has multiplayer that is actually good. It’s not as good as the multiplayer in The Last of Us, but it doesn’t feel like it’s tacked on and poorly done. Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End is by far the best entry in an already excellent franchise.
Great character development. Great acting. Great atmosphere. Best animations out there. As usual a great storytelling too, while story itself was kinda an average one.

Uncharted 4 is one of the most series closing game. The game tells you a history about how Nathan's brother survived from the prison and a last adventure. I think that Uncharted: Lost Legacy will only be good as Uncharted 4 if the protagonist is Nathan's daughter. Another person will change everything.
Most of bad reviews are just butthurted fanboys of other plataforms, pretty great game, i wouldn't say it's necessary, but it's an overall charming gaming experience
