Este juego es una basura que estafa!!!!!! segun yo era un juego nuevo y solo es una parte que no soltaron del juego original! que basura no puede ser !!!!!!!!

Finally! A game with two super smart female leads, both of whom are POC, and not hyper-sexualized character design. That alone makes this game a breakthrough in the industry. The fact that it plays beautifully and is INCREDIBLY acted (thanks to excellent writing), definitely doesn't hurt either. I dare say this is my favorite entry since Uncharted 2... but I must admit I like the freshness of these characters better than Nathan Drake, who - lets face it - is basically just a modified Indiana Jones clone. Chloe and Nadine's relationship is really fun to watch unfold, and it made me really want to play the game to the end just to see how they both turned out. I really hope we see another entry with these two in the leads.
BUYER BEWARE THIS IS NO LAURA CROFT:

I was appalled with Uncharted's writing at the end of Uncharted 2 and have been until now. The way they wrote off Chloe was disgusting, and now she has her own game so Naughty Dog has been redeemed. Uncharted 3 was a mess, the 4th one went down the same theme of "only one extra character matters." This game is better than Uncharted 4 from a graphical perspective so you are safe there as well if that's what you are into.
Game was very glitchy and the framerate dropped during large action sequences.  Aiming was also floaty and not accurate.  Very disappointed in the game, worst in the franchise.
Hay muchos juegos mucho mejor que esto!! cualquier juego de tomb raider de los primeros y de los ultimos podrian ser mucho mejor que esta basofia, me siento estafado

One of the best games I've played in a long time.  This game's immersion is unparalleled in the gaming industry.  It sets a new bar for the level of immersion video games can achieve.  The graphics/visuals are the best I've seen in a video game.  It looks almost photorealistic.  The attention to detail, variety of vivid colors, scope of the landscape, stunning architecture is all breathtaking.  This is a game that truly immersed me in its environment and made me just want to walk around and admire the scenery.  All the other aspects of the game are top notch too.  The only negative was I felt the combat/stealth parts were frustrating to play sometimes.  Their seemed to be a ridiculous amount of enemies and the controls weren't as responsive as I needed them to be when it got really chaotic.  Overall though, I'd say this game is a must-play.

While visually pleasing (with the exception of the character shading, which looks cartoonish, probably due to the lack of shadows?), this game is pretty shallow. The antagonist isn't a believable character, the story follows a rote just-copy-the-structure-from-the-last-game approach, but the scenes make no sense (the characters always have alternate, more efficient options but choose to instead follow an approach that requires some climbing, shooting a few soldiers and linearly progressing through the level)

I'm glad this game is a standalone title as opposed to the original plan of it being a DLC. Naughty Dog took a gamble with a new main cast change from the previous titles and it paid off well. Chloe Frazer is a supporting character I remember from previous Uncharted entries as a love interest/ partner for Nate but this game has given her an original identity. I wouldn't mind seeing her and Nadine in another title as they are a great pair. India is awesome.

excellent game but way too short for the price.  i completed it in an afternoon.  gameplay is as you'd expect from uncharted 4, characters are a nice new twist and there's a nice guest cameo too.  if this game was twice as long it gets a 10 at this price point  £20 in the uk would be the most i'd expect to pay..

Proves that the Uncharted series has viability beyond Nathan Drake. The best puzzles in the series yet, some great combat encounters that feel fresh, and interesting use of "Semi-open world" in some sections which I think fits neatly in the franchise. I know they're focusing on The Last of Us II now (and oh boy, I can't wait) but I hope this isn't the last thing Naughty Dog ever do with Uncharted.

The Lost Legacy doesn't reinvent the series in anyway, but for adventurous thrills and a good old fashioned Uncharted experience this is worth the purchase. Chloe is a great lead character and her banter with Nadine was entertaining and it provided that realistic dialogue the series is known for. I wouldn't mind seeing these two in more Uncharted games in the future. This being an expansion of Uncharted 4 it's not a FULL length game, I beat the story in around 6 hours. But for a reduced price of £30, and you also get the entire Uncharted 4 multiplayer, I'd say it's a steal.
+Engaging new story set within uncharted universe starring Chloe and Nadine

Originally planned as a DLC expansion for Uncharted 4, Naughty Dog enjoyed the development process so much they decided to expand the project into a standalone game. Overall, The Lost Legacy is an entertaining experience. The graphics are great, the gunplay is tight, and the story has some traditional wit and charisma to it. The problem is that this game feels way too much like U4 to be considered it's own game. I'm not 100% sure how much this game costs, but if it's being considered a standalone game, then it will cost a decent amount. And that decent amount is not worth this game, which feels like Uncharted 4.5, except probably overpriced. This is still a good game though, just a tad overpriced.

I will definitely try anything naughty dog puts out and there is a reason for that is because they have consistently developed awesome games. Lost Legacy is a great start for a new Uncharted franchise.  I really enjoyed Chloe from Uncharted 2 and I am pleased to get more developed character out of her.  Nadine not so much she was annoying in 4 but the dynamic seems to work out.  I am about half way through the game and enjoying every minute of it.  Nothing is innovative as far as game play goes but the story is a fun roller-coaster that I don't want to get off.

Uncharted: The Lost Legacy is incredibly repetitive. You'll watch a cutscene, climb a bit, shoot some enemies, rinse repeat. Fortunately the scenery and exploration is interesting enough, because the shooting mechanics are still awful. The stealth is some of the worst I've seen in a game. The characters don't engage in meaningful ways. The villain is a stereotype. But what Uncharted does well concerns history and locales. The environments are well-developed, and lovely enough at least to look at.

Few words about this game: very beautiful visuals, great plot, excellent characters (except main villain) and puzzles become more challenging. But in my opinion devs could dedicate more time for Nadine and Asav too. Also, the same thing that I HATE from all Uncharted series - collectible garbage. I don't really understand why this irritated mechanics from old games are here? But in general game is awesome!
So great to get this as a DLC, if anyone was ever curious of what DLC are supposed to, or used to, be like this is what it was.  Truly thank you for providing a quality DLC for this.

Naughty Dog’s Uncharted: The Lost Legacy follows fan favorite Chloe Frazer and Nadine Ross through the many beautiful parts of India. The stunning vistas are impressive to look at and I couldn’t help but stop and take many pictures along the way. The game contains cut and paste mechanics found in Uncharted 4 like gunplay, climbing, and overall movement. A new lock picking mechanic was added into the game but ultimately works as a gimmick that doesn’t really add anything to the game other than making you feel like a skilled thief. The biggest gripe I have with this game is that it lacks simple charm found in other Uncharted games with Nathan Drake at the helm. The chemistry between Chloe and Nadine often feels a bit forced and awkward whereas Nathan and Sully’s interactions in past games seem very organic and real. Uncharted: The Lost Legacy receives an 8 of out 10. If you're a die-hard Uncharted fan you'll likely enjoy the short and sweet romp that Lost Legacy offers but I feel that it’s a bit overpriced at $40. For new players unfamiliar with the uncharted series, wait for a price drop and start with the Uncharted Collection to see if this game is your cup of tea.

This is one of the best uncharted games that are out, in my opinion. I love that even without the brilliant Nathan Drake, this is still just as exciting and playable as the others. I thoroughly enjoyed every bit of the game and would definitely recommend it, especially for the uncharted lovers. The storyline is a mix of things, from comedy to seriousness. And I think the level of gameplay to story is spot on. What another fantastic uncharted game! Love it.

Disgusting game with really stupid characters. Dialogs are really so unnatural, the plot is not intrseting and 3500 hours of climbing in the mountains. Have I payed for a climbing simulator? The only intresting character is Sam. Hope one day there will be a game about this man!

I am a huge Uncharted fan. As someone who wouldn't call themselves a "gamer", Uncharted is the one of the few series' I am an undying fan of. Filled with great characters, storytelling, exhilarating action sequences, fluid game play, and just pure visual artistry. It is a gaming franchise that has yet to include a disappointing addition. Uncharted: The Lost Legacy, which is a spin-off of the original series, continues naughtydog's golden streak. By the end having created a new piece of gaming gold, even if I did have my reservations in the beginning.

It's a HUGE mistake to think this is a "generic" Uncharted. Far from it. Although shorter than the usual adventure (8 to 10 hours, tops), Lost Legacy offers "more of the same" in the best way possible.

Superb. That is the single one word I would use to describe this game if I could only use one word. It starts great, slows down and becomes a little hum-drum at chapter 4 but regains its fluidity from chapter 5 right up until the end. Character relationship development feels natural and progresses steadily. All of the main characters feel well thought out with some interesting and witty banter. Gameplay is solid although I do feel Chloe dies a bit on the easy side in some situations, she can take an RPG or grenade going off in her face almost then die from about 3 regular firearm shots.. that just feels off.

More Uncharted 4. The game is short and sweet, featuring two lovely female protagonists with very good chemistry between them. I was surprised how much I liked Nadine in this one, and I liked Chloe already. The animation is gorgeous, especially the facial expressions. Well worth the price.

Petty good addition for UC4 but worst UC title in franchise.  Female characters are fail... QT action scenes not necessary, too much walking and climbing and final train battle is too long and a little boring. On other side, game is not hard on crushing so easy platinum to get. Not really good UC title, but must play anyway if you like franchise.

Despite the developers trying to distance themselves from Uncharted 4, Lost Legacy is still an oversized and mind you, overpriced DLC. This is basically Uncharted in miniature, with your standard plot about another ancient city, villain with a private army and main characters bantering constantly, as well as obligatory action setpieces.

This game is beautiful with great characterization and mind-blowing action set pieces. So far I've played Uncharted 1 and 2, and Lost Legacy. I like Lost Legacy the best so far. What distinguishes this game from the other Uncharted games, of course, is that the protagonist is a woman who was a secondary character in certain other Uncharted games. She and her partner in crime go on an adventure and both have a personality that is a lot more serious, and untrusting, than Nathan Drake. In a way I missed Nathan's jokey attitude, but as the game went on and the two very slowly - VERY slowly - came to trust each other I really appreciated that character development, the realism of it, compared to anything in the other uncharted games. And the latter half of this game is brilliant. The first half is fine but it's in the second half where it soars. It's not like Uncharted 2, for example, which started off with a masterful set piece. Instead, Uncharted Lost Legacy starts off merely good and gets increasingly better as the game wears on.
Красивые виды, крутые перестрелки, знакомые герои, все на уровне, как умеют Naughty Dog, лучшее приключение и надеюсь не последнее.
Started off really liking this game, especially on the pro with my new 4k TV, the graphics are unbelievable.

When Lost Legacy was first announced I was both excited and a little sceptical. I wasn't quite sure how this game would be without the series lead Nathan Drake. However after playing it, I can confirm that both Chloe and Nadine are great in their leading roles and help make the game a blast to play, and one I would recommend to anyone who has enjoyed any of the previous entries in the uncharted series.

Uncharted The Lost Legacy has everything that all Uncharted games must have, and then some more. The new characters are a welcome adition, it's good to have some diversity on video games (Naughty Dog excels at that). The game is gorgeous, and fun as hell, it's not very long, but for its price it provides almost 12 hours of gameplay, which is very similar to most games.
honestly i enjoy this game more than uncharted 4. it has more action and less unnecessary exploring. chloe and nadin are a fantastic team . buy it you wont be disappointed
Starting this game I was a bit worried that I wouldn't enjoy it as much since you aren't playing as Nathan Drake. I thought Chloe wouldn't be able to fill that void but man was I wrong!
More of U4? Yes please! Beautiful game with amazing graphic but everything inside is too familiar. Chloe, my favorite Uncharted character doesn't have quality narrative and comedy like Nate.
Отличная игра, сюжет, графика, атмосфера - всё на высоте. Спасибо Naughty Dog за отличную серию! Жаль, что это была последняя игра в ней...
Uncharted can be amazing withowt Drake! I remember Uncharted 2 when play this part of great adventure) Really Amazing adventure, dont miss this brilliant DLC! Tomb Raider just in past..
this DLC is more of the same but without Nathan drake. it is roughly about 8 hours . it maybe less if you are playing on easy and dont care about collecting anything or the multiplayer.

Uncharted TLL is a great addition to the the franchise. Chloe is a fantastic protagonist and at the core of the story is one of a personal journey though the tone is far less serious then that of A Thief's End. The set pieces are exhilarating as ever. Naughty Dog once again have delivered the goods.
If you love Uncharted, welcome! The Lost Legasy have all nice features from original game: awesome locations, fast gameplay, some humor.
This is a fun and exciting spin-off of Uncharted 4. It has everything you enjoy in Uncharted 4 so you can still enjoy the "game-style" even after Nathan Drake's retirement.
Completion: Finished game on normal difficulty.  Did not engage in multiplayer.

A decent game that doesn't offer much than the previous title. Yes, it is a DLC and it will be reviewed as one. The graphics are amazing as expected, the story is very interesting and focused on Indian Mythology and it took me 7 hours to finish it.

This really is a great game, a fun continuation of the Uncharted story and refinement of the gameplay that made Uncharted 1-4 fun. A branch off of the main Uncharted story, it follows Chloe from UC2 and Nadine from UC4 on their own adventure recovering a lost relic and another lost city.

Naughty God is back at it again, it’s a game, it’s a DLC an expansion whatever you want to call it this is a brilliant adventure that is only matched by a very few this year. They convey of India, Indians is excellent, as well as game play, narrative, story, puzzles and the fighting mechanics is an absolute pleasure, top draw stuff. Uncharted left a deep mark on gamers in the last decade so picking up a couple of characters from the series and develop a story around them is no brainer, we just hope to see yet another starring Sullivan next time. PLAY IT!

I prefer the other Uncharted games, but that doesn’t mean this isn’t great. They obviously had great graphics, but the animation felt weird in some scenes. The story was great though. They made a great adventure, but not as good as the other games. Also, the fighting in this game didn’t feel any new. It was a little slow, but can be very fun at times. Lastly, the voice acting was good, but the characters felt a little shallow. I think everything story wise was fun. I recommend this game.

The Lost Legacy is a decent little stand-alone expansion to Uncharted 4.  It pretty much plays identically.  The graphics and presentation are the most notable thing about this game.  Even though it only runs in 1440p/30 fps on the PS4 Pro it still looks amazing.  It's a shame it's not on the PC where it could be run in a real frame-rate at a real resolution because otherwise it would be the most graphically impressive game ever.  We'll just have to wait for the rumored Shadow of the Tomb Raider until we get something better on PC.
Una expansión de Uncharted 4 que termina por convertirse en un "juego nuevo", lo cual es un arma de doble filo, dado que mantiene y recicla cosas del juego anteriormente mencionado.

Firstly, Lost Legacy has been my 2nd favourite Uncharted (behind uncharted 2). When you get past the dull & repetitive map area and into the lost city section it really gets going and does what Uncharted does best, breathtaking caverns each more stunning than the last, complete with colossus statues and filled with jaw dropping carvings and artefacts everywhere you look. I absolutely love that stuff.

First of all i don't suggest this game to new players because if you don't know the previous events it is hard to connect emotionally with the characters and to understand some of their conversations.With the same money you can buy Uncharted collection and if you like it you can continue with Uncharted 4 and this expansion-DLC.
This is more of Uncharted so you know its high quality. This particular entry is good but falls short of greatness.

A stunning landscape, and a decent story with new open world mechanics made this game very enjoyable. The new character(s) felt well written (Of course, Naughty dog) This game with it's huge set pieces and gorgeous graphics left me simply pausing to screen shot or just look at the amazing background, graphics and, the water... the water. The villain was okay, I never loved to hate him but he made well for the plot of the game. A great send off for the series and it's iconic character of Nathan Drake, it will be missed.
Very good and solid expansion for Uncharted 4. If you want to play even more Uncharted its absolutely must have game for you. But it didn't gave me the same emotions like i had with Uncharted 4.

Not being the biggest Uncharted fan, i came into this game with no expectations as i did with uncharted 4. I had a very similar experience as i did with that game. The opening hooked me right away and i couldn't wait to see this story unfold in-front of me. Quickly after that initial "wow" moment however the story began to drag/slow down a bit and i began to worry if there really couldn't be an uncharted game without Nathen Drake. I was wrong. Ever so sightly i started liking the characters more and more. Without spoiling anything seeing them evolve as they tracked down this treasure was what kept me playing. The game in my opinion reached its peak when a third character was brought into the mix. Its ashame this was done pretty close to the end as this is when the story was at its best. All this boiled up to what i consider to be one of the best video game endings i've ever played.

What makes a game great is having it be the same as something old but be something different as well and as far as Uncharted Lost Legacy goes that pretty much sums it up. From the collective girl duo to the rugged terrain of the Indian landscape this game is by far one of the best.

title: Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection
summary: From the storytellers at Naughty Dog, comes the epic that altered adventure storytelling, rebuilt by Bluepoint Games with the power of the PS4 system. Follow the harrowing journey of Nathan Drake across the globe, from humble beginnings to incredible discoveries. Meet a unique cast of characters as Drake puts life and friendships on the line in a race against ruthless enemies to uncover unimaginable treasure. UNCHARTED: The Nathan Drake Collection includes the single-player campaigns for UNCHARTED: Drake’s Fortune, UNCHARTED 2: Among Thieves, and UNCHARTED 3: Drake’s Deception.
reviews: Without a doubt, this is the best remastered game "compilation" ever made.
An utterly essential bundle for newcomers and veterans alike, thanks to the sheer value for money and huge technical improvements to three already incredible games.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is not one or two, but three of the best PS3 games, remastered with precision, love, and care for the current generation.
While not as complete or all-around "perfect" as one might hope, this is still a must-have release for PS4 owners.
Every game in the franchise looks great, sounds even better, and will have you chuckling with the spot-on chemistry of the cast in each entry.

This revamped collection also boasts a handful of key features that include explorer mode which focuses more on story opposed to combat (great for newcomers), the speed run mode which basically times certain parts of the game like how fast you finished a section to the new brutal difficulty level which takes the game to a whole new challenge level.
A well-done remastered collection of three fantastic games. A must buy.

If you have never experienced an Uncharted game before, you owe it to yourself to pick up this collection as soon as possible, as you are missing out on an incredible journey. This is a fine example of how to re-release a great collection of games for a shiny new console. Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection definitely belongs on every PS4 owner’s shelf.
If you have the originals on PS3, you might not need this. But if you are new to the series, this collection gives you some of the best games for Sony systems.
The final two games step forward and show their well-polished improvements with graphics that laugh in the face of many 2015 releases.
Simply put, it’s one of the best remasters in history. [12/2015, p.70]

Uncharted: TNDC is one for the ages. Yes, the gameplay and visual wow-factor have faded in a few spots, but the inimitable charm of Nate and co., plus some of the best story-telling in gaming, make this a must-have. [Christmas 2015, p71]
Three of the best games on PS3 remastered so they look like they came out last week, and all on one disc to boot? It's a no-brainer for fans and newcomers alike. [Dec 2015, p.72]
Three of the best looking, most fun and widely loved games all on one disc.

Nathan Drake breathes Adventure with a capital ‘A’. That’s why the collection is a must-have for anyone who’s never played the original games before. A godly trio on just one disc. [Sept. 2015, p. 064]
Nevertheless, Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a bringing together of what is probably the best set of games of the last generation.

If you’ve played the games before then the Uncharted Collection serves as a great reminder of the story up to now in preparation for Uncharted 4, and for those of you who have not played any of the previous entries, or only played one or two, then this game is a must.
Fantastic restoration craft, that didn’t spoil the spirit of the originals at all. As you can say “do not fix what is not broken”. Just gently brush it up and wait for a deserved applause.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a fantastic purchase for fans of the franchise or newcomers to the PlayStation

The Nathan Drake Collection is an ambitious collection, that includes
three of the best action adventure games from the last generation.
What makes the collection better than the average remaster is the
improvements, that the developer Blueprint have added. The graphics
are almost as good as many of the games today, and the controls have
gotten an improvement.

An essential purchase for Uncharted newbies and the graphical upgrade makes it hard to resist for series fans too. Naughty Dog's trilogy shames the competition with exceptionally detailed levels, blockbuster action scenes and a lovable cast that will be sorely missed when the series wraps up with Uncharted 4 next year.

A well-made collection that in one package includes the technically improved versions of three of the most important titles of PS3, reminding us why we eagerly anticipate the next adventure of Nathan Drake. It is however beyond us why the Golden Abyss had to be omitted.
The upgraded versions of the Uncharted-games are great, especially for Drake's Fortune. The changed shooting system and the upgraded visuals are making the game even better than before.
The HD remaster in particular does wonders for the series and makes Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection an easy recommendation for PS4 owners.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection presents fantastic remasters of three incredible games, and is an absolute no-brainer as a result.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is probably the best PS4 remaster thus far – and the system's had more than enough of them to give that statement weight.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a truly fantastic trio of games that are a mere rope swing away from perfection.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is the best way to play three of the best last gen games. Beautiful 1080p at 60 FPS, makes this versions of Naughty Dog’s master pieces the ultimate ones.
The Nathan Drake Collection is the best HD remake from 2015. Anyone who has got a PS4 and likes adventure should run to their nearest game store and buy this game. It's definitely worth your money.

The Nathan Drake Collection is worth playing, even if we've already finished the games on PlayStation 3. It's a perfect remaster that enhances not only resolution, but also every other aspect of the games - with benefits for the players.

For only sixty euros, you can own three action/adventure masterpieces. Even after all those years, we're still amazed by the perfect balance between exploration, gunfights and reflection. If you can afford it, don't hesitate one bit.
The story, characters and action sequences all add up to one of the best experiences video games has to offer. Every PlayStation 4 owner should have this in their library.
These games have aged remarkably well, they’re still an absolute to play, and their characters are as charming and memorable as ever.
Fans who have already played the PS3 games will be pleased with the improvements, and newbies interested in Uncharted 4: A Thief’s End will have the perfect place to start.

Uncharted trilogy still feels like great adventure games, and looks amazing in 1080p, but we miss multiplayer and the Drake´s Fortune level design seems outdated compared with the other two games. Regardless, gameplay and storytelling are perfectly balanced.

Anybody who’d like to replay the series or experience it for the first time before the looming release of Unharted 4 have no reason not to pick up The Nathan Drake Collection; it’s simply the best way to experience three great games.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is probably one of the best remastered collections I've ever played. If you own the Uncharted games, they look much better in 1080p at a smooth 60 fps. If you've never played them, now is the time to get in on the action. Great games, great collection.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is exactly what you’d expect. The first game doesn’t quite measure up and could turn off newcomers (always a concern), and the games really don’t have a lot of “new” in them. But really, the brilliance of this top-tier action/adventure series remains in full view throughout, and the remastering veterans at Bluepoint did a good job.
All three Uncharted games are must-plays, and Bluepoint Games has done an exceptional job porting the trilogy over on PlayStation 4 with The Nathan Drake Collection.

The Nathan Drake Collection is a strong remaster. The issues from the first game are almost all gone and the games look amazing. Especially Among Thieves and Drake's Deception are as fantastic as they used to be. This collection is a must-have for people that missed those originals, but it is good to replay them too.

The three Uncharted titles are still as fun as ever, but now they are more enjoyable at 1080p and 60fps. Bluepoint Games also added a few new game modes and graphical enhancements. All in all, this is a great package, but we find the lack of multiplayer somewhat disappointing.

Playing the iterations consecutively feels good and you can actually witness how Naughty Dog progressed as a story-teller. Every title absolutely holds up and can take its rightful place among current-gen releases.

We've seen many remasters, but when it comes to tech aspects, Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is among the best. Even if it lacks multiplayer and Golden Abyss, it is an impeccable piece of work.
Overall it’s a very good package and the best way to prepare for Uncharted 4 if you missed something during the PS3 era.
Best description for Nathan Drake Collection: 3 in 1. Yes, that's it. Three classic (and you're really must play them) PS3 games come to new generation with 1080p/60fps.
If you never played Uncharted 2 and don’t have a PS3, this collection is a good buy on PS4. Otherwise, your mileage will vary.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a slice of action gaming joy well worth a look for fans of the series and an absolute must-own for newbies. If you’ve never dabbled in Uncharted, get it immediately. You are about to have so much fun with a controller in your hands that it should probably be illegal.

For long-term fans of the franchise, the title offers a simple way to experience the solid stories and the engaging gameplay once again using improved visuals, getting a deeper understanding of the links between the installments and how they might influence the coming A Thief's End. For those who have not played an Uncharted game before, The Nathan Drake Collection is the perfect way to see what the series has to offer and why so many gamers see it as one of the most important ones in the history of gaming.

Drake's Fortune starts to show its age, but other than that, this is a fine collection of one of the greatest franchises the PlayStation brand has ever produced. If you haven't played these yet, then what are you waiting for?

For all the game industry’s current obsession with open worlds and open-ended narratives, the Uncharted games stand as a shining example of the possibility for linear stories to be infinitely re-playable. They don’t need anything more.

Remasters can be great or not-so-great products. This one came up pretty well, with a solid tech upgrade, and becoming a very valuable collection. Needless to say, the trilogy remastered is a genre-defining one, and this, the best way to play it.
Bluepoint Games is indeed a talented team when it comes to remasters. If you missed the original games, or you are in the mood for some re-textured deja vus, this is a great choice.

A great compilation that manages to make Nathan Drake look better than ever, despite the fact that its first game was released long ago. Its only flaw is the elimination of the multiplayer modes on the 2nd and 3rd entries.
If you haven't played The Uncharted Trilogy on PS3, the glory of 1080p and 60 frames per second ensures the best way to enjoy these games on PS4.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is an exercise in reestablishing familiarity with one of Sony’s most recognizable faces. Almost everything new in the game is ancillary, but what makes this retrospective collection worth consideration is the the quality of design the original games brought to the table.
The Nathan Drake Collection presents a trilogy of single-player adventures at their technical best, but the value proposition will depend on series experience and a few matters of preference.
At the end of the day if you are looking to relive Nathan Drakes’ adventures, or you want to experience them for the first time, then Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is the way to do it.

Great game series in one edition, graphically enhanced and rejuvenated still offers the same great gameplay. If you missed any of the parts, or the whole series, don’t hesitate and buy the compilation at once. [Issue#258]
If you’re just in it for the solo games — and let’s face it, Uncharted is at its best when it’s just you and Mr. Drake clinging to things together — the Collection is a fine choice.
It has some minor technical problems, but the care that Bluepoint has put into The Nathan Drake Collection makes it clear that this is far more than a rudimentary cash-in. [Issue#263, p.60]

A well made remaster, especially when it comes to the first chapter, that's kinda ruined by the absence of the multiplayer and some bugs. It's still three great games for an honest price though. If for any reason you never played the series, this is a great way to experience some of the best games the tps genre has to offer.
This is a generous, technically excellent and genuinely fascinating omnibus.
If you never played Uncharted, with the Nathan Drake Collection you're in for a hell of a ride. But the lack of any juicy extra content is a shame.

A wonderfully remastered trip into Nathan Drake’s past rekindles some of the joy the franchise has brought to its thousands of fans, but also makes some of its more glaring shortcomings far more noticeable. Still, the best Uncharted Collection you could’ve hoped for is finally here.
This is the best kind of remaster: a lovingly crafted technical update that's also a master class on how a developer can evolve ideas.

It’s a slight disappointment that the compilation doesn’t sum up the story to date somewhere. Not a lot was needed, but a little bit — character bios here, a brief rundown of each game there — would have provided the perfect starting point for Uncharted 4.
An excellent remastering effort for anyone looking to discover or relive Nathan Drake’s unparalleled peril.

While the Uncharted series does have few bumps and bruises, and Drake’s wrinkles have deepened over time, fans of the Drake’s story, and action adventure games alike, couldn’t have asked for anything better.
An excellent remaster of three of the PlayStation 3’s best looking games, but none of them have aged quite as gracefully as you might expect.

Despite the market becoming saturated with remakes, re-masters, and re-releases, the Nathan Drake Collection is one that both fans of the series will enjoy for its slight improvements, and, those that missed it the first time around can enjoy as a series that stands up pretty well to father time.

This glorious compilation is the definitive way to experience the trilogy, whether you're a returning fan after a recap ahead of Uncharted 4: A Thief's End or a newcomer looking to pop your Uncharted cherry. Either way, you're in for a treat.
The Nathan Drake Collection is a firsthand account of Naughty Dog's growth as a storyteller, and this collection is the best way to relive that history, and witness its transformation up close.

Whether you play through these three games once, or several times, Uncharted is still required gaming. The Nathan Drake Collection puts three of last generation’s most important games in one place, all with enhancements that make it the best way to experience Nathan Drake’s story.

If you were already a fan of the series, this remastered bundle will be worth picking up. Those who are a bit more cynical, as I was, may very well find themselves surprised by the time they’ve slogged through all three of them. Pleasantly so.

If you’ve never played an Uncharted game, by all means, fire it up. Go hunt for El Dorado; go to Shangri-La; go find the Atlantis of the Sands. The core gameplay might tire you out a little, but you’ll be handsomely rewarded with lovely cinematic shots, quirky dialogue from a group of affable characters, and stories from adventures you’ll likely never forget.
A sumptuous remaster, but the games themselves have aged badly.

Feeling jealous listening my PS3 friends talking wonderful things about Uncharted, finally i had the chance to play it, and yes, it is true, it is one of the best games ever played. Good story with a lot of action, you can't stop playing, you won't find a boring moment letting you to quit. They made a great job with the remasterization.

It's brilliant that Bluepoint remastered these Naughty Dog gems and re-released them all together for the price of one game! I've never had a chance to play these until now. I finished The Last of Us Remastered which is also by Naughty Dog and it was an absolute sensation. I'm currently 70% through the Drake's Fortune and I'm loving it. Plus I've heard the second game is even better! I'm very happy with this great collection.
3 Great games looking better than ever, especially Uncharted 1, my only complaint is there's no form of MP, that's it. other than that, this is the best remaster since GTA V.

I don't wanna say long. Why? I feel I don't have to. If you say bad about this thing, what would you like in the world? I love the game, I love the characters, and I love the stories. This game make me feel so excited.

I didnt have the chance to play Uncharted series before, and now thanks to this wonderful Remaster i can play them all. Its so great, i love the gameplay, the stories, musics and everything. Bought it yesterday and i just cant stop playing it. I love the first part of it and every one say that 2 and 3 are even better!

As a new player on PS4, I was once a 360 fanboy. And now, I moved on to PS4 because of this series alone. End of youtube era (my own) watching Uncharted 1-2-3. Now I am having this amazing Uncharted The Nathan Drake Collection. And I must said, playing is always better than watching. The gameplay is okay with not much innovate but the most shining things about Uncharted is musical, story, settings and level design and the very high quality graphic. Those things help the gameplay entertaining and making you can stop playing until you have to stop to eat, work and study. (kidding).
Had to give this game a 10 to balance out all of the trolls giving it a poor rating for no reason.
Naughty Dog can do no wrong in my eyes and I'm more than happy to hand over my cash to play three of the best games ever made, now looking even better than ever. Enjoy.

Lazy cash in from last gen games. Completely mediocre of third person cover shooter, scripted and linear to the point of extreme boredom. A complete rip off of every B grade adventure movie ever made.
Does Naughty Dog ever fail to make a good game?

if you own them all on the play station 3 there isn't much value for money here...but for those who never played any of them or for those who are missing a chapter in the story like i was, then this is a must for PS owners...if it were cheaper and had multiplayer it be alot easier to recommend...the price will drop quickly so there's no issues with waiting

The greatest remaster of three of the greatest games ever made. Negative reviews must be from Xbox owners that cry they buy the low-end 900p console on which they never can play some good exlusive game.

I've owned a PS3 since 2012, but criminally, I never owned an Uncharted game. Then, around a month ago, I picked up a PS4 that came bundled with Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection. At first, I didn't want my first PS4 game to be remastered last gen games, I wanted to experience the new stuff, but I gave it a whirl anyway, it was all I had after all. I have now completed all 3 games, and they just might have been some of the the finest pieces of media I've ever laid eyes on.

First off: if you enjoy adventure games, then get this collection! After playing through all these 3 masterpieces ( considering it's time ), I'd say time and money very well spent! The story is really good and the character building is just outstanding. The game play however can get a little boring since it is almost a repetitive design of this: Climb to puzzle, figure puzzle out, bad guys followed you, shoot bad guys dead, climb again. This is however not a problem since the art direction is incredible. The remastered graphics really are great and you won't even notice these games are kind of old. Uncharted has just become one of my favourite game series and is an absolute HAVE TO PLAY for fans of the adventure genre.

This remaster is a real dream-come-true for somebody like me, who wasn't able to play Uncharted before. It was a great adventure, and makes me excited when I think about Uncharted 4. I recommend it for everyone, but especially those who weren't able to enjoy the game on PS3. If you have a PS4 then it's a must have.

After reading through the negative comments, it is obvious that mot of them are from XBox fan boys. A lot of them will question the $60 of remastered game and compare it to Gears of War Collection and Halo MCC (which was also $60 at launch). This is NOT just a re-release of the previous 3 games. They are remastered to 1080p, there are new game modes such as Speed Run mode, new difficulty settings, new trophies, and more. The only complaint I have is one that returns from the original release of Drake's Fortune. The controls when platforming seem just a bit off. But that is only in the first game. It is fixed in the 2nd and 3rd entries.

Awesome remaster for those who have not played the game before. In a nutshell, this is the best way to experience the first three main games of the Uncharted series and for veterans of the series to replay the games.
Best remaster ever made. You never did Uncharted on PS3? THEN GO FOR IT!

Every gamer should play this series.  I played them all on PS3 and had to come back for another helping.  The remaster looks excellent.  Naughty Dog did us all a huge favor by implementing the U2 controls into the other games. No more sixaxis grenade arc!!! The set pieces in U2 can't be beat and the melee combat in U3 is a blast to play with.  Looking forward to the final installment next year.

Having never played any of the uncharted games previously, I couldn't pass up the chance to see what everyone was raving about...... I have to say, I was VERY impressed. Yes, they are remasters, but how can you complain when you are getting 3 quality games for such a small price.

I am new to this type of genre of game but I absolutely loved the three games.  They are both great games but the environments in two and three were outstanding.  The gameplay does get repetitive but in general it is fun and I enjoyed the storytelling and historical/geographical parts of the game.

Scoring this collection is difficult. Uncharted 2 and 3 are easily 9.0's. But Uncharted: Drake's Fortune really does not age all that well. It's still a 7/10, but it does negatively impact the collection's overall score. And yes, I could've split this into three reviews on each games' page, but who has the time for that? So here's a quick review for each of the games.
Como fan de las peliculas de aventuras, puedo decir que los juegos de Uncharted son mis juegos favoritos.
Buy it, even if you already own the games already! If you don't own the games, you can't miss this opportunity to get tham all at this amazing price. .

Ignore the trolls. This series is one of the greatest of all time. I recommend it especially if you never played any uncharted. This would also be worth picking up even if you played Uncharted before because the improved graphics look amazing.
here are some bug here and there but in an overall point of view this is a delight to play those games.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection was such a great tie within the Uncharted series and one of the greatest remasters to play. Definitely a must get if you were a fan of the series and just want some nonstop fun action!

never played uncharted on ps3 as i had an xbox 360. bought the collection on ps4 and already completed the first two, halfway through the third one now. what a masterpiece!!! uncharted 2 was without a doubt one of the best action games i have ever played in my entire life. uncharted 1 was also brilliant. halfway through the 3rd and have to say this is one of the best gaming series of all time. 10/10 so far! if you never played uncharted buy it, it's worth it. even if you did play them on ps3, play them again so you can experience them in glorious 1080p and 60fps! you will even get access to the beta in December!

Great games, very similar to Tomb Raider. A must play for anyone who had a 360 last gen like myself and missed these. Like The Last of Us tho, it was maybe a little overhyped, but I won't mark it down for that.
I came into this collection as Uncharted virgin and I come out as a fan of the series.

Jeśli ktoś nie grał, bo np. nie miał PS3, jak ja - pozycja obowiązkowa. Polecam zdecydowanie, ja dla tej serii kupiłem PS4, choć jestem zatwardziałym PC-towcem. Polecam.

Absolutely amazing game! The haters on this reviews, after reading some of them, are people that don't own the game. They're literally fanboys. Speaking truthfully, this game was my first UC game and I've played all three. They are AMAZING! UC3 is the weakest, IMO. But it still stands as one of the best! A must play if you want a thrilling story and good action!
3 amazing Uncharted games at 1080p/60fps with graphics and gameplay improvements for the price of 1. Admit it, 360 switchers got the better deal out this.
Amazing collection of 3 of the best games of last gen... Ignore all the xbox fan salt their 0-3 ratings fool nobody.
Okay, i never played this game on PS4 (I'm going to buy this, because i loved The Last of Us and Uncharted 3)
The Best Action Adventure Franchise of PS3 is now on PS4 with all 3 Game in one Disc

It's funny to see how poor are these xbox/nintendo fanboys,more than 50% users score negative (now 60 negative,117 positive) and when you see users reviews,only 2 negatives (now) where is these others 58?You want one example?That Wanderlei (http://www.metacritic.com/user/Wanderlei) a nintendo fanboy has 3 negatives reviews in you profile (now,and guess,Uncharted Collection,Bloodborne and The Last of Us remastered,all score 0,and all others reviews games from Nintendo a perfect score),you see,that is the problem from users reviews in exclusives games,you see the level of mature here?Wait until Uncharted 4 release.If you never play a Uncharted game on PS3,go get it,when a exclusive game has a lot of haters from another plataform you know,thats a good game,here we have 3 incredible games,Uncharted 2 alone won over 100 Game of the Year in 2009,most awarded game in 2009,Uncharted 2/3 gorgeous visuals for 7th gen,now not even close 8th gen AAA visuals,but still beautiful,upgrade 1080p,60fps,and acess to beta multiplayer Uncharted 4.If you never play Uncharted before and wants play Uncharted 4,go get it that Collection now!seriously.
Great series beautifully remastered for nextgen consoles, dont know why theyre getting so much hate when faithful fans wanted this collection on the newgen consoles.

Xbox fans are jealous and trying to rate bad this collection.  Don't be fooled,  I've never played any uncharted before but I saw a sample on the ps3 and it's looks better and more beautiful on the ps4, I just think that this game could be cheaper but that doesn't mean that it's not worthy.

they did an excellent job at remastering the games. the screen tearing and controller lag that plague the ps3 versions are gone. and with the tearing and the tighter controls made playing these games again even more enjoyable than the first time.. but the fully appreciate the remaster you have to play the original ps3 version. those that give a bad reviews of this without ever playing it on the ps3  should have their reviews disregaurded. as they don't realize the original version pushed the ps3 to it absolute limits. and now  with the remastered  you can say games look a lot better and finally play the why they were ment to be played. and the storytelling is by far the best part of the game not the action. these games aren't ment for speed runners those types of gamers will get no enjoyment from these games ther is too many cut scenes and story for their tastes.

who could possibly go with lower of 10 grade?? FFS this remastered is the best remastered collection ever happened in playstation hystory games.Totally nailed it every true gamer MUST Have it in collection!!

Having spent the last-gen primarily on the 360 I never got the chance to play any of these titles. Hearing great things of Uncharted, I thought I'd pick up the collection and give it a go. The games, in summary, are amazing. I naturally started from Uncharted 1 and worked my way through the trilogy. It's great to see how the games evolved along the series with all still looking great due to a wonderful job done by Bluepoint Games. If you've never played these games before, then now is the time to play them, you won't regret it.
A fantastic remasterd game with improved graphics, great gameplay , great story , much content and a lot of content. A very good game . A absolute must buy for playstation 4 owners.
Uncharted 2, in my opinion, is a 10/10 game. For that reason alone, I'm rating this collection a 10.

This is a good collection of games, however there is a problem (and hence the score of "6"). The second game contains a game breaking bug on a tutorial that stops all further progress. The only way around this is to remap your controller buttons, but try to tell this to the average user.
This game is an amazing remaster of an awesome trilogy! Having played it several hours now, I can honestly say I am hooked. Can't wait to try out different modes.
Played Uncharted 1,2,3 already morethan 5 times in ps3,and loved it
Amazing collection of a great series. just finished the first uncharted and for a game thats already 7 years old it was beautiful. and it will only get better from what i hear! so excited.
Really don't get why 65 negative votes? This is masterpiece, even for old games...thank good for ND + Bluepoint. You get 3 great games in better quality, what else to want?
Really great way to experience this amazing collection of games. Cannot recommend this enough, i am a newbie to the uncharted series, before this collection i had not played any Uncharted. 10/10

3 critically acclaimed games in one disk? how is this bad? if you're a xbox 360 user that now owns a ps4, that is your chance of experiencing this series. i don't know why this even has to be reviewed, just go to search metacritic, type uncharted and look at those reviews. now get those 3 critically acclaimed games you just searched, put at 1080p 60fps, with better textures,  in one disk, and there you go. the only bad part is the lack of multiplayer, but i don't think that's a big deal, those 3 games together have like 70 hours of gameplay anyway.

absolutely amazing game! UC 1 feels so much more fluid and the lighting has been improved so no more eye sores. Uc2 was also well done and so was uc3. But uc1 feels the most improved and is by far my favorite one. Must get!
Without doubt, U:TNDC the best remastered game on ps4 to date.
Simply the best remastered ever made. 3 very good games for the price of 1.

Maybe my review is clouded by nostalgia, but these games are still amazing.  I've read reviews that state they haven't aged well, particularly "Drake's Fortune," but after finishing the first of the trilogy again, I still find the game more enjoyable than almost anything made today.  It looks even better with Bluepoint's improved visuals, and the mechanics are still fluid and fun.  If you're a gamer and have never experienced the Uncharted series, it's a must play.  And if you enjoyed them previously, take another run through a series that mixes story, character, and game play better than any other franchise.

The upgrades to the games are good and welcomed as they now run at 1080p 60fps but I found the gameplay generic and stories of each game cliche ridden sorry but I don't understand the hype behind these games.

Like with most game remasterings, this is a must for anyone who hasn't played the original versions, and still provides good reasons to play these 3 great games again. This collection is an AMAZING deal. You get three excellent games for the price of one; and these games should be replayed, even if you (like me), played them exhaustive in the past. I honestly lost count of how many times I've played this series and that did not stop me from having a lot of fun with the remastered ones. Also, the collection does not include Multiplayer (but who cares?). Some thoughts on each of the games:

A zero from me because it is a cash grab rehash. Why release Unchartered 4 when you can make another few $millions from a remaster? A financial decision nothing else. We've had these games already. Let's have something new. If it's not a cash grab then sell it for $20 not the price of a new release which is what they are asking. These are old games. We got Halo 5 today not a remaster of Halo 4.  I got Tomb Raider definitive edition for $10. This should cost no more than $30 as its old, outdated content not a new retail game just released. Price does matter. You pay full retail price for a new release not a rehash remaster with a few tweaks here & there. Not good enough. Zero points. Sony wouldn't make it backward compatible so you have to buy it again for PS4. Many games you bought on a 360 you won't have to buy again shortly when backward compatibility is introduced. This is a cash grab nothing less.

My review was so hated that it was removed. I didn't say anything wrong, I just questioned the value owning three old games in 1080p. Yeah, they do look good, but they are stripped down versions with no multiplayer. The Rare replay gives you hard to find retro games, and Gears Ultimate Edition gives you the class multiplayer game. $60 is a pretty lame price tag from Sony, a dev that says they are only going to focus on new games. If that isn't hypocrisy what is? I really do wonder why my review was taken down though.

I had never played the Uncharted games on PS3 so this was a brand new experience for me.  As far as gameplay, there were definitely some fun times to be had jumping around the environments, leaping distances no human should ever be able to clear.  Cool climbing/leaping aside, the puzzles became tedious and the firefights were pretty standard cover fire.  The graphics, though remastered, felt very dated and the story was so cheesy.  I understand the "cheesiness" may have been intentional to appeal to a wider audience but I absolutely wasn't expecting to feel so disconnected from basically all of the characters, including Drake.  I would maybe buy this compilation for $10 if I had to do it all over again, definitely not worth the $50 I paid for it.

A complete and utter cash grab. The multiplayer is not in tact, other than resolution there is no graphical overhaul. All that for $60? Right. This should take notes from Halo MCC, they overhauled the graphics and included all the multiplayer components.

I played first game, but could not finished because there will come a part where player dies constantly in 2 seconds and that is not possible to get passed because aiming is too slow and ally go where you need to shoot. A brilliant remastering job by Bluepoint of one of the most epic journeys in the history of gaming, this is a fantastic trio of games at an incredible price. Uncharted 2 still stands as something beyond a perfect 10, but 1 was groundbreaking and still fun, and 3 is a solid 9.5. Must play for all gamers everywhere.

What else to say? In case you didn't know these games raised the bar for story driven action games on the PS3. They looked like fantastic movies but never forgot they were games and while you could never call Uncharted innovative the combination of perfect pacing, great script, jaw dropping set pieces and action is still the benchmark for this genre today, especially Uncharted 2. Even the first game, while undoubtedly the weakest of the three is still a cracking adventure.
Naughty dog create best games, because they creating interesting characters in their storyes. This aspect with perfect gameplay is based element of their succes. Special thanks for czech subtitles.

I've got to wonder if any of the people complaining about 1080p being the only upgrade have ever played the originals. Textures, lighting, shadows have all been upgraded. Reactive foliage, anti aliasing... I could go on but the point is all the negative reviews don't have a clue what they're talking about. Funny how they all list X1 remasters that are better... Sure, Gears of War where you only get one game for that money and is the most generic shooter ever built is better (I'm being sarcastic and yes, I own an X1 that came with that game- wish it had been physical so I could have traded it in) and Rare Replay with a dozen games you never wanted to get the one that you did with very little upgrades to the graphics or gameplay and annoying borders on the screen. Such a deal!! Again, sarcasm. Uncharted has never been about the multiplayer, it was tacked on at best and only gained a cult following in 3. Multiplayer in almost every game is highly overrated. Babies who whine about it not being in every single game ever released need to recognize that the rest of us have grown up and recognized what a repetitive slog most MO games are. But if you need to run around the same maps over and over shooting people in the face to good about yourself, that's your problem not ours.

First time to ever play these games as I never had a PS3. They are all great adventure games with part 2 probably the highlight. Well written characters and 3 good stories. Part 1 is mostly shootouts interspersed with puzzles, but still very enjoyable. Part 2 & 3 are more of the same but there are better set-pieces thrown in. Simple concept but very effective, keep in mind it is a remastered PS3 game so don't expect anything groundbreaking.

This is how you do a remaster. Very polished the visual improvements are substantial, tweaks to the game it's self. The guns seems louder. The controls are refined. Even the sound is re engineered. Considering this is 3 of the best games ever made in one polished package it's not bad value. No multiplayer ported across but that's no major gripe I guess. At least give it a rent you may be surprised how improved this is.

I cannot believe how some people are rating this low. This is 3 games in 1 with upped resolutions and 60 FPS. This is meant for people who did not play the games on a PS3. People complaining that this is a cash grab are silly. This isn't a bad port with bugs or with 30 FPS, it's a pretty good port with all 3 games in 1. If you bought this game brand new, that's $20 per game which is a pretty fair deal. Now you can probably get it on sale for cheaper.

El juego lo compre en un dia de aburrimiento y vaya que me lo saco. Nunca juegue un uncharted (vengo de xbox 360) por lo que ya era hora y ademas juagar a 3 juegos por el precio de uno, en fin una ganga. El juego esta muy bien, el primer uncharted me encanto, esa mezcla de indiana jones y tomb raider sumado a la carisma de nathan hicieron que el primer juego me lo pasara el mismo dia fue ena experiencia muy redonda. El segundo me gusto aun mas ya que es en esa entrega donde se nota un salto tecnico y jugable mas grande, los escenarios y puzzles son mas dificiles y hermosos y la jugabilidad (el disparo fundamentalmente) se ve claramente mejorada y se nota mas la verticalidad de los escenarios. En cuanto a la tercera entrega no la pude terminar por el hecho de que era lo mismo que la segunda pero con mejores graficos (lo cual no significa nada si no viene acompañado con otra cosa) en cuanto a la jugabilidad es la misma y me dio la sensacion de que los puzzles se hicieron menos divertidos que antes y aburridos ya que solamente en la tercera entrega sufrí con los puzzles e incluso me hartaron lo cual me llevo a dejar el juego en la mision 6. Buen juego ya que pagamos 1 y nos llevamos 3 y muy recomendado para aquellos que como yo no juagron a un uncharted, el 1 y 2 epicos y el 3 normalito. Si ya jugaste a los anteriores 3 diria encarecidamente que no lo compres.

The perfect collection or exactly what you want from a remaster. The last time I saw a collection this great was the Orange Box back in 2007. Alright, so i'm the biggest fan when it comes to the Uncharted series. I remember when I first bought Uncharted: Drake's Fortune for PS3 back in 2007. I was 10 at the time and had no idea about the game, just thought the cover art looked pretty neat and I had just enough Birthday money to purchase it and I'm so glad I did. I believe Uncharted: Drake's Fortune was the first game I ever beat to its fullest. If you are just playing these Uncharted games for the first time, you're still missing out. It would've been better if you were there when it was first released. I bought every Uncharted game on its release date and I still couldn't part with my PS3 copies as I purchased the Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection. Still enjoyable and i'm still having as much fun as I did when they released for PS3. Beautiful story and characters are incredible. Each game still looks fairly good. Drake's Fortune is a little dated, Uncharted 2 still has an incredible story, and Uncharted 3 still has a very intense and unique story and still looked incredible on the PS4 even though it was released 2011. These games are incredible and the release of Uncharted 4 will be very emotional for me.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a collection reccomend to anybody who is interested in playing the entire Uncharted the series. The package is an overall good value including the first 3 games in the series. The menus are well done and easy to navigate and each game is here in their full version except multiplayer. My personal favorite of the collection is Uncharted 2: Among Thieves. I found Uncharted: A Drake’s fortune dated by modern standards and merely average and Uncharted 3: Drake’s Deception an above average game with a good production. I recommend getting this collection and playing these games before buying the 4th and final installment. For value Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is good.
After playing and reviewing all the games in this collection, gets a score of 8 from me. All in all a good collection and worth playing through.

A great way to tide you over until the real fun begins (uncharted 4). Унылый тир с сюжетом среднего качества. Купил только по рекомендациям друзей, которые говорили "шедевр, 10 из 10". Это не шедевр и не 10 из 10. I never had any desire to play Uncharted, to me it always looked like a playable movie and I have always thought in games game play is key. The only reason I have this game is because it came bundled with the PS4, and even then the only reason I played it was because I had no other games to play. So it came as quite a surprise when I really enjoyed these games. The story is nothing special until 3, but the characters are so well realized. The experience benefits from being a game as it makes us relate to Nathan and become engrossed in the situation, so it really couldn't work as a movie without missing out on a large portion of it. The first game is enjoyable and is really just another action game. The second game is where the pacing and mechanics start to sharpen up to give a truly compelling experience. By three the game game play is quite good and the level design is great. It is also great to play a game where the levels are well designed and unique and skill as opposed to leveling is required to get through it. Uncharted really surprised me and opened my mind to what experiences games can offer beyond just Mario levels of game play joy. Uncharted is not without flaws though, some levels make the actions necessary unclear, sometimes the combat is wonky and unfocused, and some levels do not feel interactive enough. Even as a story based game the story feels quite thin until the third one and even at that the story is not revolutionary or a must see.
Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a must have for any PS4 owner, regardless of whether they had played the originals on PS3.

Gave me the chance to play what became my favorite franchise of all time, Uncharted 2: Among Thieves is the best , so good (9.4/10), Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception still looks really good (9.3/10), the only one that I didn't like was the first Uncharted.

I loved Uncharted on the PS4. I really liked that Bluepoint remastered the uncharted games. The graphics are much better. I'm also glad that I can use my PS4 more and not have to switch between my PS3 to my PS4 whenever I want to play different games.

Es una buena recopilación de los Uncharted´s de PS3, pero es vergonzoso que Sony  y Naughty Dog tenga que hacer volver a pagar porlos juegos en un compilado que salio hasta con un pack de PS3 (juegos mas consola). Podrian haber incorporado Retrocompatibilidad, aunque solo sea con unos títulos seleccionados como ocurre en Xbox. La historia de los Uncharted, Bien, pero este juego, junto a otros como The Last of Us Remastered,  demuestran la falta de ideas en Sony y en esta generación de consolas en general.
Excelente remastered, el primer juego a 1080p, bueno es creible ya que el mejor studio de Sony lo desarrollo.

A literal definition of essential. Any PS4 owner must have this. At the end of the 3rd storyline you will want to forget the plots of these games and replay them. The campaign is a wonderful experience with intriguing narrative, well written screenplay, career high voice acting and creative level design. There is plenty of replay value as well, like collecting artefacts, re-visiting levels with different character skins while having the ability to add cheats such as unlimited ammo. The game play is solid, the shooting and fighting mechanics are swift and the platforming is no where near sticky.The enemies are intelligent but not robots. The puzzles are simple enough to be solved and you can skip them if you get stuck. Every set piece brings something new to the table, you will think you're in an action movie. The graphics have somewhat been polished with only the first game showing its age. Sadly on-line play is not available in the collection, but the series was not known for that. The only arguments you will have is which game is the best (it's the second one). If you've never played these games, get it, if you have, get it, if you're planning to get Uncharted 4, get this collection and play it. I might be over-praising the game, but i didn't call it an essential for no reason.

This is an absolutely amazing collection of games. While it doesn't have any multiplayer, it doesn't even matter because the 3 single player experiences are so great. I've gotten 100s of hours out of this game which is why I would recommend it to gamer, especially those that did not get to play these games on the PS3.

I absolutely Love the Uncharted Series. After finishing Drake's Fortune back on PS3, I was Amazed by it. Uncharted has Awesome Storytelling, Voice Over work, Humor, and more Importantly, it's Excellent Cinematography. NaughtyDog did an Awesome Job of what they did with the Uncharted Franchise and with out a doubt, the best Franchise I've ever played on my PS4!!

Three great games remastered in one package but "remaster" does the collection a disservice, Uncharted 3 is not only the pinnacle of the series but it's the best looking game on Playstation 4 showing that 60 frames per second really does go a long way, a 2011 masterpiece still outshining the latest games in 2016.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a remastered compilation of the action-adventure shooter platform video games Uncharted: Drake's Fortune, Uncharted 2: Among Thieves and Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception.

Having skipped over the previous generation of consoles, this was the first time I experienced the Uncharted collection, which came with my PS4. Many say the games haven't aged well, however I personally thought they looked and played great.

First time ever played uncharted(cause i had a 360) and really suprised how good they are. Uncharted 1 hasnt aged that well however 2 and 3 are amazing. I prefer 3 cause its very action packed like 2 and has amazing puzzles like 1. Overall really good games and a must buy.
I love this game. It's an awesome action adventure just like the others. I don't know how to say it but. Whatever. Uncharted is an awesome game and it always will be.

This bundle is great for persons who haven't played Uncharted series on PlayStation 3. These games are not only one of the best games of adventure genre, but one also of the best exclusive games for Sony.

The Uncharted series presents interesting histories and gorgeous, really beautiful, graphics. It has a smooth combat system (although countless waves of enemies can get repetitive) and the puzzles are ok. The fact that the character can only carry two weapons adds realism to the combats.
The three games are as fun as all the last. A great deal containing some really fun, exciting and tricky game play. If you have a PS4, then I recommend you to buy it! =)

A collection of the most over-hyped games of the century. These games are absolute, by-the-book cliches. Hollywood plot? Check. Michael Bay explosions? Check. A non-military, untrained guy  shooting gazillions of well-armed men. Check! Check! Check! I could go on, why it is this bad, but it is simply not worth it.One of the critics nailed it perfectly in their review: "More Sahara than Raiders of the lost ark..."

I have never played Uncharted games until i bought this amazing collection. It will keep you entertained for a long time.If you like a good adventure,good campaign story,this is for you.So many great missions,places.Graphics are tottaly fine,even in the first game.I mean,graphics aren't even matter,when the game is good.Great collection,definetely!

Some of the best games ever made, in my opinion. Having never got the chance to play any of them on the PS3, however when I picked up my PS4 the collection came bundled with it and not knowing much about the uncharted series I went in with an open mind. To my surprise I found some of the most well written games I have ever come across, with what I would consider the best voice acting of any game. For me Uncharted 2 is the best game in the collection and just for that game alone the collection is well worth the price and the other 2 games are also amazing but not quite as good as number 2. I would definitely recommend to anyone considering picking up this bundle.
Uncharted: the Nathan drake collection is an action game made by naughty dogs.

The Nathan Drake Collection is the equivalent of the Indiana Jones films: a high octane adventure of action, wonderful set pieces and great performances of the characters all around. It is a worthy buy for anyone who has not played the Uncharted series ever and has gotten a PS4 that wants some good exclusives. It comes at a 60 FPS with updated visuals that make the adventures great to partake in and enjoy. The first game is the weakest of the three  and the second and third will get huge bumps in quality as you go in order.

Fantastic remaster of timeless classics from the PS3. Some parts didn't age as well, but that's to be expected. There are some frustrations with the cover system and little bugs that remain from the originals. I didn't expect them to be knocked out in the remaster, but still frustrating nonetheless. Gives me a chance to play these games on a better system. I'm happy to put the collection right next to my PS3 versions of the respective games.

Awesome game-play and AI, although each one is a bit repetitive.  Other than the details and guns available, the story followed the same general plot line for each of them.  Still a great game and a worthy buy for sure.

Out of all the remastered collections, the Uncharted collection would seem like a pointless purchase, if you've already played them all.  Yet all of Nate's adventures are worth more than one revisit, which makes this a great title to own.  The updated visuals give the titles a clean look to go with newer TVs, is only an added bonus to the already great package you're getting.

Gameplay is not that good but nothing actually offensive. Every time I felt the game was being stupid with difficulty spikes, its always been my own fault for not noticing something. Remaster is pretty good and writing is top notch.

The best remaster of all time. Three great games in one. The HD on the PS4 makes the old versions looks, well old. Of course the stories are amazing as always. The only downside is glitches throughout the game.

I had never played any of the Drake games until this collection came out and it was one of the first games I picked up when I purchased a PS4 (I had a PSOne, PS2, and PS3 but never played the Drake games).

I never played Uncharted before.  As an Xbox 360 owner, I have  played Tomb Raider series. In comparison, experience with Uncharted is very similar. All three games are amazing: great story, nice graphic, lovable characters. Uncharted 3 is the best title in this collection. Drake's Fortune and Among Thieves feel bit dated but playability isn't affected.  Both games are highly addictive and you just can't stop playing.

If you want to get into Uncharted, this is where you start. Even though every of the three installments is very linear and repetitive, the story and characters are very well written and offer you an amazing experience.

Una excelente recopilacion de la saga Uncharted, para aquellos que no han podido disfrutar de esta joya en ps3. un juego dedicado a la accion pura y dura, con una historia simple, pero atrapante, donde la jugabilidad y la espectacularidad se combinan!

Great collection of three great games, each of which has unique features and very interesting. Uncharted is the king of action-adventure! Thanks to the creators of such a great series of games! Recommend!
Lebilincselő akció, csodás grafika és még csodásabb tájak, mélyen és erőteljesen kidolgozott karakterek mind kinézet, mind pedig jellem terén, igazi kalandfilmes sztori, jól kidolgozott irányítással.

A melhor coletânea de Remasters pro PS4 até agora, não bastando apenas reviver a melhor franquia do PS3, mas melhorando (e muito) os gráficos, mantendo a essência do gameplay com poucas alterações e com uma dublagem nos 3 jogos que eu considero boa. Pra quem não teve um PlayStation 3 e passou direto para o PlayStation 4 e quer uma franquia exclusiva de peso, essa coletânea é compra certa.

One of the reasons i finally broke down and bought a playstation was to see all the fuss about Uncharted.  Yeah for once the fuss was true. Nathan Drake and his band o merry cohorts make this one of the greatest collections of games ever assembled. The remasters PS4 versions are glorious and worth the buy. Top notch story telling, action gaming and incredible visuals add up to a masterpiece.

Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection is a remastered compilation of the action-adventure shooter platform video games Uncharted: Drake's Fortune, Uncharted 2: Among Thieves and Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception. Ported by Bluepoint Games, the collection was released in 2015.
Just finished Uncharted 2 and all I can think Is; "Why haven't I played these before?". On to the review!
Heard so much about Unchartered and it is a good game. Perhaps, I should have played it at the time of their release. Still enjoyable but controls are a bit clanky 8/10.

Three excellent games together and remastered. For anyone who not has ever had a playstation 3 is perfect. I would venture to say that they are 3 of the best games of the last years. Mandatory to play before Uncharted 4. I can say that it is the beginning and the middle of the best series of action / adventure video games to date.

This remaster of the first 3 Uncharted Games is Amazing. I have never played the original on PS3 but always wanted to. Now with this Collection pack i was amazed at how great these games were. If you haven't played any of the first 3 games yet on PS3, make sure to pick this game up. I give this game a 10/10

title: Under Night In-Birth Exe:Late[st]
summary: The best parts of Street Fighter and BlazBlue combine in this epic 2D fighter! Easy to pick up but filled with tactical depth that will have you playing for years, Under Night In-Birth Exe:Late[st] is the frantic new fighter from the maker of cult-classic Melty Blood -- and the hit underground Japanese brawler that has captured both the imagination and hearts of the fighting game community.
reviews: When it’s all said and done Under Night as a whole is a great fighting game. Although, I d have a small issues with the $49.99 price tag when the previous version was only half of that. With the [st] version out with new fighters, new mechanics, and a much needed full tutorial with challenge modes it makes this the best version yet. I highly suggest checking this game out for hardcore fans of the fighting game genre. It’s fast, fun, complex, and very stylish. If you’re not that big into fighting games, you may want to look elsewhere. This has the potential to be an easy to learn game, but it will take a lot of patience and practice to hold your own online.
Exe:Late[st] takes the delicious Under Night cake and adds an entire extra layer of your favorite flavor, plus the garnishes and decorative frosting to make it stand out again, 3 years later.

Under Night In-Birth Exe:Late[st] is a sublime fighting game, with a lot of content to enjoy, a varied gameplay and a generous roster. The graphics show their age, but the art direction is still pretty unique. Despite the fact that several fighting games were released in the past few weeks, this one should be on top of your list.

This title improves where it predecessor failed, including new game modes that teach the fundamental mechanics and movements to learn to play and improving playability with new techniques making the title quite accessible from newbies to veterans. With four new characters, reaching 20 in total, and quite extras and game modes to play, this title becomes an interesting option in the genre.
A great choice for those who seek a 2D "anime" fighting game. Under Night in-Birth Exe contains both great content and excellent combat system.
With stylish combat, a ton of game modes and fun combat, UNDER NIGHT IN-BIRTH Exe:Late[st] is a blast, especially online with friends.

Under Night In-Birth EXE: Late{st} is a fighting game that deserves to be played but will inevitably be overshadowed by its competition. It’s a shame because its $50 price tag is worth it for the tutorial alone.
If you're looking for a new arena for on-screen violence, this is well worth your money. [March 2018, p.85]
